story:
Most of you that know us by now know that we sacrifice a lot to do what we do… You would also know that we have a lot on our plate coming up in the next few weeks in terms of national tour dates and traveling.

Every tour we have been on so far we have crammed inside Evan's FJ Cruiser along with gear and luggage. If you looked up clown car in the dictionary you would probably see a picture of us traveling to a gig. This method has worked for us at the cost of blowing tires due to excessive weight, spending gig money on hotels, limited merch and supplies and overall crammed riding conditions for very long periods of time.

Each member of the band is going through the very common paycheck to paycheck way of life. We still no matter what put every dime we make in BFV right back into BFV to buy things like cds and more desirable merchandise. More often than not we spend our own personal money getting to gigs, chipping in to complete tshirt orders, rent for a practice studio, wear and tear on equipment and every other little thing it takes to keep the ball rolling.

We all have a passion for music and simply won't stop following our dreams until we no longer have a choice. We are all in and ready to take BFV as far as it can possibly go.

This is where YOU our Friends and Fans come into play.. With our current lack of money situation and Evans car (tour vehicle) getting beat to the ground we need help. We are not asking for donations for beer money or other BS. We are asking for your help to purchase a safe reliable tour vehicle that we can use to grow as a band.

In the next 8 weeks we are playing a date on Warped Tour in St Pete FL, Rockstar Energy Mayhem Festival in GA, Summer Slaughter in TN and a 2 week tour run Co-headlining for Rise Records Exotype. Thats not including the 4500 miles we are doing in September.

We are trying to make some of our donation incentives a little more personal and will also try to give you 110% worth of your prize incentives.

Thank you for reading and thank you to the fans and friends that have given us this opportunity to get us where we are! \m/

If you are mobile, Click the little arrow "<" to see our perks to offer.

story:
Hallo zusammen,

mein Name ist Sven Ernst, ich bin 2. Vorsitzender der Organisation for Strategic Development in Africa (OSDA e.V.), und bitte Sie darum, uns mit einem finanziellen Beitrag bei unserer Arbeit zu unterstützen.

Wir von OSDA e.V. wollen unserer Freundin, Kollegin und ausgebildeten südafrikanischen Vorschullehrerin Lebo ermöglichen, sich ehrenamtlich in der IGS Wedemark und dem MTV zu engagieren und somit zum interkulturellen Austausch direkt beizutragen.

Wir sind davon überzeugt, dass wir ein Teil einer globalen Weltgemeinschaft sind und gemeinsam in einer Welt der Vielfalt leben. Dabei unterscheiden wir uns von anderen Nationen in unseren Traditionen, unserer Sprache, unseren kulinarischen Spezialitäten, unserer Identität – ganz allgemein gesagt durch unsere Kultur. Doch wäre es tragisch diese Unterschiede als Grund der Abgrenzung zu verstehen. ODSA e.V. will viel mehr dazu beitragen unterschiedliche Kulturen als Anlass zum kulturellen Austausch zu verstehen, denn Mul­ti­kul­tu­ra­li­tät bedeutet ein Stück Lebensqualität. Mit Ihrer Spende können Sie dazu beitragen, dass der Schulalltag der integrierten Gesamtschule noch ein kleines Stückchen abwechslungsreicher, interessanter, bunter gestaltet wird. Dabei bereichern Sie sowohl die interkulturellen Erfahrungen der Kinder und Jugendlichen  aus Wedemark, als auch den Erlebnishorizont der 22 jährigen Lebo, die sich wahnsinnig darauf freut, Deutschland und Europa im Allgemeinen näher kennen zu lernen.


Lebo engagiert sich bereits seit Gründung unseres Partnerprojektes in Südafrika in dem Briardene Youth Center, welches mit Hilfe von durch unseren Verein gesammelten Privatspenden mitfinanziert wird. Dieses gründete ich 2013 zusammen mit einem motivierten Team aus lokalen Freiwilligen. Da ich selbst das  bereichernde Erlebnis hatte in Südafrika zu leben und mich in der lokalen Gemeinde einzubringen, ist es mir persönlich ein großes Anliegen diesen Austausch dieses Jahr bei uns in Deutschland fortzuführen. Auf Grund großer finanzieller Unterstützung des Bundes Freiwilligen Dienstes wird es glücklicher Weise im August dieses Jahres passieren, dass Lebo also für 12 Monate in die Wedemark kommen kann. Dennoch müssen wir von OSDA einen Eigenbeitrag von 5500€ aufbringen, um Lebo den Flug, Versicherung, diverse pädagogische Seminare, einen Deutschkurs und ein „Taschengeld“ von 300€ pro Monat zur ermöglichen, da sie als Freiwillige sich Vollzeit kostenlos engagieren wird.

Ich hoffe wir konnten euch für Lebo gewinnen. Bitte unterstützt uns.

Gemeinsam schaffen wir das große Ziel für Lebo die IGS Wedemark und dem MTV, gemeinsam sind wir stark.

Ihr habt noch Fragen? Bitte kontaktiert mich per Kommentar oder per 

email: sven@osdaev.org

Mit freudlichem Gruß

Sven Ernst

story:
Austin Musicians and WOBEON

WOBEON is back in September 2015 to bring you the third edition of the Austin World Music Festival.  As in previous years, the festival spotlights both local Austin talent and touring artists spanning different countries and musical genres.  This year's highlights include a new Jazz Fusion program.

WobeonFest Website     |    WobeonFest 2015 Facebook Page

Most importantly, we are launching this crowd-sourced fund to support and promote local Austin musicians to showcase their talents.  We need your support with this initiative.

Why Contribute?

While most festivals offer a low or no fee to local talent to perform in festivals, we at WOBEON have always believed that Austin musicians deserve better.  However, in order to continue to pay local artists generously, we need your support because festival economics (given our ticket-pricing and fiscal sponsorship realities) do not allow us to do as much as we would like to and to showcase more Austin talent.

Help us raise $4,000 to fund 4 local Austin bands at WobeonFest 2015.

All the money raised from this campaign will go directly to these local artists. If we raise more, then we will simply feature more local bands at the festival. Every $1000 raised will go towards featuring an additional local band.

WobeonFest Website    |   WobeonFest 2015 Facebook Page

As a token of our appreciation for your contribution, we are offering you t-shirts and tickets to the festival.  See "perks" for more details.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Come to WobeonFest and invite your friends!
  • Become a sponsor of WobeonFest, and bring visibility to your organization, cause or brand.
  • Share our work with potential sponsors
  • Volunteer at WobeonFest and attend the event for free
  • Help us spread the word!  Tweet, Post & Share, Email, and Talk about us
  • Continue to send us your good vibes.  We feel them; we appreciate them.
  • Support the wonderful year-round work done by our various sponsors and partners.
  • For more info, please email wobeon15 (at) wobeon (dot) com

Thank you for your attention.  See you at the fest.

Let's do this! 

WobeonFest Website    |   WobeonFest 2015 Facebook Page

story:
Who & What Exactly Are We?

Hi Guys - Nell, Mark & Steve here of Danze Macabre. 

Firstly we just want to thank you so much for taking time to view our Indiegogo campaign - you ROCKSTARS! Before we explain our campaign to you, let us tell you a little bit about ourselves. 

Danze Macabre is a female fronted classic/melodic rock band hailing from the New Forest, England, UK. Song writing twins Mark (guitar) & Steve (bass) Owers (formally of 'Lionsheart' & 'The Psychics') teamed up with classically trained vocalist Nell Montague-Rendall whilst working on a different project in 2014. Upon listening to a playback of some recordings, it became clear to the twins that this was the voice they had been looking for. The voice to help deliver their unique brand of powerful yet melodic rock in the right way - the BEST way. After a short discussion with the band's now music publisher and manager, Danze Macabre was born! The band has come a long way in a very short time; working in the studio on their début album, releasing their first music video 'Jamaica Inn', organising the singles official download release date - and now creating this very special Indiegogo campaign! Take a look at some extra special 'Making of' features under the 'Gallery' page.

What Are We Doing?

We need your help to create our next music video for our self-titled track 'Danze Macabre', and put the finishing touches to our début album.

Once again, we have teamed up with the creative crew from our first music video 'Jamaica Inn' to bring you an exciting, dark, gothic tale of a young woman who attends a glamorous masked ball where all is not quite as it seems. Think along the lines of the cult films 'Eyes Wide Shut' and 'Rosemary's Baby'. 

To give you an idea of our vision, take a look at a few of our creative ideas (photo source: www.pinterest.com):

                    

What We Need & What You Get

We need £20,000 of your hard earned dough to make this music video and album everything we want it to be. This will help us fund production costs for the video, which includes a fantastic location, wonderful creative team, gorgeous period costumes, hair & makeup, set design & props, and additional studio time we need to finish the album.

"Nothing in this life comes for free" - so we have some rather exciting 'perks' in store for you all:

  • We have created a fabulous Danze Macabre 4 track EP exclusively for you Indiegogo-ers. Get a digital version for just £10, or a limited edition singed copy for £25.
  • Get a special 'Thanks' on Facebook + a download of our first single 'Jamaica Inn' for £5, or....spend a teeny bit more for a 'Postcard' with a message from the band (+ 'Jamaica Inn' download) for £7.
  • £25 gets you our EP download + an official Danze Macabre T-shirt.....who doesn't like a bit of good ol' band merch!!
  • Danze Macabre Packages (limited) - our Basic package gets you all the above PLUS a hand written lyric sheet of our track 'Danze Macabre' for £180. Our Ultimate package gets you ALL the above, PLUS a special mention on our debut album sleeve for £250.
You don't even need  to buy a perk - you can simply contribute whatever you can afford. Seriously, if you can only donate £1, that gets us that little bit closer to pursuing our dream!

Other Ways You Can Help

Words cannot describe our gratitude for helping us create this platform to share our music with you all. We thank you for taking time to read our campaign, and we hope you can help us with this exciting adventure.

Please help us spread all things Danze Macabre far and wide by using the Indiegogo share tools! Don't forget to Like us on Facebook and Follow us on Twitter, for band updates. Want to know official Danze Macabre news before anybody else? - Join our Mailing List HERE.

Many thanks again - without your support, this simply couldn't happen!

Nell, Mark & Steve - DANZE MACABRE

story:
Who Am I?

My name is Ulises Rodríguez Palada. I work as a public ELL teacher in the Southwest suburbs of the Twin Cities. I have a Master’s Degree in Teaching from the School of International Training in Vermont, a K-12 ELL license from Hamline University, and a Bachelor’s of Arts in Foreign Languages from the National University of Honduras. My professional areas of interest include second language and multicultural education, youth mentoring, and multicultural music education. In my free time, I like to play guitar, play soccer, ride my bike, read, and spend time with my family. Playing guitar plays an important role in my life. It relaxes me, brings joy to my busy life, and keeps me away from unhealthy distractions.  


Campaign Name: Guitars Over Cell Phones

Description

Today, many teens spend too much time on their cell phones. According to the Kaiser Family Foundation study (2010), “Kids and teens ages 8 to 18 spend seven-and-a-half hours a day, seven days a week, engaging with media, more time than they spend with any other activity besides sleeping.” As a public school teacher and a parent, I see this trend as a serious problem that is negatively affecting the socio-emotional skills of our youth. This issue encouraged me to take action and and create MUFFASA. MUFFASAstands for Music Unites Friends Families And Schools Association. It is a multicultural music education and youth mentoring project created by Ulises Rodriguez Palada and a group of parents from the Chaska-Shakopee area in Minnesota, United States. The program will be funded through fundraising activities like this, grants, and generous donations. For more information about our program, please visit www.muffasa.org 

One of the goals of this campaign is to provide selected kids with an opportunity to reduce their cell phone use and instead invest that time in a more productive activity, such as playing guitar. Research has shown the tremendous benefits that playing a musical instrument provides. Some benefits include the improvement of cognitive, emotional, cultural, and academic skills. 


What are the Objectives of this Campaign?

At the end of the 2015 - 2016 academic school year, selected students for the project will be able to:

* Learn the basic skills to play guitar.

* Improve their socio-emotional skills.

* Increase their engagement in school.

*  Improve their academic performance.

* Reduce their dependency on electronics.


Who is Going to be Benefited from this Project?

Fifteen students grades 6 - 12 from the Chaska-Shakopee area who demonstrate outstanding ability, interest, and discipline to play acoustic guitar. Priority will be given to underrepresented students and those kids who have a lot of musical potential, but are struggling to put their cell phones down.  


Timeline

Selected students will receive a gently-used guitar and weekly beginning guitar lessons from Mr. Rodriguez Palada. Classes will be one hour and fifteen minutes long and will be offered at one of the schools in the Chaska-Shakopee area. Sessions will go from October, 2015  to March,  2016. At the end of the program, students will plan and perform a guitar concert for their community. 


What I Need 

I need to raise funds to buy gently-used guitars, rent a classroom, and cover for instruction expenses. All the money raised from the campaign will be used to cover the following:

October 2015 – March 2016 Budget

Item

Description

15 gently-used guitars and guitar cases

$ 1,500.00

Classroom rent

$ 1,500.00

Guitar instructor

$ 6,000.00

Indigogo fee

$ 500.00

Total

$ 9,500.00

If I don't reach my entire fundraising goal, I will still offer the guitar and mentoring lessons; On the other hand,  if my fundraising campaign exceeds its funding goal, I will buy more guitars, offer more lessons and reach out to new students.


Challenges

One of the challenges that I might face on the way to achieving my goal is not being able to raise all the funds I need for my project. Some of the activities I plan to do to solve these challenges are do more fund-raising activities such as sell t-shirts, organize a concert, garage sales, sell cookies, etc. or offer my teaching and mentoring services as a volunteer.   


Conclusion

Many teens are spending too much time on their electronics. This project aims to reduce that dependency and provide them with the opportunity of doing something more productive and rewarding, such as playing guitar.  


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially to my project, I would truly appreciate if you could get the word out and share the link of my campaign with your contacts or other individuals and organizations who you think may be interested in supporting it. 

Thank you so much for your help!
Ulises Rodríguez Palada

Guitar instructor


$ 6,000.00




Indigogo fee


$ 500.00




Total


$
  9,500.00






If I don't reach my entire fundraising goal, I will still offer the guitar and mentoring lessons; On the other hand,  if my fundraising campaign exceeds its funding goal, I will buy more guitars, offer more lessons and reach out to new students.



Challenges

 One of the challenges that I might face on the way to achieving my goal is not being able to raise all the funds I need for my project. Some of the activities I plan to do to solve these challenges are do more fund-raising activities such as sell t-shirts, organize a concert, garage sales, sell cookies, etc. or offer my teaching and mentoring services as a volunteer.   



Conclusion

Many
teens are spending too much time on their electronics. This project aims to reduce
that dependency and provide them with the opportunity of doing something more
productive and rewarding, such as playing guitar.  

   Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute financially to my project, I would truly appreciate if you could get the word out and share the link of my campaign with your contacts or other individuals and organizations who you think may be interested in supporting it. 
Thank you so much for your help!
Ulises Rodríguez Palada

story:
Who is Solomon Jaye?

My name is Solomon Jaye and I'm a musi-holic. I’ve been so honored to open stages for Pop Star, Robin Thicke and LMFAO. I’ve played sets in Las Vegas at the Palms, Rio, Gibson Showrooms. I performed live with Pentatonix (from NBC’s Sing-Off). I did all this with a group called "The Edge Effect". I co-wrote for them the album, 'Alphabet Radio' which received Grammy consideration. I’m so excited to finally launch my first, major solo project. 

What is 'Ordinary Man'?

‘Ordinary Man’ is the culmination of my time living in New York working an AWFUL telemarketing job, falling in and out of love, and just trying to make something out of everyday existence.

Musically, this album is a tribute to my appreciation of 60s and 70s music (“real” music with “real” musicians and singers). Each song features all live instruments and pays homage in its own way while holding onto a contemporary sensibility. I took every ounce of me and poured it into something I can share. Raw, candid emotion. Not for fame and superstardom, but for you to listen and say “wow… I felt that.” This album is about life, love, happiness, and pain. 

For the last 11 months, I've been working with an amazing team that believed in my work. Grammy Award winning engineer Clark Germain, producer Jamey Tate (Al Jarreau, Mindi Abair, David Benoit, David Pack), keyboards by Jeff Babko (“Jimmy Kimmel Live,” Frank Ocean, Jason Mraz), guitars by Justin Smith (“Mad Men,” “Wicked,” “Book of Mormon,” LA Philharmonic), bass by David Hughes (David Benoit, Chaka Khan, Melissa Etheridge) and drums by Jamey Tate. Thanks to them and the mental support of my friends, family, and fans, the project is in the final stages.

I now have the right experience and contacts to spread my music around the world. I just need the finished product to do it.

Of the $2000...

  • $1000 will go towards remaining production fees
  • $1000 will go towards mixing & mastering by Gavin Lurssen (he mastered the song "Happy" by Pharrell, and countless other hits). This balances the levels of all the individual recordings and brings them to "radio quality"
  • After that, I'll continue working hard to mass produce this product and present it to the world!

So far, I’ve spent about $10,000 out of pocket on this project and it has been worth EVERY penny. You can do a lot yourself, but I know sometimes is takes more than just me. I’m now in the final stretch of the process and need your support to cross the finish line. 

Perks and Perks

I’ve got some awesome perks for you to enjoy when you contribute including a day with me and a guitar on South Beach, and lots more.  All contributors to this campaign will receive an advanced copy of the first album single. This is your chance to receive your advanced music and start listening to what you helped create!  Whatever fits into your budget will help! *If 7+ people contribute  to select the "A Song For You" package, I'll release a separate EP of those stories exclusively for all contributors.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute but you’d like to help you can.  

•Please spread the word about this campaign and my music! Use share tools on this page. 

•Sign up for my newsletter (at www.SolomonJaye.com) to get free music and news from me. 

•Like me on Facebook.com/SJmusic

Thank you so much and I look forward to sharing this music with you!

Solomon Jaye

story:
Introductory Note:

Hello, I am Vishna Shorova-Angelova, Director of Dom na Mladi.

For the past four years, I was responsible for professional management of projects I was assigned in the local Municipality. In December 2013, the Mayor appointed me, Director, of Dom na Mladi (House of Youth) in Stip, Macedonia.  

My first responsibility was to watch over completion of the urgent repairs required for the physical facility. I did so, using local funds and by securing Grant funds from a Swiss agency. We completed repairs, according to stipulations, in December 2014.  

Now, I am responsible to create and administer this Crowd Funding Campaign, on Indiegogo. Our purpose is to raise funds to purchase sound and light show equipment. With this equipment installed, DNM will generate income and achieve sustainability. Next, with income generated from music festivals, concerts, and gigs, DNM will expand its programing across a full spectrum of the Arts!

I want to thank US Peace Corps, Macedonia for responding positively to my request for a Community Development Volunteer to join our Staff. As you know, Peace Corps Volunteers serve only in countries where they are invited. The three Peace Corps goals encompass development of mutual understanding and friendship and to strengthen Staff with specialized skills a Volunteer might bring to the work. When Community Development Volunteer, Jim Willis, joined our Staff-Team, in January 2015, I directed him to assist us with strategic planning and writing skills. The text below is one example of how he supports us in our work. Thank you, Jim.


Broad grassroots support drives this project. And, it is promoted by both local and national government. Your donations will be deposited in a special bank account at the national level and administered by the Director of DNM and the Mayor of Stip. The acquisition of professional sound & light show equipment is the next step in DNM’s strategic plan. With this equipment in place, DNM immediately becomes sustainable and self-supporting of its continued operation and future expansions of programming.

Resurrecting DNM is truly worthy of your support. This project will be successful and it already has traction. I count myself grateful to be a part of this community effort. I ask you to join too.


What is Dom na Mladi? 

Dom na Mladi (DNM) means “House of Youth” in Macedonian language. DNM is located in Stip, Macedonia, a town of approximately fifty-five thousand residents, which is also home to a significant, National University and Music Academy. The town’s location----in east-central Macedonia----is approximately one hour and fifteen minutes, by car, southeast from the capital city, Skopje.

DNM is a government organization operating from within the Stip Municipality. The Municipality provides basic, operating funds (for utilities and maintenance) and employee salaries are supported through the National Minister of Culture. In April 2015, the national government approved funding to hire six new employees, who bring skills necessary to realize DNM’s “Vision.”

The building and grounds are a unique assembly of irreplaceable elements, situated half way up Isar Hill, which is near the center of town. Atop Isar are the ruins of an ancient fortress which amplifies the “presence” of this dramatic scene. The DNM building contains a concert hall (200 to 300 people) with an elevated stage, a bar, a large adjacent room for multipurpose uses, three office spaces and three areas appropriate for classrooms and training. The grounds consist of an outdoor amphitheater (1000 to 1200 people); an additional out-building; two open-air bars; and performance areas terraced on two levels. An enormous, steel-structured “Umbrella” shelters the outdoor stage from weather and also functions to symbolize the “Spirit” of DNM. The “Umbrella,” is the official DNM Logo. As one can see from the photographs, the “Umbrella,” also symbolizes DNM’s current need for infrastructure improvement.

Historically, Stip----where DNM is located---- has always been known as a town hungry for music and the Arts. Approximately eight years ago, the national government designated Stip to be the home to a new, national university. This university in Stip became significant in a very short time. It now enrolls nearly fifteen thousand domestic and international students. DNM will become an integral part of the "town/gown" relationships here as this community, at-large, continues to blossom.

New highway construction----to be completed next year----will put Stip just 45 minutes from the National Airport located in the capital city, Skopje. Because of its location, Stip is already the eastern transportation hub. One of five high schools in Stip is dedicated solely to music. Local professors and working artists are abundant here; they will propel high-quality "after school" mentoring across a spectrum of the Arts.




Brief History

When Macedonia was a part of Yugoslavia, this facility provided dining, housing, sports, and entertainment for military officers. The public gathered here too. Throughout the community, DNM was known as “the place” to go in the evening to relax, enjoy a drink, listen to live music, and dance. When Macedonia became independent, the national government remodeled DNM and used this facility as a music-center for youth in the region. The music center flourished. For several decades, DNM enjoyed its reputation for being the “happening place” for Rock, Blues, Jazz and Underground music across the Balkans. Many artists wanted to perform at DNM because they knew the people of Stip were a special audience that genuinely understood and appreciated high-quality music of all kinds.

The best bands played here; as did many European and International Artists. When spoken, the words “Dom na Mladi” still engender pride across generations, who remember, fondly, their experiences during its “heyday.” The phrase “I will meet you at the Umbrella,” continues to evoke elation and wonder about the not too distant past, when so many creative accomplishments were happening here.

When Macedonia made the wise decision to create a center for youth, in Stip, their decision rippled across the Balkans. People began to notice; large crowds of young people attended performances here. By demonstrating the power of music to engage youth around high values and common purposes (when they have a special place) DNM put Stip on the map!

As you know, Macedonia became an independent Democratic Republic in 1991. Start-up is never easy. Because unemployment is high, many youth need to leave Macedonia to earn a living in other countries. Strategically, this trend must be reversed. It is true for all peoples that the future of one's country rests in the hands, hearts, and minds of its young. The youth of Macedonia know the future of their Republic rests in their hands. They know they need to “lift their country up by its own bootstraps.” Spirit, hope, passion and perseverance are four key energies that drive accomplishment of a challenge----this large!  So, this project to revitalize DNM goes straight to the heart of the matter.




Rationale for the Project

We all know that shared-music and the Arts have the power to reach across social divisions to lift a community as one. And, we know from experience how important music is to each succeeding generation. By co-creating and sharing their distinctive “voices,” new generations establish shared identities, around which youthful energies take vital form. The very presence of DNM makes a clear statement to youth: “All of you are important to all of us; you are the future; we want you to do well.” 

A youth-center dedicated to music and the Arts, provides an especially effective way to connect youth with their peers. Through these connections, youth discover who they are at a level deeper than mere personality. They find purpose and build common grounds. 




Recent History 

After Macedonia became an independent Democratic Republic, enormous needs and scarce funds led to gradual, physical deterioration of DNM. In 2013, repair became urgent. The fate of DNM was at choice point. The Mayor convened several public meetings, in 2013, and the community decided to restore and revitalize DNM. A Swiss agency granted money to the “Repair Project” and these repairs were completed in December, 2014. 

The purpose of this current Indiegogo Crowd-Funding project, to raise funds to purchase sound and light-show equipment, which is the next step in the strategic plan. By holding concerts, festivals, and gigs throughout the year, DNM will support itself and continue its development. Programming will expand beyond music to include "after school" workshops, exhibitions, and performances across a full spectrum of the Arts! 




What Are DNM’s Goals?

DNM’s Campaign goal is to raise at least 70k US Dollars. This number is based on research of what it would cost to purchase the components necessary to install a basically adequate professional-grade sound and light-show system in the Concert Hall of Dom na Mladi.

If campaign donations do not reach the funding- goal: DNM will purchase what equipment they can with the funds they raised in the order of listed priorities.

If campaign donations exceed the funding-goal, DNM would decide among the following priorities:

1. To purchase a more comprehensive sound and light show system for the Concert Hall, that could include acoustic engineering.

2. To restore the grounds and the Umbrella in the Amphitheater at DNM.

3. To preserve the history and equip the Bistro-like room (adjacent to the Concert Hall) as a multipurpose “hang-out” for youth: historic restoration/repair; small stage for gigs; sound & lighting system; Big-Screen TV Monitor; Wi-Fi for laptops; Bistro furnishings; and upgraded coffee/bar area.

4. To purchase furniture and educational technology for classrooms to conduct mentoring in “after-school” programs across a full-spectrum of the Arts.




What Are the Risks and Challenges?

The obstacles to manifestation of the DNM "Vision" are common to all young republics. Systemically, Macedonia is in the process of finding itself; forming its identity; forging unity in diversity; developing its economy; establishing the rules of law; and, systematizing its internal processes. At the global level, Macedonia may or may not become a member of the European Union. The effects would be dramatic and they are unpredictable.

At the community level, the obstacles and the opportunities are more apparent. Right now, Dom na Mladi is like a gourmet restaurant without a kitchen! The menus are printed, the tables are set, and customers line the sidewalks, clamoring to get in. With sound and light-show equipment in place, DNM will rocket to success.



Summary

By donating to this project, you become the "wind beneath their wings." A breeze from you----at this critical time----is a difference that will make a difference in the positive future of Macedonia. Some call it the "Butterfly Effect." We are all part of the greater whole. All peoples, all countries, and all children are our own. Your donation to this project is an assertion proclaiming the highest Good, for all.

By acting now to support this project, you become a fact in the concrete history of what Macedonia will become. It is the small things people do together that result in profound accomplishments and the reason it is possible that one person can change the world for the better. Please know your generosity will be felt and recorded in the eternal unfolding of the whole. Your support will ripple forward through decades to come.

Youth, parents, grandparents and extended families will celebrate your generosity. One can watch what DNM does with the donation you provide by regularly checking DNM’s official web-site www.domnamladi.com & FB page Дом на млади Штип.




Conclusion

So, I ask “Will you place your donation, whatever you can, “under the Umbrella” at Dom na Mladi, Stip?” I recommend this project wholeheartedly and as enthusiastically as I can.

I also ask that you share this “link” with your family, friends, Facebook Friends, colleagues at work, and social groups, churches and professional organizations to which you may belong.  Your help “spreading the word” about this project is critical to the success of this campaign. Pooling resources through Crowd-Funding can accomplish amazing results.   

Thank you.



NOTE TO BE CLEAR: 

This fundraising campaign – and any funds generated from private contributors - is the sole responsibility of Dom Na Mladi.  Peace Corps Volunteer Jim Willis and Peace Corps Macedonia accept no responsibility for the use of the funds raised in this campaign.

story:
I need help to promote my new Album 'Ain't Supposed To Be Here' Properly.

With your help I really believe that we can reach a lot of people who are lost with this album! I believe that this is the best body of work the LORD has ever allowed me to be a part of and I truly believe that it is anointed to break chains and destroy yokes!

The money raised is going toward helping me to market the album on various websites and shoot videos to "Come Home' which I believe is the most anointed song I have ever been blessed to be a part of and "Winning" which has been an encouragement to many people since this album was released in June! 

Though I am currently working on some new music for you guys, I truly believe in my heart that the LORD really wants me to continue to push this album and get it into as many hands and ears as possible. With your help we can make this a reality! 

Thanks in advance for your prayers and your contributions. I pray that the LORD will bing you back a 100 fold blessing in JESUS Name!!!!!

story:
Visit us on Facebook

Visit us on Twitter


HELP BRING THE MAJORS FOR MINORS "ADVENTURES IN WAVEWORLD" ANIMATED CHILDRENS SHOW TO LIFE AND RECEIVE LIMITED EDITION PERKS FROM THE ORIGINAL MUSIC SERIES

The Majors for Minors children's music series has sold in excess of 575000 copies (10 X Platinum) in South Africa alone making it the biggest selling children's music title ever in that market. Featured on CNN and endorsed by professionals worldwide, Majors for Minors is now taking their brand global and into the digital age with an interactive mobile app and the development and production of a new animated children's series. The series will focus on the history of popular music culture as discovered by the vibrant and colorful inhabitants of  a magical musical wonderland - Waveworld. Introducing eager young minds to some of music history's greatest icons and most memorable melodies recreated within the context of Waveworld, the series stands to be groundbreaking in the field of children's development and entertainment content. Music has always defined the key moments of our lives, it has often defined a generation on the landscape of history, NOW afford future generations the opportunity to discover the joy from within this musical treasure chest. Music is love and there is no greater gift for a child than love. Give the children of the world this gift and benefit from our generous perks which include selected and unlimited download packages, limited edition CD box sets, contributor and production credits and more.

Funding will be used to complete the production of the pilot episode which will be mass distributed via the web for support and feedback. The intention is to develop the concept  into a regular web series and later syndicate to childrens TV networks.

THE ORIGINAL MAJORS FOR MINORS MUSIC SERIES

View our full catalogue here

We have carried out a great deal of research into understanding how certain types of classical music stimulates brain development. Through understanding the process involved, we went on to develop our own “UNIQUE FORMULA” consisting of a number of “key ingredients” that, effectively used together, produces this special series of classical music.

"When a baby comes into this world her brain is a jumble of neurons all waiting to be woven into the intricate tapestry of the mind” –Sharon Begley, Newsweek.

There are specific periods in your childs life when neurological pathways in the brain need to be stimulated, or they will “literally fade away”. Well documented research has demonstrated the positive effect of music on the development and strengthening of patterns in the cortex in the brains of infants and young children. These pathways are the same ones responsible for certain cognitive functions, as well as higher learning such as maths and science.

When children exercise cortical neurons by listening to classical music, they are also strengthening circuits used for mathematics and complex reasoning” – Gordon Shaw, U.C. Irvine.

PROFESSIONAL OPINION

Dr Annette Lotter (BA-Ed, B-Ed, M-Ed, D-Ed (RAU), Organisational Specialist (SHL) conducted direct research with Majors for Minors music and reported that the music helped to reduce hyperactivity and sleep disorders in babies and children. Some of her latest research has shown improved attention, concentration and handwriting in children, as well as children being weaned off prescription stimulants and depressants.

WHAT PEOPLE SAY ABOUT US

My wife and I bought six Majors for Minors CD's for our three children ages two seven and nine. The benefits have been superb and we truly recommend this music.
- Dale and Jill Evans (Sydney NSW Australia)

Who would have thought that the answer to my prayers would have come in the form of music? I battled for ages trying to get my twin boys to sleep at the same time. Bingo! The Majors for Minors Symphony of Sleep CD which I received as a gift was staring at me one evening when I opened the closet. Since I've been playing the music I get both boys sleeping at least 80% of the time – Thanks you
- Morgan Dixon (Woodland Hills, Los Angeles, CAL, USA)

My Daughter loves this Majors for Minors CD because it calms her every night. Since we have been playing it her sleep time has lengthened. When she wakes up she quietly plays in her crib whilst listening to her CD. A must have for all parents and children. (We enjoy listening to it on her baby monitor too.)
- Nena Roberts (New Jersey, USA)

Used to play the Classical Music Lullabies to myself while pregnant (No Joke!) and I have used it for Liam. It is great chilled music and the lullabies are classics.
- Lisl van der Westhuizen (South Africa)

As a nursery school teacher I have always believed in the benefits of classical music. Majors for Minors have a superb range which I use to keep my little ones focused during activities. The music is also extremely helpful at naptime.
- Elize Botha (Pretoria, South Africa)

WWW.MAJORSFORMINORS.COM

story:
Thank you for visiting our Indiegogo campaign! We are thrilled to share with you our self-titled EP that will be released on April 7th, 2015. We hope you are enjoying our latest single, “Best of Me” that is catching the attention of fans, radio stations, and social media networks! 

Just to recap our story, we are a band from a small town in southwestern Indiana that set out to do one thing…Make music that ignites the flame of emotions and positive energy that we all seek in our daily lives. We began to assemble our vision in September 2014 in which we laid the ground work for a handful of songs that would eventually become the foundation of Haven Fire’s sound. With a collection of songs, but with no singer, we sought the talents of Tennessee native and former Wake the Light singer TJay Tipps to lend vocals to compliment the band’s sound and energy. Our band is set to release its self-titled EP that was produced by Keith Wallen (former Adelitas Way and current Breaking Benjamin guitarist) and Jasen Rauch (former RED and current Breaking Benjamin guitarist). 



Since day one we have been self-funded and do it yourself which hasn't come easy, but there are still hurdles to overcome. Fan interaction is the key to not only our future in music but to the success of our communities and the local independent music scene. With your help you will not only be helping Haven Fire make name for itself in the ever changing music scene, but you will bring exposure to businesses and musicians that have supported this band from day one. We are strong supporters of local businesses, independent musicians, independent radio stations, and those who have dedicated their time to helping our vision come to life.  Some of these entities include: Hybrid Audio Solutions, EMURG.com, Lanturn Design, Rock Rage Radio, The Mosh Chasm Podcast, etc. So consider this as a way of funding independent in your own way!

What We Need & What You Get


Haven Fire is set to play shows with the Red Jumpsuit Apparatus, Black Stone Cherry, Joe Nichols, and many more, but in order to accomplish this goal Haven Fire has to travel long distances and pay for radio campaigns to break into new markets.  All the funds contributed to this campaign will go towards bringing Haven Fire to you, the fans! Through this campaign we will offer fans exclusive perks such as signed merchandise, exclusive access and perks for die hard fans of the band, and so much more. If we don't reach our goal, the funds will be invested back into the band to bring you new music, music videos, exclusive offers, and to help bring exposure to those who work so hard to bring the vision of Haven Fire to life outside of its band members. We can't wait to see all of you soon live!

“What started as a spark became a flame, and from that flame spread a fire of passion and beauty”.

story:
Who I Am

Hello All! My full name is Tyler Fox Kittelson (professionally known as Tyler Fox), and I am a budding music producer from Minneapolis, Minnesota. 
My passion is to produce Hip-Hop and Electronic Dance Music full-time. To do that however, it will be necessary to continue to purchase better and more powerful equipment while at the same time growing an online presence and building a solid reputation.

The Simple and Transparent Monetary Breakdown

Where will my money go exactly?

$300 - This will go to the main component of production, the digital audio workstation or DAW for short, known as Fruity Loops Studio Signature Edition. From this website.

$150 - This amount will be invested into a pair of ultra-high quality headphones. The specific ones that suit my music production needs perfectly can be found here.

$50 - A small chunk of the money will be used to help build a professional website for the Tyler Fox brand, where I will be able to sell merchandise, beats, samples and full songs to the public.

Extra Funds - Any and all extra funds raised will go directly into furthering my education about the vast field of Music Production, mainly from online sources.


Why Invest In Me?

First of all I would like to personally thank you for taking the time to read this far, and I hope by now you are at least half-interested in the up-and-coming brand in music production that is Tyler Fox. 

Why should you donate your money?
You will get a chance to be an essential part of the near future as I embark on the journey to success as a professional music producer. Thank you for your contribution, and remember, EVERY cent counts!
-Tyler

story:
...What?

Yes you heard it right. We take the bus. We load it with foreign ensembles from different countries who play any sorts of impro music, from root folklore to noise and from straight-ahead jazz to prog rock. We book over 70 venues on Russian territory in 80 days period, June 12 till August 30, 2015. We buy some snacks and some pillows, and we start for a ride of approximately 15.000 kms one-way.

That was already done in 2013 and 2014 for smaller territory and with bigger fears of everybody involved. We were quite busy trying to stay alive, put ends together with money and, last but not least, to show this music to audience which sometimes had no idea about live music at all (leave alone serious avant-garde stuff). Now we know better how to do it, and we want to show the world how it looks from the inside: so, the movie.

But how?

The movie? If you help to produce it. The tour itself? Lot of sources - embassies, cultural foundations, venues deals, Russian commercial sponsors, society donations. Just be sure it will be done. We're speaking here about the possibility to see the good footage with decent Emglish, German and French subtitles, not about begging you to pay for musicians' meals. We will feed them :)

But who?

Musicians are very different, from 20 years old guys from Denmark who just won the national Jazz Award Prize to wise Frenchmen who can be their grandfathers; from Catalan hurdy-gurdy master to Russian psaltery virtuoso; from Dutch noise-punkers to Swiss jazz academicians who deconstruct George Gershwin. Or would you like US prog-rockers, Chilean ethno jazz or tuba with electronics derectly from Norway? We have it.

And if you meant "but who the hell are YOU", well, we're an independent Russian team of very few people who just devote our lives to make some insane projects with music. Enough to be said that MuzEnergo, the mother festival of the whole idea, is being held in the city of Dubna (population 70.000) from 2007 and since that time presented over 800 musicians from 40 countries here. Hopefully that is illustrative enough.

You can ask why nobody knows of us. Well, musicians know. Embassies know. RUSSIANS know (and since they speak very special ugly language with cyrillic it's quite hard to spread the news to foreigners). We're not that bad here and not only stealing some other countries lands; we're not government; we're NORMAL PEOPLE, sorry for the terms. 

And what if...?

That will be done. Period. The money we try to collect here can make the film better and more accessible to foreign audience. But neither tour itself nor the film as an idea are not at stake. If you help us, you're investing in better production, but with every penny you've invested you can be sure it falls in the right place.

Spread the news if you want to see how your friends, compatriots, your beloved musicians or just some madmen whom you do not know at all fall in love with the roadlife, still possible in 2010s. One of them (Brazilian, by the way) got married to a girl from Siberia, and another one (from Spain) said that his usual audience at home is few dozen of serious men of his own age, and here in Russia he's playing for hundreds of beautiful ladies on daily basis.

Want to see it? Welcome onboard.


Of course there are some links if you want to know more. Check out the project website with it simple English page: http://tour.muzenergo.ru/en/

story:
Short Summary

Hi everybody, my name is Cristina and I am currently working on my solo Symphonic Metal project called Rhenium.

www.facebook.com/rheniumbandofficial

This project has been going on for over a year now and although I have got some good ideas in my mind, I feel like my music could be so much better if I had the right sounds...

What I Need & What You Get

I have recently discovered a Software called Komplete 10 Ultimate which has got really epic sounds...it really has got all I need for me to make my music sound more professional as well as adding fantastic orchestra and choirs sounds to it.

The software is really expensive and that is why I have launched this campaign to ask you for help :)

What will you get?

For this campaign there will only be 3 perks:

1. Every little helps --> You can donate as little as £1 and in return I will personally thank you on FB :)

2. Digital download (£3) --> With only £3 you will be able to download 2 of the songs I will be working on using Komplete 10. You will receive a snippet of all of the 5 songs I will be working on so that you can choose the 2 you want to download :)

3. EP Digital download (£7) --> With only £7 you will be able to download my EP which will have the 5 songs I will be working on using Komplete 10. This will come with the EP artwork. You will also receive a personal thank you message on FB.


The Impact

I would like you guys to have a listen to my songs on Reverbnation http://www.reverbnation.com/Rheniumbandofficial

...but just imagine what they would sound like with this... https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AWj6lciMPYM (this link is about Komplete 9)

I hope you guys can help...

Thank you in advance :)

Cristina

story:
The “E.Gai” Music Band from Town of Nepi (Italy) boasts more than one
century of history. Its origin dates back the end of XIX century.
Its main purpose is hand down from one generation to another the band
tradition and love for music like a vehicle to share emotions and
experiences.


In two-year period 2010-2011, “E.Gai” Music Band realized a cultural
exchange with IHCConcert Band of Portland (ME-USA). Two different
countries and cultures joined using the same language: the music. It was a
wonderful experience from which were born deep friendships. It was a
hard project but the band succeded.

Now, “E.Gai” Music Band want to realize a new great project and dream:
a new cultural exchange with the Kiwanis Community Band of Dawson
Creek (British Columbia – Canada). The Canadian Band already came to
Italy in the summer of 2014. The time spent together was amazing.



 “E.Gai” Music Band would like to go to Canada in summer of 2016.
Probably the “E.Gai” Music Band will perform: one parade in Dawson
Creek, one concert in Quesnel, one concert in Salmon Arm, one concert in
Summerland and one concert in Vancouver.

We don’t want our dream half-done. So, we ask to everyone for helping
us to realize and complete our project.

Two countries, one language…the music.

Thank you.


The Music Band "E.Gai" will accomodate every contibutor who will give a contribution of at least 500$ at one's own expensens for three days in Nepi (30 minutes from Rome): cultural tours in lovely town of Nepi (Borgia Castle, historic centre with its beautiful Plaza, wonderful cathedral...), typical traditional foods.
story_txt: The “E.Gai” Music Band from Town of Nepi (Italy) boasts more than one century of history. Its origin dates back the end of XIX century.Its main purpose is hand down from one generation to another the band tradition and love for music like a vehicle to share emotions and experiences.In two-year period 2010-2011, “E.Gai” Music Band realized a cultural exchange with IHCConcert Band of Portland (ME-USA). Two different countries and cultures joined using the same language: the music. It was a wonderful experience from which were born deep friendships. It was a hard project but the band succeded.Now, “E.Gai” Music Band want to realize a new great project and dream: a new cultural exchange with the Kiwanis Community Band of Dawson Creek (British Columbia – Canada). The Canadian Band already came to Italy in the summer of 2014. The time spent together was amazing. “E.Gai” Music Band would like to go to Canada in summer of 2016. Probably the “E.Gai” Music Band will perform: one parade in Dawson Creek, one concert in Quesnel, one concert in Salmon Arm, one concert in Summerland and one concert in Vancouver.We don’t want our dream half-done. So, we ask to everyone for helping us to realize and complete our project. Two countries, one language…the music. Thank you.The Music Band "E.Gai" will accomodate every contibutor who will give a contribution of at least 500$ at one's own expensens for three days in Nepi (30 minutes from Rome): cultural tours in lovely town of Nepi (Borgia Castle, historic centre with its beautiful Plaza, wonderful cathedral...), typical traditional foods.

story:
Misa E' Gallo prepara su segundo video musical "El Loco" y necesita tu aportación para lograrlo. Este video es bien importante para nosotros ya que no solamente es el primer sencillo, de nuestro primer disco. Si no que representa nuestra lucha diaria como artistas sobreviviendo en el sistema.  

Misa: 

Misa E’ Gallo nace del Hip-Hop pero se expande por todo un conglomerado de géneros musicales tomando prestado la energía del Funk, la actitud del Rock, la elegancia e improvisaciones del Jazz, el sazón de la Música Latina entre otros. Estos ingredientes crean una fusión única que apela a los sentidos y a la cotidianidad reconociendo ritmos y melodías pero que obliga a retorcer el cuerpo con dicha innovación. 

Historia: 

Misa E’ Gallo Comenzó su primera gira programada en Febrero 2015 “Guerrilla Tour” en el que se incluyeron visitas a Orlando, Miami y Fort Lauderdale , Florida y todo Puerto Rico. Como un esfuerzo continuo se propone mantener el tour hasta finales de Mayo 2015. Para en ese entonces darle paso  a los nuevos esfuerzos; disco, videos musicales, campañas publicitarias y gira de espectáculos. 

El Proyecto: 

Hemos trabajado muy fuerte y poco a poco hemos logrado cumplir nuestras metas; como haber lanzado  nuestro primer EP y comenzar a grabar nuestro primer disco y con este proceso es que se pone la cosa buena. En nuestros planes de llevarles nuestra música y su mensaje de la manera que ustedes merecen con la mayor claridad y calidad posible hemos decidido hacer un video musical de una de las canciones que saldrá en el disco, “El loco”, una de nuestras favoritas. Un vídeo que plasmará la esencia de la canción y de lo que es Misa E' Gallo llevándote en un mundo visual y haciéndote parte de este movimiento. Como ustedes ya saben una producción de excelencia y profesional conlleva un serie de gastos que se nos ha hecho muy cuesta arriba conseguir. 

Trama del Video:

La historia del vídeo toma lugar en algún casco urbano puertorriqueño. En la historia podemos observar como la ambición de exceso de dinero y poder lleva a líderes del país a la deshonra, manipulación y como resultado la sociedad, en especial la clase trabajadora, llega a un nivel absurdo de estanque, abacoro y dificultad económica y social. En respuesta a esto Gerry y Victor, cantante y bajista de Misa E’ Gallo, deciden reunir a la banda y todos los artistas de Puerto Rico desde pintores, fotógrafos, bailarines, artistas plásticos, deportistas, malabaristas, músicos, actores etc. Para organizar un contraataque artístico representando a la clase trabajadora puertorriqueña.

Esto desemboca en una “guerra” (literal) artísticas donde las pistolas son guitarras y bajos, los francotiradores son fotógrafos urbanos, las cuchillas son pinceles y las granadas bombas de colores etc. Y se enfrentan a un grupo de funcionarios que  lucharán hasta el fin por mantener su poder económico, sus trucos y corrupción. La función es volver a demostrar lo que se nos ha demostrado la historia tantas y tantas veces; que el cambio comienza por la expresión y la mejor manera de expresarnos es a través del arte. Se desarrolla una batalla intensa en donde solo saldrá un ganador… ¿Quién Será?


Presupuesto aproximado:

El video esta cotizado para el mínimo de necesidades, mas un 10% de contingencia para un total de 6,370.00 como producción ideal. Pero sabemos que la realidad es otra, por lo que solicitamos a través de esta campaña 3,500.00 en ayudas, mientras, nosotros seguiremos trabajando duro para cubrir el resto de necesidad.

Otras Manera de ayudar:

  • Únete a nuestro equipo de producción, talento, técnico o servicio de catering.
  • Pregunta por nuestra lista de “props” y se uno de nuestros auspiciadores substituyéndolo por tu producto.
  • Contratando nuestros servicios.

 Información a través de nuestro email. MisaEGallo@gmail.com


A continuación enlaces para que conozcas mas de nosotros.

Contacto:

Misa E’ Gallo
MisaEGallo@gmail.com
http://www.MisaEGallo.com




Enlaces:

Facebook – www.Facebook.com/MisaEGallo 

Twitter – www.Twitter.com/MisaEGallo

Instagram - www.Instagram.com/MisaEGallo

SoundCloud – www.SoundCloud.com/MisaEGallo 

Youtube - https://www.youtube.com/user/MisaEGallo

Música:

Cervecita: https://soundcloud.com/misaegallo/cervecita

Sumerio: https://soundcloud.com/misaegallo/sumerio

Primer Video Oficial:

Cervecita: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YYymZY2Y0hs

story:
We at Musicians Everywhere will use the money in the following way:

  • Built solid and dependable website platform 
  • Create and Maintain Musician database
  • Ensure adequate server memory for user  uploads and downloads (photos, video, and mp3s)
  • Interface design
  • Marketing Website to Users

We are excited about how this website will actually get and keep musicians working. The website is created, designed and built by musicians for musicians everywhere.

story:
Summary

The BREIZH AMERIKA COLLECTIVE is a collaborative project between Breton musicians  from Brittany, France and Garifuna musicians from Belize who have come together to bring awareness to their endangered languages and cultures through music. 

They will be in a studio residency during May 2015 to record original Breton and Garifuna compositions. We have already raised money to bring the Breton musicians to the US to perform and tour. We now seek funds to produce this innovative album and share it with the world. Our goal is not only to produce a beautiful album but also to strengthen these endangered languages and traditions through international collaboration. 

Armel an Hejer and Alain LeClere of the Breizh Amerika Collective singing in the traditional Kan Ha Diskan style: 


James Lovell of the Breizh Amerika Collective performing at the 2013 Smithsonian Folklife Festival: 


What We Need & What You Get

While we have been successful in raising enough money for an American tour, we are now turning to you to help us cover the following costs for the production of the album:

       Studio rehearsal - $500
       Recording studio time - $1000
       Mastering & mixing of music - $1000

Please help us make it happen and be a part of this musical celebration. Anything helps and you'll receive a variety of perks for your contribution. 

Far Reaching Impact

Your contribution will enable us to record and distribute Breton-Garifuna musical works that will inspire thousands in the United States, France and Belize and serve as a powerful advocacy tool for endangered languages.

Ways You Can Help

Any contribution is appreciated, but we would still love to have your support in any way possible! You can

  • Share this campaign through email and social media (add a personal note:-)
  • Suggest venues and educational institutions who may be interested in collaborating with the Breizh Amerika Collective.
  • Come jam with the Breizh Amerika Collective at Meridian 23 on May 14 and spread the word about this concert!

Who we are

We are a dedicated team of supporters raising funds to make this possible. The fundraising team includes: 

-Bob Holman, writer and language activist of the Bowery Poetry Club

-Charles Kergaravat, Breton cultural activist, Founder of Breizh Amerika

-Dan Kaufman, linguist and co-founder of Endangered Language Alliance

-Nyasha Laing, lawyer, writer, and producer of a film on Belizean Garifuna music

-Charles Von Rosenberg, founder of CommonBeat NYC

-Volunteers of the Endangered Language Alliance (ELA) and Breizh Amerika

The Endangered Language Alliance is an established non-profit organization that has been working for years to empower diverse communities to document and preserve their languages throughout New York City and the world. Check out this recent New Yorker article  to read about their work in documentation and advocacy.

story:
In 2004 I came to America with a J-1 visa (educational). After a short while, I realized that Kansas City was a place where I wanted to stay.

I was lucky to find a job that I loved and an employer who was willing to sponsor me for a Green Card (permanent residency).

During my 11 years in the U.S. I have been fortunate to create a wonderful life full of friends and extraordinary experiences.

With the support of my American friends and my family I decided to embark on the U.S. naturalization process. I came to discover that this process is time consuming and possibly financially burdensome.

These are some of the fees that I have encountered:

- U.S. Naturalization Fee ($595)

- FBI Biometric Fee ($85);

- U.S. Passport ($140);

- Legal Counseling (appr. $1,000).

Fortunately, these fees are not an obstacle for me. But for many who are eligible to become legal do not have the financial means to go through naturalization process.

I love this country, and I know that it has the power to help so many more people. In 2014 the United States admitted 70,000 refugees, mostly children. 68% of these refugees have been in a refugee camp for more than 17 years. Those coming to the U.S. come from countries you might expect, like Afghanistan, Somalia, Iraq, Syria, the Sudan, and the Congo. Annually 600 to 1000 new refugees and 500 to 600 secondary migrants come to Kansas City.

Thankfully there is a wonderful local organization that helps refugees and immigrants navigate the process as well as provide other support services. Jewish Vocational Service (JVS) seeks to help reunite families and strengthen our diverse community. JVS in Kansas City receives between 450 to 500 refugees every year. 

That is why I am raising $1,800 for the Jewish Vocational Service Immigration Counseling Program which is accredited by the Board of Immigration Appeals.

Thank you for your support.

Teresa.

For more information check here to visit the JVS website .

story:
Hello I’m Doug Marshall of a new project named Akilavue. Some of you may know me as the lead singer and front man of the band Souls Harbor. I’m starting a new venture with Sonny Bond, Davey Masteller and Doug McCarthy. It will be an alternative rock project that embraces energy, well written songs, great musicianship and compassion. 

Hailing from the Low-Country of South Carolina in the town Hilton Head, Akilavue is comprised of a group of musicians that found a common thread amidst their very different experiences and backgrounds. With a raw, in-your-face rock sound, that displays an energy and drive that can only come from the melding of the unique backgrounds of it’s individual members. From the Southern-styled rock background of the guitarist Sonny Bond, to the seasoned jazz experience of Davey Masteller, the thundering metal/punk influence of drummer Doug McCarthy and the raw and powerful vocals of Doug Marshall, Akilavue is sure to strike a chord with music lovers of all varieties.

Our campaign is to raise much needed money to continue this project that we have been working on for the past 9 months. We have, as a band, have came to the realization that we need the help of our music community which includes, our personal fans of us, friends and family as well as new fans, to chip in to help us get this project completed. It is important to us, to keep music in our lives and to continue to create music for our fans.

There is no doubt, that with your donations that our passion of making an album that will include a digital download version, a compact disc version and a vinyl version of this full length, along with a music video to coincide with the release, even closer within our grasp. 

Majority of the money collected will go towards producing, engineering, mixing and mastering of the album. The remaining money will go towards artwork, packaging, merchandise etc..to ensure our fans a high quality product. If we do well and have enough leftover, on Indiegogo,we would like to use the rest of the money towards a legit music video.

We have collectively discussed the perks and we feel we have came up with some really solid packages to make our fans feel they are getting their money’s worth. We want our music in your hands, we want you to crank it loud in your car and in your headphones. We want you to sing our songs when we play them in front of you and for you the fan, to feel what we felt when we were writing them!!! 

If for some reason we do not meet our goal, whatever money’s collected will go toward the most important thing, THE MUSIC! 

Whether it has been because of a work schedules, to playing gigs to make ends meet as well as finances, that has held up the process of finishing this album in a timely manner, we feel your donations will eliminate these obstacles. If you are in a position where you cannot donate, spreading the word to your friends and family is just as important. We truly in advance want to thank all of you for giving us a shot. 

To share this link, just copy and paste it to your Facebook page or other media outlets.

ENJOY!

Doug, Sonny, Davey and Doug

story:
Short Summary

 

Hey Guys, my name is Carl and I am 40 years of age and have been making harder edged Trance music for almost 2 decades. From my humble beginnings of living in a doorway in the West end of London, I have always lived and breathed Dance music, it has been my saviour on more than one occasion I can tell you.  Back in 2011 I released my debut album 'Storybook' which was completely funded by myself, featured in Mixmag and spent 3 weeks at No 1 on Trackitdown.net, this time around I have transitioned to 138 Trance, but due to outgoings, unfortunately this time I cant fund all by myself, and this is where you come in! :) 

What We Need & What You Get

The £5000 is to cover costs for a professional studio in London covering two weeks at £1250 pw = £2500, £2000 is to cover the mastering, cutting, duplication and artwork for 1000 Ltd Edition Full Colour Albums, and the final £500 is to cover promotion and distribution for the album.

  • Perks to be included:- Digital Download of Full Album, Fully Branded WAV USB Key, Numbered and signed Ltd Edition CD, Private Gig at your house (UK Only), Meal for Two, Bottle Of Champagne and Guest List at one of my future events, Wall Canvas Featuring Album artwork.
  • If I don't reach my full goal any funds raised will go toward completion.
  • *BONUS* ALL PLEDGES will receive a complimentary download of my last Hard Trance album 'Storybook' containing 25 full tracks and 2 DJ Mixes when this fundraiser has run its term.

The Impact

This album is extremely dear to me, since transitioning to 138 Trance in 2013 i now finally feel that i have found my corner musically, and i'm sure many will agree there's nothing better than coming home from a hard day's work, closing your eyes and letting your troubles melt inside a euphoric soundtrack.  That's what i do, i make music to drown out the drudge of everyday life, a soundtrack for the working class folk so to speak.

  • Over the past two decades i have had tracks included on over 40 compilations, had 3 UK Top 10 dance chart entries, have made over 150 original tracks and remixes which have been supported by everyone from Lisa Lashes and Paul Van Dyk, to Armin Van Burren & Judge Jules, i have also tour Ibiza, Argentina, Russia, South Africa, Australia & NZ to very high acclaim.


Risks & Challenges

My main challenge with this project is funding, studio hire is extremely expensive, but quality creates quality, and i want this album to be the absolute very best i can do, i know exactly what i want, i just need the means to get it


Other Ways You Can Help

 

If you cant help toward the project, no worries, even if you could just share and tell your friends, every little helps :)
story_txt:
Short Summary Hey Guys, my name is Carl and I am 40 years of age and have been making harder edged Trance music for almost 2 decades. From my humble beginnings of living in a doorway in the West end of London, I have always lived and breathed Dance music, it has been my saviour on more than one occasion I can tell you.  Back in 2011 I released my debut album 'Storybook' which was completely funded by myself, featured in Mixmag and spent 3 weeks at No 1 on Trackitdown.net, this time around I have transitioned to 138 Trance, but due to outgoings, unfortunately this time I cant fund all by myself, and this is where you come in! :)    What We Need & What You Get The £5000 is to cover costs for a professional studio in London covering two weeks at £1250 pw = £2500, £2000 is to cover the mastering, cutting, duplication and artwork for 1000 Ltd Edition Full Colour Albums, and the final £500 is to cover promotion and distribution for the album.
 Perks to be included:- Digital Download of Full Album, Fully Branded WAV USB Key, Numbered and signed Ltd Edition CD, Private Gig at your house (UK Only), Meal for Two, Bottle Of Champagne and Guest List at one of my future events, Wall Canvas Featuring Album artwork. If I don't reach my full goal any funds raised will go toward completion.
*BONUS* ALL PLEDGES will receive a complimentary download of my last Hard Trance album 'Storybook' containing 25 full tracks and 2 DJ Mixes when this fundraiser has run its term.    The Impact This album is extremely dear to me, since transitioning to 138 Trance in 2013 i now finally feel that i have found my corner musically, and i'm sure many will agree there's nothing better than coming home from a hard day's work, closing your eyes and letting your troubles melt inside a euphoric soundtrack.  That's what i do, i make music to drown out the drudge of everyday life, a soundtrack for the working class folk so to speak. Over the past two decades i have had tracks included on over 40 compilations, had 3 UK Top 10 dance chart entries, have made over 150 original tracks and remixes which have been supported by everyone from Lisa Lashes and Paul Van Dyk, to Armin Van Burren & Judge Jules, i have also tour Ibiza, Argentina, Russia, South Africa, Australia & NZ to very high acclaim.     Risks & Challenges  My main challenge with this project is funding, studio hire is extremely expensive, but quality creates quality, and i want this album to be the absolute very best i can do, i know exactly what i want, i just need the means to get it    Other Ways You Can Help If you cant help toward the project, no worries, even if you could just share and tell your friends, every little helps :)

story:
I'm making an album of original songs that will make you dance, make you cry, and make you sing.

Over the past few years, I've spent a lot of energy recording a couple EPs and many demos. So far, I've had to do it all myself at home. While I could probably make a decent album on my own out of my home studio, I feel this collection of songs are so good that they deserve better treatment. Good music, just like good food, is best served with others, and I want to include some of the most talented people I know here in Nashville on the project. Here's why this is important to me:

  • A full-length record by a local, accomplished, tasteful producer will be a high-water mark in my musical career.
  • These songs will begin a new life of their own with the release of this album, and I will be able to shop them around to venues across the country, labels for distribution, and other musicians and creatives I hope to include in future projects.
  • Your support will allow me to focus on the many creative aspects of making this album without compromising production quality due to budgetary restraints. Imagine the liberation of being able to try ideas from each person involved until we find the right one.

Here is what we need from you:

I've spent most of my time teaching others how to play music and find fulfillment through music. I'd like to share some of the lessons I've learned along the way through my songs. Recording a full-length album can get very expensive very quickly, but I've settled on a budget of $10,000. I'd like to break down the costs with you:

  • The bulk: $5,000 goes to renting the space, recording, arranging, mixing, and producing. This is what will make the real difference between doing it myself and having others on the project
  • The musicians: $3,000 goes to the fine musicians I've included on the project. They all lead hectic, incredibly busy lives, mostly in the studio and all across America on the road. They've graciously blocked out a solid week in the studio with me to help bring these songs to life.
  • Documentation: $500 goes to video production and promotion of the album. I'd like to have some video documentation of the process to share with you all when it's all said and done.
  • Mastering: $500 goes to the mastering engineer who will make this album sound like something you can put under your Christmas tree.
  • Pressing & Rewards: the final $1000 goes toward making the CDs, t-shirts, and other rewards for you, our supporters.

The Impact

I feel like my songs allow the musicians; my friends, to live, breathe, and contribute in a real, collaborative way. I want you, the listener, to get to know them in the same ways that I have: through their musical expression. A lot of music right now is homogenized and any sort of personality is ironed out to make a nice, neat package. This is not that kind of album. The people I've chosen to include are some of the most interesting and beautiful personalities I've met in my life, and I'd like you to get to know them also.

Challenges

Any sort of creative project comes with risks. If we don't make the full asking price, of course we will have to make sacrifices along the way. I have faith that we won't need to, but creative types in Nashville tend to stay very busy, and I'm not sure of the next time I'll be able to get these people in the same room together to make the magic happen. I want to make every dollar count.

If you can't afford to help financially:

As someone who makes his living in music, I understand what it means to have to live by a budget. If you can't afford to help the project financially, it would mean just as much if you would:

  • Tell your friends! Share this link!
  • There are "share" buttons all over this page. Click them! It won't hurt. I promise!

Your support means so much to me, and I can't wait to share this music with you.

story:
In 2013 DJ Premier got his hands on Dawhud & Ace-One's chest pounding "Battle Anybody".  It quickly became a favorite track that the legend would play on his "Live from HeadQCourterz" show on Sirius XM.


By the end of the year, DJ Premier posted his "Top 20 of 2013" and at number 19, the duo's emceeing anthem was placed on the list. 

20. Busta Rhymes – Thank You (Feat. Q-Tip, Kanye West & Lil Wayne) 
19. Dawhud – Battle Anybody (Feat. ACE one) 
18. Jay-Z – Open Letter

The duo shifted focus from other projects and decided to work on a full length project together titled, David & Goliath.  Once the album began to develop, the two were able to work with many legends in hip hop and build an album that the two could only have dreamed of.  D&G features production from from Dawhud and Da Beatminerz, along with guest spots from Masta Ace, Sadat X and Pacewon.

Kings... giants... titans... champions...  David & Goliath "The Scepter & The Sword" is a boom bap document that has classic throwback appeal but is just as relevant in the current era of hip hop.


After principal recording was finished and post production/mixing began, Dawhud's house was robbed.  In an instant this dream album was nearly lost into oblivion.  But by a simple twist of fate, it was saved. Backup sessions were sent to Pete Marriott to mix just before the incident took place and the hard drive with the original sessions was not stolen.  This epic project was almost lost forever and now the two feel it's even more important to not only put out this album, but to give it the proper physical release for it to become immortal.  

In this digital age, stories like this STILL need to be documented physically to live on like sacred scrolls.   Although Ace-One and Dawhud have released their other projects in various formats, they have never released anything on vinyl.  This project, and what the duo would consider their dream album, is the first time both artists have produced a project that they've wanted to document on vinyl.

And that's where this crowdfunding project begins. In order to release "The Scepter & The Sword", we will need to raise funds to finish post production costs, art, current debt from the project and the actual pressing of the album.  We're looking at an initial pressing of 500 copies on double vinyl and a limited run on cassette.  (but it all depends on what is raised via the crowdfunding campaign.*)  

This project was almost lost forever, please help us release this epic album the way it was meant to be heard.

If you'd like to be a part of the journey of this album, please support by selecting one of the perks or sharing this post if you can.

Thank You

Dawhud & Ace-One

Something's Coming...


*Due to the upswing and demand of vinyl in the last couple years and there being a limited amount of pressing plants, delays can be expected with releases.  We're hoping and shooting for a March release, but with RSD/Record Store Day in spring, the project may be unexpectedly delayed.
