story:
Hi there!

We're Duo Diez, and we need your help to make our album come to life...

'Duo Diez' is an innovative and eclectic musical collaboration between guitarist Dimitris Dekavallas and violinist Violeta Barrena. Since meeting at the Royal Academy of Music as students back in 2005, we discovered a shared interest in playing and promoting Spanish, Ladino and Latin American classical music. We decided to work together in 2012, and this signalled the beginning of Duo Diez.

Since then, we've been performing and touring all over the world and have loved every minute of it. However somehow in the whole three years we've been playing together, we never actually released an album... until now.


'From Granada to Buenos Aires'

Our debut album 'From Granada to Buenos Aires' was recorded with Grammy Award-winning producer James MacMillan in his home studio in Hastings, and features 18 varied and exciting tracks. These are drawn from our musical roots in Latin-American and Spanish and Ladino folk music and also feature some of our own compositions and arrangements as well.

Even more excitingly, we've booked the major London Venue of Conway Hall to launch our album with a enthralling programme of music drawn from our standard repertoire and from the album itself! The event will be on the 12th November, and you can find more information on the performance here: http://conwayhall.org.uk/event/from-granada-to-buenos-aires/

Unfortunately in today's tough climate, release costs are significantly higher than they used to be and artists regularly have to put up these costs themselves. Whilst we've personally funded over £5,300 of the album, we need external support from here onwards to make sure our investment goes as far as possible. In return for your generous help we're offering some fantastic pledge rewards to make you a part of what we're doing!

So to sum up our pitch, we are asking for funding for three key points:

1. Organising a Tour to promote the album
2. Venue Hire for a follow-up event
3. Marketing and PR Costs

And a more detailed breakdown:
  • We need to raise a total of £2,000 to organise a US Tour
  • Another £2,000 to cover hire and promotion costs for one of London's top venues - such as St. John's, Smith Square, Cadogan Hall or the Purcell Room.
  • On top of this, we need a budget of £1,000 to spend on professional marketing and PR throughout the rest of the next year. This will help us develop as artists
  • The remaining £1,000 should cover campaign costs (including Indiegogo's commission) with a small amount of contingency funding.
Even more excitingly, we've booked the major London Venue Conway Hall to launch our album with a enthralling programme of music, drawn from our standard repertoire and from the album itself.

Conway Hall, London

What We Have Already Invested

This project is not something that we've only just started making - we've been working on this since October 2014, and have invested significant amounts of money into this project as an ensemble to ensure that we have a level basis to produce the most professional product possible.

  • We raised £1,000 ourselves to record the album
  • £1,000 spent to commission 3 exclusive bonus tracks from composers
  • £600 to record the bonus tracks at a very high budget studio, utilising a top engineer (as a particularly incredible favour!)
  • £2,000 for the hire, event management and promotion of our Album Launch event at Conway Hall
  • £700 for the printing costs of the physical album

The Impact

The essence of being a recording artist is that in the 21st century, the biggest record labels hold diminishing influence over the music industry. Physical CD sales are far lower than they used to be and if you don't have the means to invest in marketing yourself, it is very difficult to reach a large enough audience.  

That's where you come in. 

By backing us today you will enable us to take our music to the next level! We will be able to go on tour, perform to more people and have the freedom to focus on perfecting our music rather than worrying constantly about how to pay the bills. It would be a life-changing, and indeed a career-changing difference.

We've also secured a worldwide distribution deal for our album with the innovative Demerara Records, who are specialists in working with New Music and who operate solely as an online-based label. They are a fantastic example of how a label can work 'against the grain' with enormous success and we're delighted to be working with them on this project.

Demerara Records

Risks & Challenges

Right now, the biggest challenge we face is raising the funding. We need to ensure a really solid marketing drive is put in place to deliver the best platform for our new album. 

We have taken the following steps to ensure that risks are eliminated:

  • We have engaged a fantastic PR Team, including specialist arts marketing agency Promote Classical and Lisa Peacock Concert Management Ltd to help with both the crowdfunding campaign and concert planning and promotion, acting as professional support to ensure we reach the widest audience possible
  • We are using flexible funding, to make sure that every penny raised goes directly towards the project

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to contribute, don't worry - we understand entirely! You can still help this campaign out without contributing financially:

  • Share this page on Facebook, Twitter, Reddit, Instagram, Pinterest, via Email, smoke signals, post the link to your grandparents, or even send it by owl. Every bit of exposure we get helps enormously.
  • Get in touch if you think you can recommend this project on to anyone else.
  • If you want to engage Duo Diez to perform, email our press team on info@promoteclassical.com
Thanks so much for taking the time to check out our pitch. For more information on us, you can visit our website at: 
---> www.duodiez.com <---


See you at Conway Hall on 12th November!


Duo Diez

Twitter: @DuoDiez

Facebook: DuoDiez

Website: www.duodiez.com

story:
We're a Morning Show at Night

Good Morning You Drunks (GMYD) is an entertainment talk show that mixes honest talk, comedy bits, witty dry humor, and indie music to compose an impossible to define yet easy to enjoy antithesis to boring, overplayed shlock.

We strive to bring back fun talk radio, while also helping out other independent artists, whether they be comedians, actors, musicians or bands. There is a huge amount of talent out in the world and we want to help give a forum for those that might go overlooked.
GMYD is hosted by Matt Wade, Nathan Emilio and Justin Wilson, three guys that are taking the DIY attitude and applying it to their show. This is just the first stage of a much larger project, one we hope will culminate in a low powered FM community radio station to serve the Norfolk, VA arts district as well as an internet radio station to cover the rest of the world with our entertainment and music programming.
With this funding we'll be able to take the show from an hour long podcast to a three night a week, three hour a night talk extravaganza.

We Need Help. Here's Where Your Support Goes

All money raised will be going to upgrading our gear. Since we're moving to streaming live with phone calls and user interaction, we'll need to upgrade our gear to give live listeners with the best quality broadcast. 

Here's a breakdown of how the money will be spent:

  • Upgraded Mixing Board - 25%

  • Phone Controller - 22%

  • Upgraded Mics, Headphones, Misc gear - 38%

  • Incentive Fulfillment - 15%


We Won't Let You Down

We take this support very serious, and we want nothing more than to give the best possible quality. It means a lot to us that our listeners would open up their wallets and donate. That's huge. You'll not only be helping us grow, but you'll also help us build something unique for our community. We don't have a lot of radio in our area that supports both talk radio and independent music. This will be a boon to all that we can help with our aspiration to create a small LPFM station.

GMYD started out as a small podcast that only pulled in 134 downloads in its first week. We've grown that to almost 10,000 sustained weekly downloads in only five months. The drunks are working hard behind the scenes and will only continue to work harder.


Risks & Challenges

Internet radio and podcasting is an emerging entertainment platform, and although it has grown significantly in the past few years, there's still an amount of risk in creating and sustaining a business with this art form.

We work hard to create a unique listener experience, combining the tropes of traditional talk radio with the added interactivity of social media, along with a few great songs to back us up.

Could we fail? Of course. But as long as we work hard and continuously petitions for new support, we think we stand a chance of surviving the odds.


Other Ways You Can Help

We know that there are a lot of you out there that don't have the money to support us financially, but there are plenty of ways to help out that don't cost a single penny.

  • Share us with all your friends!
  • Reach out and let us know that you're out there and support our efforts, This is hard work and hearing from you guys really makes our day!
  • Just listen to the show and enjoy! That's one of our biggest rewards, knowing that listeners are loving the content. 
Thanks for looking us over, and please consider donating. We really do love you guys.

yet easy to enjoy antithesis to boring, overplayed shlock. We strive to bring back fun talk radio, while also helping out other independent artists, whether they be comedians, actors, musicians or bands. There is a huge amount of talent out in the world and we want to help give a forum for those that might go overlooked.GMYD is hosted by Matt Wade, Nathan Emilio and Justin Wilson, three guys that are taking the DIY attitude and applying it to their show. This is just the first stage of a much larger project, one we hope will culminate in a low powered FM community radio station to serve the Norfolk, VA arts district as well as an internet radio station to cover the rest of the world with our entertainment and music programming.With this funding we'll be able to take the show from an hour long podcast to a three night a week, three hour a night talk extravaganza.  We Need Help. Here's Where Your Support Goes All money raised will be going to upgrading our gear. Since we're moving to streaming live with phone calls and user interaction, we'll need to upgrade our gear to give live listeners with the best quality broadcast. 
Here's a breakdown of how the money will be spent:




Upgraded Mixing Board - 25%

Phone Controller - 22%
Upgraded Mics, Headphones, Misc gear - 38%
Incentive Fulfillment - 15%

    We Won't Let You Down We take this support very serious, and we want nothing more than to give the best possible quality. It means a lot to us that our listeners would open up their wallets and donate. That's huge. You'll not only be helping us grow, but you'll also help us build something unique for our community. We don't have a lot of radio in our area that supports both talk radio and independent music. This will be a boon to all that we can help with our aspiration to create a small LPFM station.
GMYD started out as a small podcast that only pulled in 134 downloads in its first week. We've grown that to almost 10,000 sustained weekly downloads in only five months. The drunks are working hard behind the scenes and will only continue to work harder.

    Risks & Challenges Internet radio and podcasting is an emerging entertainment platform, and although it has grown significantly in the past few years, there's still an amount of risk in creating and sustaining a business with this art form.
We work hard to create a unique listener experience, combining the tropes of traditional talk radio with the added interactivity of social media, along with a few great songs to back us up.
Could we fail? Of course. But as long as we work hard and continuously petitions for new support, we think we stand a chance of surviving the odds.
 
   Other Ways You Can Help We know that there are a lot of you out there that don't have the money to support us financially, but there are plenty of ways to help out that don't cost a single penny.


Share us with all your friends!
Reach out and let us know that you're out there and support our efforts, This is hard work and hearing from you guys really makes our day!
Just listen to the show and enjoy! That's one of our biggest rewards, knowing that listeners are loving the content. 

Thanks for looking us over, and please consider donating. We really do love you guys.

story:
"She's Dangerous" will be the single off my upcoming EP! Get your copy now!!!

Prints are 11x17 and fit in a standard frame size! 

The Man Behind the Music

My name is Rob LaFond, I’m a songwriter and a musician. I can’t stop writing songs. I have been playing music since I was a little kid, hammering out notes on my uncle’s Wurlitzer electric piano. Throughout my teens, I would stay up for nights, writing music and penning lyrics - every word helping me discover myself and find purpose. However, I thought I couldn’t sing. I couldn’t. But something pushed me to keep doing it. I started to find my own unique voice. It was then that I realized, being a great artist is not about being better than everyone else. It’s about contributing to a larger conversation and expressing yourself freely.

After completing two albums, I’m super pumped to announce that I am hard at work planning the next steps to create more music to inspire you to find and develop your inner voice. Right now I am working on a trilogy of EPs. I have already released the first EP “When We Fly” but now I need YOUR help to produce the next one, “High and Low.” When the trilogy is complete, each title will come together to make a complete sentence:

“When We Fly High and Low…”

I’m so excited about these songs. This project will help tell the story. I started writing these while driving across the country from Boston to LA. My eyes were wide and filled with possibility. I found an apartment in Silverlake where I started writing and recording the demos. Songs that I wrote years ago are just starting to make sense to me now.

I’ve been down many roads from Boston to LA

Seen the sun shine so bright and I’ve seen it rain for days

Stood upon the mountain and looked down at the Sea

Seen my reflection and didn’t know it was me

On a springtime in LA

By supporting this initiative, you can help me not only create my music, but help me reach a larger audience.

This is where you come in…

I am humbly asking for the support of my community in order to produce, record and promote this EP. All the people that have been listening to my music, coming out to the shows and backing my career thus far, THANK YOU! You have meant the world to me.

This next phase is sure to be a success and I am inviting you to become a part of the process.

Your financial support will go towards studio time, hiring a producer, mixing engineers, studio musicians, mastering engineers, radio trackers, a music video, hiring a publicist and eventually, help cover the actual duplication of the album when it’s ready to be in tangible form!

I have teamed up with some incredible people to offer you exclusive perks. The incredible artist, Joey Feldman has jumped on board to offer exclusive original prints for some of you lucky supporters! For aspiring songwriters and musicians, I was able to get Raymond Richard (who will be producing this album) on board to mix and master a song for you for a donation of only $350.

For music enthusiasts and entertainment lovers - you have the chance to book my band, for a house concert or private party of your choice.

This will be a success

I have a very distinct vision for this which I am really excited to share with you. I’ve spent the last year and half playing these songs with my bands in front of many audiences and have really honed my skills. I’ve spent time doing vocal lessons, practicing, performing, working on song lyrics and jotting down melodies. This is a fully thought out idea. Everything down to the T-shirt has a succinct artist vision.

Moving from the East to the West Coast has really helped build my character and my experience in the music industry. I know what it is like, day in and day out, as I spend my days working at KCRW, working with artists in the business.

For the past year, I have been playing all around LA and networking with other musicians. A huge majority of these shows, I produced. Part of my vision is to connect with other artists and build a true arts community where we can all share our creations, express our true emotions and be better individuals.

On the musical side, I have sharpened my skills and proved my diversity by playing all of the instruments on my debut album “Shadows in the Room” (which was self recorded in 2007).

My second recording, which is the start to this series “When We Fly,” came out in March of 2014 and received radio play at KCRW in Los Angeles.

With your support, I know the second part of this trilogy will ‘fly high’ and take my career to the next level. I am inviting you to become a part of my creative process and make it possible. Please help me see my creative vision through.

Be a Part of the Story!

Check out the perks and be sure to grab your copy of the EP before we even start the recording process. Don’t have any extra funds this month? That’s ok - beyond the money, we need your help spreading the word, so please share this on your Facebook, Twitter and social media channels - every little bit helps!

Once again - Thank you!!!

Rob

story:
Pick a perk in exchange for your contribution...

Check out the perk list from Single £1 to Big Boss Mega Bundle £100



Who is The Big Boss?

The Big Boss was a band Martin Byrne & Martin Sawtell had from 1997-2000. They worked together in Camden Market and a love of Fat Boy, Leftfield, The Prodigy, The Chemical Bros, big beats and bad-ass baselines as well as a both being born on Friday 13th of March is what made it click. In 2000 they just drifted apart as life moved on but left a body of work that never saw the light of day other than live shows.

Fast forward to 2014 and Martin B is at Beatherder festival watching Vitalic, he realises he doesn't want to get to the end of his life and look back thinking "yeah, I should have made that album, but I didn't" So he get's back in touch with Martin S, asks ace producer NJC to mix and produce and gets the Akai S3000 and his SQ80  out of the loft. A year spent reworking, retrieving and  rediscovering has resulted in the album being finished. 

That's the "don't die with regrets" box ticked, the next tick box is to get heard, and that's where you come in. By helping us with this release you are part of that dream of sharing music which is the real inspiration behind creating it. Make people happy with music...make yourself happy. Simple right?

Any contribution however small is massively appreciated. We are keeping as close to cost as we can get and if you like The Chemical Brothers, The Prodigy, Fatboy Slim, Vitalic, Leftfield, Daft Punk and that whole genre we're reasonably confident you're gonna like this album. Here's a preview of all the tracks. Turn it up!!


What We Need & What You Get

The detail:

  • We are looking to cover the cost of mixing (the recording/programming bit was all done at home), mastering and producing some lovely CDs and Vinyl.
  • With the album download you will get the remixes free when they are done.
  • The CDs will only be available via this campaign.
  • The Vinyl will also only be available via this campaign and this is a limited edition run. 


Risks & Challenges

Obviously this could all go horribly wrong and we get 3 people (including me) and a dog who order a download. Well it's a risk but at some point you've got to put it out there and be damned so here goes nothing!

What to do next...

1. Choose your 'perk': it's just £5 for the album download or choose one of the other Big Boss bundles.
2. Spread the word: use the share tools on this page to let like-minded music lovers know about this project.
3. Connect with us on Twitter @thebigbossuk and on Facebook at  facebook.com/thebigbossuk

Thanks!

story:
UPDATE: Market EP production will start in December 2015. Pre-production phase is almost done!
I'm Nicolas Eddowes, a 20 years old Singer/Songwriter from Lima, Peru who writes indie pop music with rock, funk, and folk elements. 

I had the idea of making an album a long time ago, and I have written many songs and the songs for "Supermarket" are available for you to listen below in its demo phase (go straight to the "Songs" part). Some of the artists that influenced me the most are: Regina Spektor, Ingrid Michaelson, Of Monsters and Men, Foster The People, Lykke Li, Miss Li, Gossling, La Roux, and Bruno Mars
I intend to improve every song greatly before releasing the album. Look at this demos:

Listen to my band Demo here (Spotify) 

Listen a Demo from my album (Spotify)


During my summer vacation this year, I got to work in the USA and got a lot of experience, but I had negative stuff too. This inspired me to write music, and only with the GarageBand app the ideas started to flow.

"Supermarket" consists of 8 tracks, out of which seven are songs, and one is a little introduction. You can listen what I already have. Keep in mind that all of the songs still need to be polished. 


 

Every person involved is being supportive with the budget. I already own a little equipment at home, but obviously there's a lot more work to be done. I'm at the stage where I'm pulling everything together taking the project from my phone to a computer to work with a DAW (Digital Audio Workstation).

I have the songs, the ideas, and a team of people who are willing to help me. Let's talk about costs


I've chosen to use drums samplers, to get a professional, clean sound without the hassle of the edition process.

A recording engineer (Robert Chavez) will take care of this process. He'll be really involved with the production too. The album will have a real drum sound. He will charge $200 for programming drums for 5 songs.

I have a cousin who is a musician (Gustavo Villegas), who plays with many bands (Paramusicales, Cocaina...) and has experience working in studios. He owns a home studio and has everything required to record bass tracks. We'll use an audio interface with a direct box.

You can listen to his band's EP here (Spotify)

Gustavo will also help me record the electric and acoustic guitar lines. For the electric guitar, we'll use a direct box and an audio interface as well. For the acoustic guitar, we'll work with a condenser microphone and an interface in a quiet space.

He's charging me $180 for all of this work.


Gisela Perez-Ruibal is a professional piano player and she's going to do both parts. As we'll work with MIDI for some tracks, we are going to do piano parts, synthesizer parts, even strings in this process. A keyboard will be plugged through the audio interface and a USB cable (MIDI) to record. Arrangements will cost $240 ($30 per track).


You can listen to her work here (Spotify)


Orchestral Programming, in this case. This is going to be easily achieved with Miroslav Philharmonic. It sounds really good and practically there's no additional monetary investing in this part, it's included in the arrangements.

I'll probably do most of the vocals (if not all of them) for each song, even backing vocals. The tracks should be recorded in a professional studio, to get the best quality possible. The average price for recording voice in a studio is $30 an hour. I'm assuming I'll need around five two hours sessions, which would mean I'd need $300 for recording sessions. However, this is by no means fixed: it could take more or less sessions to finish recording.

I've decided to use one service with a great price and quality. You can check the service here. It includes Mastering on its prices. I'm using his album mix rate for 6 songs ($240), and for the singles I will be using the single song mix with 33-48 tracks rate ($110 each). That's a total of $460 for mixing and mastering.

UPDATE: Costs will be similar since I've decided to release an EP first, I would take the 3 song EP rate ($190), and the 5 song rate ($260), making a new total of $450 for mixing and mastering.

All I need is good photo session and some text, and for this I would spend only $50 for the photography and design (including singles and album artworks).

(not final artwork)

To do this I'm using CD Baby. It lets you to get your music on every digital platform and even physical copies.

 For this they charge $14,95 for each single (9,95 per song + 5 for an UPC barcode) and $69 for each album (49 per album + 20 for an UPC barcode) you release. I'm planning on releasing 2 singles and the album, which would come to $83,95.

UPDATE: Since I'm releasing an EP instead of individual singles, consider two album releases rates ($69 times 2 = $138, compared to the $83,95 previous total)

UPDATED!
I need to stick to a short list because of the low-budget project.

Stuff like Digital downloads, CDs, Vinyls, Posters and T-shirts will be given depending on how much you pledge, don't forget to look at the perks I've prepared

Feel free to suggest any other reward and I'll definitely look into it.

$10                                                       Be on the credits of the album

$10                                      Limited! Credits + Digital EP and Album

$15                                                              Credits + Digital EP and Album

$15                       Limited! Credits + Digital + "Supermarket" copy

$20                                            Credits + Digital + "Supermarket" copy

$30                             Credits + Digital + Signed "Supermarket" copy

$45                                   Credits + Digital + Signed copy + Vinyl copy

$60        Credits + Digital + Signed copy + Vinyl + Poster + T-Shirt

$100                 $60 Perks + Create some beats, a piece of lyrics or

                                                       anything you want for a Bonus Track


If I get to my funding goal, Supermarket would be done as described previously. If I don't reach the goal, I'd have to record the songs I can afford with that amount. But, If I exceed the goal, then I'll probably add more songs to the album,  spend more on production (so I can have an even better product), and I might even consider making a Deluxe Edition!

Considering this is an album, and music production can be really expensive, why do I need so little money compared to other artists? I'm recording with my own equipment and with people I already know, which makes it cheaper. I'm working on the stuff I need, but the money I already have for the project won't be enough to record and mix every song.


Drum Programming                                  $200

Bass, Guitars (Electric, Acoustic)           $180

Arrangements, Piano, Strings                $240

Vocals Recording                                      $300

Mixing & Mastering                                  $460

Design                                                           $50

Indiegogo Fees                                            $80


I would really love to have "Supermarket" in my hands, I've been dreaming about it for a long long time. The only way I can do this is with your help.

That would be it, folks, please remember to share this project. Thanks for the support!

$30                             Credits + Digital + Signed "Supermarket" copy
$45                                   Credits + Digital + Signed copy + Vinyl copy
$60        Credits + Digital + Signed copy + Vinyl + Poster + T-Shirt
$100                 $60 Perks + Create some beats, a piece of lyrics or
                                                       anything you want for a Bonus Track


If I get to my funding goal, Supermarket would be done as described previously. If I don't reach the goal, I'd have to record the songs I can afford with that amount. But, If I exceed the goal, then I'll probably add more songs to the album,  spend more on production (so I can have an even better product), and I might even consider making a Deluxe Edition!
Considering this is an album, and music production can be really expensive, why do I need so little money compared to other artists? I'm recording with my own equipment and with people I already know, which makes it cheaper. I'm working on the stuff I need, but the money I already have for the project won't be enough to record and mix every song.





Drum Programming                                  $200
Bass, Guitars (Electric, Acoustic)           $180
Arrangements, Piano, Strings                $240
Vocals Recording                                      $300
Mixing & Mastering                                  $460
Design                                                           $50
Indiegogo Fees                                            $80

I would really love to have "Supermarket" in my hands, I've been dreaming about it for a long long time. The only way I can do this is with your help.
That would be it, folks, please remember to share this project. Thanks for the support!

story:
As a musician, I work aallmmoosstt exclusively with dance and theater in the New England area. In deciding to make my first full-length album, Off Grid, I found a good excuse to finally turn the tables!

Instead of making music for dance or writing songs for actors, now the dancers and actors are making their art for the music. Check out 4 released videos on Youtube:
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL1jy0yfz...
Featuring a half dozen dancers, a flamenco guitarist, and a Rube Goldberg Machine!

We are asking for $4500. We have 15 amazing artists that HAVE NOT SEEN A CENT and we'd like to give them something for their work.
$1500 will go to the dancers, singers, actors, visual artist that have been involved.
$1000 will go to our amazing mixing and mastering engineer.
$500 will go to our graphic designer.
$1200 is for printing the CD and DVD!
$300 for stickers, t-shirts and other fun.

story:
Om Projektet

Hej jeg hedder Kim Hot, jeg har lavet kompromisløst gangstarap i årevis, nu vil jeg lave endnu en ny EP til jer. Håber i vil støtte mig.

  • Jeg kommer fra Hundige jeg Rapper.
  • Mit album P.I.K. Produkt I Kølvandet er i produktion men det koster meget at få over rampen.
  • I vil med kampagnen hjælpe mig med med mix og master af pladen, musikvideoer, studietid, grafik alt der omhandler min musik, håber i vil hjælpe.

I Støtter Kongen når i giver

•Støt projektet 0-50kr

•50kr: album digitalt

•100kr: Højopløselig optagelse af kongen på lokum plus digitalt album

•200kr: Kim hot t-shirt plus digital album

•5000kr: Kongen indspiller en personlig sang til dig eller en ven

•7500kr: Signeret Kim hot t-shirt plus Signeret digital album og Kongen kommer forbi og laver Kylling Creme Fini til dig og 3 venner

•10.000kr: Signeret Kim Hot t-shirt plus Signeret digital album og Intim koncert med kongen hjemme i stuen

Det hjælper i med

Hele Kim Hot holdet bestræber sig på at lave det sjoveste til jer, hvis i støtter vores projekt kan vi lave en mere fuldendt pakke til jer og komme ud med et stærkere projekt.

Udfordringer

Vi vil gerne have en flot video mix master og have budskabet ud, med jeres hjælp kan vi gøre Kim Hot projektet endnu vildere, vi håber i vil støtte.

Andre måder at hjælpe

Del og spred ordet om Kim Hot og lad det vokse sig større. Husk, at vi prøver at få jer til at have det sjovt.

De bedste hilsner fra hele Kim Hot holdet.

Det hjælper i med
Hele Kim Hot holdet bestræber sig på at lave det sjoveste til jer, hvis i støtter vores projekt kan vi lave en mere fuldendt pakke til jer og komme ud med et stærkere projekt.

Vi vil gerne have en flot video mix master og have budskabet ud, med jeres hjælp kan vi gøre Kim Hot projektet endnu vildere, vi håber i vil støtte.

Del og spred ordet om Kim Hot og lad det vokse sig større. Husk, at vi prøver at få jer til at have det sjovt.

story:
Devo, The Residents, Negativland all have much in common. Each has approached the notion of a band in unique ways. Each have had critical success. Each of these groups takes the notion of a song and creates beautiful alternatives. These bands use technology as an experimental canvas, where new and older electronics act as brushes. The most important thread among these groups is longevity, each has existed for over 30 years and have never steered from the path of celebrating the unusual . 

We have great footage so far, which includes recent performances, and extensive interviews with Mark Hosler, Peter Conheim and Don Joyce. Also interviews with fans and collaborators, such as, Steve Fisk, Amy Denio, David Minnick. We have access to all of Negativland's archive, so the film will have photos and videos that have never been seen before. 

This campaign exists to help us finish the film. We have it about 1/2 shot, but still have some crucial interviews to do, which constitutes traveling to various locations around the country. We also need to buy more hard drive storage, which is so essential to the editing and archival process. 

ABOUT THE FILMMAKERS: The Negativland movie is a collaboration between William Davenport and Leah Gold. 

Leah is a Filmmaker, Musician, Radio host, Conceptual, Textural and Performance artist. Her background includes Visual Art, Radio, Music and Video projects throughout the USA and Europe. She studied Dada in Berlin as part of her BA from Evergreen State College and created a Conceptual Art Cookie Company in Portland, Or. as part of her social work helping homeless, at-risk youth. She has made a number of short films that have been screened internationally and has won numerous awards. 

Her website: www.vaginajones.com

Watch some of Leah's videos here:


William Davenport is an independent filmmaker, teacher, writer, interdisciplinary artist and musician. He was the publisher and editor of Unsound magazine from 1983 to 1987. He was also the founder of the innovative band Problemist, who released many recordings internationally, most notably their LP critically acclaimed “Nine Times Sanity”, through the French label Sordide Sentimental. More recently he has worked on many award winning film productions and has shown his work at film festivals around the world. William was the Executive Director of the Autism Social Connection, where he created a unique filmmaking program for teaching social skills to children, teens and adults on the autism spectrum. In 2011 he released the feature documentary “Too Sane for This World”, and 2013 he released “Citizen Autistic”, both films explore the world of autism. In 2015 he completed two feature documentaries about music, “The New Punks” and “The Great American Cassette Masters”. He holds advanced degrees in technology, education and art.

His website: http://www.talkstoryfilms.net/

Watch some of William's videos here:


THE NEGATIVLAND STORY 

(from http://www.negativland.com/news/?page_id=250)

Since 1980, the 4 or 5 or 6 Floptops known as Negativland, a performance and recording group based in the San Francisco Bay Area, have been creating records, CDs, video, fine art, books, radio and live performance using appropriated sounds, images, objects, and text. Mixing original materials and original music with things taken from corporately owned mass culture and the world around them, Negativland re-arranges these found bits and pieces to make them say and suggest things that they never intended to. In doing this kind of cultural archaeology and “culture jamming” (a term they coined way back in 1984), Negativland have been sued twice for copyright infringement.

Over the years Negativland’s “illegal” collage and appropriation-based audio and visual works have touched on many things – pranks, media hoaxes, advertising, media literacy, religion, the evolving art of collage, the bizarre banality of suburban existence, creative anti-corporate activism in a media-saturated and multi-national world, file sharing, intellectual property issues, wacky surrealism, evolving notions of art and ownership and law in a digital age, and artistic and humorous observations of mass media and mass culture.

While it is true that, after being sued, Negativland became more publicly involved in advocating significant reforms of our nation’s copyright laws (more recently finding themselves being brought to Washington DC and Capitol Hill as citizen lobbyists for copyright and art issues), Negativland are artists first and activists second. All of their art and media interventions have intended to pose both serious and silly questions about the nature of sound, media, control, ownership, propaganda and perception in the United States of America. Their work is now referenced and taught in many college courses in the US, has been written about and mentioned in over 150 books (including “No Logo” by Naomi Klein, “Media Virus” by Douglas Rushkoff, and various biographies of the band U2), cited in legal journals, and they often lecture about their work here and in Europe.

Since 1981, Negativland and an evolving cast of characters have operated “Over The Edge,” a weekly radio show on KPFA FM in Berkeley, California. “Over The Edge” continues to broadcast three hours of live, found-sound mixing every Thursday at midnight, West Coast time, also streamed online. In 1995 they released a 270-page book with 72-minute CD entitled “Fair Use: The Story of the Letter U and the Numeral 2,” documenting their infamous four-year long legal battle over their 1991 release of an audio piece entitled “U2”. They were the subjects of Craig Baldwin’s 1995 feature documentary “Sonic Outlaws” and created the soundtrack and sound design for Harold Boihem’s 1997 documentary film “The Ad And The Ego,” an excellent in-depth look into the hidden agendas of the corporate ad world and the ways that we are affected by advertising. In 2004 Negativland worked with Creative Commons to write the Creative Commons Sampling License, an alternative to existing copyrights that is now widely used by many artists, writers, musicians, film makers, and websites. In 2005, they released the elaborately packaged “No Business” (with CD, 15,000-word essay, and custom-made whoopie cushion), and debuted “Negativlandland” – a large visual art show of over 80 pieces of their “fine art” works, videos, home-made electronic devices, and a life-sized animatronic Abe Lincoln robot, at New York City’s Gigantic Art Space. That art exhibit continues to change and evolve and has traveled around the country, showing in Los Angeles, Seattle, Minneapolis, Houston, and Richmond, VA.

In 2007, Negativland released “Our Favorite Things”, a feature-length DVD collection of their many years of collaborative film work, and in 2008 they surprised themselves and everybody else by putting out a toe-tapping all-songs project of one member’s compositions called “Negativland Presents Thigmotactic,” and they continue to occasionally visit Washington DC as citizen lobbyists.

More recently, Negativland has been performing a show of radically new audio-visual versions of many Negativland fan-favorites that have never before been heard live. Negativland’s current performance project, entitled “Content!,” finds them teaming up with electronic musician Wobbly, and “live cinema” video artist Steev Hise, to create a visual and sonic performance that reinvents favorite past and present dialog cut-ups, while showcasing Negativland’s homemade electronic noise-making devices that they call “Boopers,” and relying heavily on group improvisation.

And in 2014, for their first new audio release in six years, “It’s All In Your Head” finds the group tackling their biggest subject ever: God.  This ambitious and densely-crafted double CD is packaged inside an actual King James Holy Bible which has been appropriately repurposed into a “found” art object. Negativland mixes found music, found sound, found dialogue, guest personalities and original electronic noises into a compelling and thoughtful musical essay on monotheism, Christianity, Islam, Judaism, neuroscience, suicide bombers, 9/11, colas, war, shaved chimps, and the all-important role played by the human brain in our beliefs. The audio is presented as a live radio broadcast (modeled after the “Over the Edge” radio program). This theater-of-the-mind project has been assembled from basic tracks recorded live in front of blindfolded studio audiences, and documents the unique style of live collage performances that Negativland has been presenting on stages, and on radio, since the formation of the group in 1980.


BIG TIME MEDIA QUOTES ABOUT NEGATIVLAND’S WORK THAT MAKE THEM SOUND LEGIT- 

Declared heroic by their peers for refashioning culture into what the group considers to be more honest statements, Negativland suggests that refusing to be original, in the traditional sense, is the only way to make art that has any depth within commodity capitalism…

– NEW YORK TIMES

Negativland isn’t just some group of merry pranksters; its art is about tearing apart and reassembling found images, objects, and sounds to create new ones, in an attempt to make social, political and artistic statements. Hilarious and chilling.

– THE ONION

It’s an often ignored request, but you may pay more attention to the phrase “Please remember to take all your belongings” after seeing Negativland’s eerily mesmerizing new project…

– NEWSWEEK

Negativland is arguably the preeminent audio collage collective of our time.

– HI FRUCTOSE

Negativland argues persuasively that creators should be able to appropriate bits and pieces of anything and incorporate then into their work without fear of legal action.

– UTNE READER

Negativland, longtime advocates of fair use allowances for pop media collage, are perhaps America’s most skilled plunderers from the detritus of 20th century commercial culture…the band’s latest project is razor sharp, microscopically focused, terribly fun and a bit psychotic.

– WIRED MAGAZINE

For more than 20 years, Negativland has earned renown for manipulation of both tape and media.

– LOS ANGELES TIMES

Collage pioneers…..genre-defying, densely layered, strangely accessible…..

– WASHINGTON POST

Negativland…known for their media pranks….

– TIME MAGAZINE

Negativland are at it again…a parody of soft drink marketing.

– ENTERTAINMENT WEEKLY

Scathing and entertaining…they believe that the sheer volume of advertising is degrading to the mental and physical environment

– BUSINESS WEEK

A provocation and a punk-inspired commentary on our mercenary culture…eloquent and impassioned spokesmen for ideas like a “creative commons”…it’s salutary to see these smart and influential guys get a gallery show.

– ART IN AMERICA

Fearless artistes or foolhardy risk-takers….by constantly haranguing the listener with authentic advertising spiel and highlighting its transparency, they kill the messenger, kill the message and produce highly entertaining art simultaneously.

– L.A. WEEKLY

Musical-collage pioneers…..genre-defying, densely layered, strangely accessible…..

– URB

Twisted genius…compelling…..parody and satire as a grass roots weapon of consumer resistance.

– ROLLING STONE

The band hilariously juxtapose and layer sound bites and jingles…to help their targets hang themselves. What if the Pepsi execs actually like the album?

– SPIN

story:
My name is Johnny Graham. I am a singer/songwriter residing between Ayrshire and Glasgow. I released an album titled "Love Is Blind" almost 3 years ago and am looking to begin recording the follow up to that.
Unfortunately with commuting so much to my day job I am finding it difficult to keep funds aside for this project. So that's where I hope you can help. As fans it is you I want to get the new material released for. I strongly believe it will easily surpass the quality of my debut and am desperate for you all to hear it. On top of recording the album some funds will be put towards the official video for the first single from the album. All remaining funds will go towards marketing and distribution. 
What you can expect from your donations;
£1 - One digital copy of a single track of your choosing from the upcoming album.
£5 - One pair of tickets to a show of mine in the future.
£10 - One signed copy of the new album when available.
£15 - One signed copy each of both albums.
£20 - One pair of tickets and backstage passes to a future show.
£50 - One song from the album dedicated to you with a credit on the sleeve. 
£70 - Copies of both albums signed, pair of tickets to an upcoming show and cameo appearance in the video for the first single.
£100 - Pair of tickets, backstage passes, both albums, song credit & one day in the recording studio to listen in on a song of your choosing.

Thanks in advance for your help, the band and I really appreciate any help offered no matter how small.

story:
Gunner Gunner is an ambitious group of Rock n' Roll rebels from the streets of San Diego, CA, pushing the limits of live Rock n' Roll music entertainment with Josh Blevins on lead vocals, Christian Borja lead guitars, Kyle Wright rhythm guitars, Adrian "ODZ" DeLeon on bass, and Brian Baker on drums, the possibilities are infinite on what they can achieve. 

In March 2014 Gunner Gunner hit the studio to record their first EP. With only five months under their belt, the EP was a huge success, receiving airplay on over thirty radio stations around the world. This success didn't come cheap; Gunner Gunner's core values are hard work, dedication and perseverance. From the moment they wake up, to the point their brains just turn off, this is how Gunner Gunner achieves success. 
With the buzz from their Ep spreading through the San Diego music scene like wildfire, Gunner Gunner had no choice but to get right back in the studio. Hitting their one year anniversary in October, Gunner Gunner released their latest EP "Our Time". From this EP things only got bigger. From radio interviews with San Diego local radio DJ legend Tim Pyles, winning Rock 105.3's very first local spotlight, winning 710 Beach Club's Battle of the Bands number one Rock n' Roll band, obtaining sponsorships from Coldcock Whiskey, Tribal Clothing, Orange Theory Fitness, Syk Ostitch Patching, and Pusser's Rum, to opening up for national acts Such as Lita Ford, FUEL, and Lynyrd Skynyrd. The guys knew it was time to take their show on the road. 
Gunner Gunner is scheduled to hit the road March 13th of this year. With twelve shows, in twelve cities, in over six different states, booking, planning, and funding the tour by themselves is no easy task. They have been planning and working on this tour every day since August 2014. Saving every penny they've made since then still isn't enough to cover the $8,000 they need to make it. 
With the expenses of a full van, trailer, gas, a place to sleep, food, and two weeks loss of work, it is a big decision and risk for every individual. With their hard work and help from their sponsors they've managed to raise $5,000, which means only $3,000 left to go. We Hope to achieve this with your help! A simple donation to help us pursue our dreams in exchange for an awesome Gunner Gunner package is all we can ask for. We have lots of great things to choose from and we worked really hard on making each package the best we could. So please take a look and see if you'd be able to help us out. Even the smallest contribution is greatly appreciated. 
We hope to see you in a city near you March 2015! 
HELP A HARD WORKING BAND AND DONATE TODAY :) 
\m/ \m/

story:
Hi everyone,

My name is Pablo Mora Brito and I am a native of Caracas, Venezuela.

Just like many other people of my generation, I am trying to make a difference in the world. In addition to my professional background in political science and international relations, I have developed a very successful career as a rock performer in my home country, Venezuela. Music is my biggest passion and has become my main and most important means of expression, particularly for advocacy purposes.

The current situation of Venezuela, however, makes it extremely hard for young people to thrive and prosper, regardless of their area of influence or field of expertise. Violations to human rights and freedom of speech, state-led censorship and repression, shortages of food and basic goods, rampant corruption and a crippled economy make it almost impossible for anyone to move forward and flourish.

After a great deal of work and effort, one of my biggest dreams came true: I was admitted to The Collective School of Music in New York to continue my studies in percussion and get much better at what I do. This is an amazing and unique opportunity for me to grow, build new networks, and scale up the different music-related initiatives I have led in Venezuela over the last few years.

Due to severe economic constraints in Venezuela, including a very restrictive foreign exchange control regime, I am unable to find the resources to attend The Collective at this moment. And, in this context, I appeal to you for support and generosity in order to raise USD 10,000 to complete my tuition expenses. I was lucky enough to receive a scholarship from The Collective as well as other donations (living expenses, insurance and pocket money) from relatives and friends, but I still need to complete the cost of my certification.

This is the cost breakdown of my course:

  • Full cost: USD 17,000
  • Merit scholarship and reduced tuition credit: USD 7,000
  • Tuition balance: USD 10,000

Help me make a difference with my music and bring change to my country. Your support means the world to me! Many thanks in advance for your contribution!

story:
Hi I'm Jayson Richmond,

I'm 27 years old and I live in West Virginia. Before taking up writing music I served in the United States Navy. 
Music has always been my passion and dream. Right now I am closer than I have ever been to completing that dream. I'm writing with some extremely talented artist that I know you will be soon hearing on the radio. I have several songs ready for production and would like to start a production fund. You can check out a lot of samples of my work on Instagram my screen name is the_real_jayson_richmond. I have a huge amount of backing for just being a writer and I am very appreciative for that. 
My music is no way negative. I write country music and I try my best to always be a good influence on our young crowd. I have the skills to be successful in music and in setting a good lead for our young kids. 
My future plans which are under way is to start my own label under a LLC. Like I said music has always been my passion and I have a lot of people who are waiting on this music to come out! Any help for production costs would be amazing!

story:
Short Summary

lightcraft is a five-piece indie-rock/dream-pop band from Jakarta, Indonesia, a land that is rife with corruption and political chaos. We make music that comes straight from the heart, derived from our respective experiences in life, music that is melancholic yet anthemic, which aims to tug your heartstrings and lift you up at the same time. After meeting each other during their university days in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, lightcraft was formed in 2004. By 2006, we released an EP titled "The Modern Seasons", which caught the eye of the local music scene. In 2008, a debut album followed, called "Losing Northern Lights". After a series of line-up changes, they finally reconvened in their hometown of Jakarta, and proceeded to officially unveil their sophomore album, "Colours Of Joy", in January 2014.

lightcraft has performed at shows and festivals in a number of countries across South-East Asia, including Malaysia, Singapore, Thailand and Indonesia. In 2014, the band managed to play the prestigious Baybeats Music Festival 2014 in Singapore, as well as Java Soundsfair 2014 in Jakarta, Indonesia. In January 2015, lightcraft played their first-ever show on Indian shores - and their first outside of South-East Asia - when they performed at Saarang 2015 in Chennai, India. Before they went to India, however, they were notified of something very monumental in their musical journey so far: lightcraft was invited to perform at Canadian Music Week 2015.

We were shocked, to say the least. Our dream was to spread our wings as wide as possible, and suddenly, we were given the opportunity to do so at a music festival that is rich in history; recognised as one of the best music events in North America, and indeed, the world. This could be the big break that we need, and on a larger scale, what the Indonesian music industry needs. This year - having been going on for 33 years - Canadian Music Week (or CMW) is set to showcase the likes of The Jesus & Mary Chain, Noel Gallagher's High Flying Birds, John Mellencamp, Alvvays, Lights, Colbie Caillat, Ben Lee, and many more, all descending upon Toronto and performing across ten days from May 1-10, 2015 in various venues dotted around the city. For lightcraft to be chosen among them as a representative of Indonesia is a very big deal indeed, both for us and for our country.

Thus, what we would like to ask of you is this: help us get there, help us fulfil the dreams of many and help us open the door for our fellow compatriots in the Indonesian music industry so that we can show the world what we're made of. We need you to help fund our flight tickets and accommodation costs, so that we could fulfil the invitation to perform at Canadian Music Week 2015; so that we could make Indonesia proud; so that we could help place Indonesia under the global spotlight as a force to be reckoned with in terms of our music industry.

What We Need & What You Get

We're going to be very straightforward here: the amount we need that we've calculated to get us to fly out to Toronto, Canada and bag an adequate place to stay is approximately US$10,000. That amount will cover all five members of the band's return flight tickets from Jakarta to Toronto and back, as well as accommodation for ten days, but if we could raise at least US$8,000 from you via Indiegogo, then we'll be more than happy. Why will we be there for the whole duration of Canadian Music Week 2015, you ask? Because besides playing showcases that are organised by CMW 2015, we will also be playing shows outside of the festival, and if things go as planned, we shall be performing in a couple of cities around Toronto, including Mississauga and Hamilton. We've also made plans to follow all the seminars and talks that will be part of the festival, so that we could learn a lot of stuff about the music industry on a global scale and bring back home that priceless knowledge and apply that to the local music industry in Indonesia.

To be honest, we wouldn't be able to afford half of the total amount of money on our monthly wages alone, let alone the full US$8,000. That's why we need your help. But don't worry, as there are a few rewards in store for those of you who have parted with their hard-earned money to assist in our cause: social media mentions, handwritten postcards, pins, t-shirts, CDs, your name mentioned in our next album credits, signed merchandise and more!

If all does not go to plan, the funds that you have pledged will be partially donated to a charity of your choice, while the rest of it will be used to fund the recording sessions of our next album, which we are planning on releasing in early 2016. So we assure you that your money will not go to waste!

The Impact

Imagine the possibilities that could happen if your contributions were to successfully get us to Toronto, Canada for Canadian Music Week 2015. It could spell a new era for the Indonesian music industry; an industry that is brimming with untapped talents. It could also help in putting Indonesia under the global spotlight as a country. People will definitely notice what Indonesian musicians can do, and people will finally discover what Indonesia is really like: a developing country with cultural heritage and creative minds that could help in changing the world for the better. You won't just be giving lightcraft a helping hand; you'll be helping a whole country. And we promise that we will try our best to make what we've just said a reality, because it is possible.

Risks & Challenges

Let's face it: there will be hundreds of acts that will be playing Canadian Music Week 2015 armed with the same aims as we are, and they're there because they're awesome. Your funds, however, will prove to be a major help as we try our darnedest to get ourselves noticed while we're there; so that we are able to deliver on our promises.

The second risk that we may face is show cancellations. As you might've noticed, many gigs have fallen victim to getting cancelled due to various reasons, be they floods, fire, cancelled flights and more. We sincerely hope that none of them will happen when we get there, but we just want you to understand that there's always those risks lingering around.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute for some reason, hey, we understand. But what you can do, though, is to help us spread the word about our campaign. Tell your family, relatives, friends, work colleagues, football teammates, and anybody else that you could think of, and get them to pledge to our cause or spread the word as well!

story:
Dare You to Move: A Cover Together!


Short Summary

In early 2014 Mike & Nick discovered they had similar interests in music. Since then, the two have been growing into strong musicians and vocalists. They started by covering songs and playing at local open mic nights in the greater Fort Wayne area. Together their musical chemistry has grown and they have begun writing their own music. Looking to produce their first album, they are excited for what the future holds for them as they look to commit their lives to music.

Mike & Nick are starting this campaign to raise the money they need to be able to take their music to the next level. Wanting to be able to have shows and tour, they are looking to their supporters for help. 

We are looking to raise $5,000.00!

What We Need & What You Get

Like we said, we are trying to raise $5,000. Us as artists are investing our own money into this, but we can't do it by ourselves! We want to break down the costs for you, so you can see what you are helping us achieve! 
  • Acoustic Electric Guitar - $1,349.99
  • Electric Amp - $379.99
  • Mic - $99.00
  • 20 Cables (for mics and guitars) - $369.80
  • Guitar Effect Pedals - $500.00
  • PA System - $1,000.00
  • Accessories (picks, straps, strings, cable splitters) - $500.00
  • Media Relations (Website, Marketing, Photography, and Booking) - 750.00
Here is the fun part for you! What do you get for contributing to our goal?!
  • At the $20 level: you will receive a signed copy of our first album!
  • At the $100 level: you will receive a signed copy of our first album, a personalized message, and *VIP access!
  • At the $250 level: you will receive a signed copy of our first album, a personalized message, **Premium VIP access, and a personal Skype call with you and closest friends/family!  
We anticipate hitting our goal, but we want to cover our grounds and let you know where your money will go if we fall short of our goal. If you hit one of the levels of donation, you will still get those things! We prioritized the break down of what we are raising money for and will apply what we raise to those things in order! 
*VIP Access (1 year access): free live track download every month, band Q&A, insiders sweepstakes.
**Premium VIP Access (1 year access): free live track download every month, band Q&A, insiders sweepstakes, monthly postcard, early access to ticket presales, our first album on vinyl.
The Impact

Bono once said that, "Music can change the world, because it can change people."  That is what we want to do as artists; we want to share our music with the world!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not all of you will be able to invest financially, but we can still use your help! Please help us spread the word, and share us to your friends and family! There are quick share links you can utilize on this page for Facebook, Twitter, and Google+.

story:
Il Cantiere Internazionale d’Arte di Montepulciano compie 40 anni, con la direzione artistica del maestro Roland Böer. Nello spirito del suo fondatore, il compositore Hans Werner Henze, la musica, l’opera, il teatro, la danza, animeranno di nuovo lo splendore delle piazze, dei vicoli, delle chiese; e le terre della Toscana più autentica.

Il Cantiere non è un festival come gli altri: in questi 40 anni, artisti di fama internazionale provenienti da tutto il mondo hanno offerto spontaneamente e senza compenso il loro lavoro per i giovani del territorio, coinvolgendo cittadini, turisti, appassionati, in un vortice di idee creative che diventano progetti didattici e culturali unici in Europa.

Quest’anno, per il nostro compleanno, unisciti a noi!


Regala anche tu un’emozione a Montepulciano.
Per far proseguire la musica, dai il tuo contributo alla cultura e alla bellezza.
Sarà il più bel dono per i nostri primi 40 anni. 


Cantiere Internazionale d’Arte of Montepulciano turns  40. In the spirit of its founder, the composer Hans Werner Henze, music, opera, theater and dance will once again enliven the splendor of squares, alleyways and churches; and the heartlands of truly authentic Tuscany.

The Cantiere festival is unlike any other; in these 40 years, internationally renowned artists the world over have offered to work, spontaneously and without pay, for the youth of the area, involving citizens, tourists, and enthusiasts in a whirlwind of creative ideas that become didactic and cultural projects unique in Europe. 

Join us this year for our birthday!

You too can give an emotion to Montepulciano.
Keep the music happening - make your contribution to culture and beauty.
It'll be the nicest gift we get for our first 40 years. 

40° CANTIERE INTERNAZIONALE D'ARTE

TRA MONTEPULCIANO E LE TERRE DI SIENA
11 LUGLIO - 1 AGOSTO 2015

Opera lirica, concerti sinfonici, danza contemporanea, musica, teatro
50 eventi dislocati in 8 Comuni della Valdichiana, dall’11 luglio all’1 agosto. 
La Banda dell’Aeronautica ricorda il centenario della Grande Guerra
"Idroscalo Pasolini", la prima opera su Pier Paolo Pasolini
"La finta semplice", l'opera di Mozart con la regia di Caterina Liberovici
Tre celebri direttori d’orchestra per il Concerto di Chiusura
 

Opera lirica, concerti sinfonici e cameristici, danza contemporanea, teatro, jazz e concerti di mezzanotte: 40 appuntamenti dislocati su 8 centri delle Terre di Siena nell’arco di 22 giorni, conoltre 400 artisti internazionali coinvolti. Il Cantiere Internazionale d’Arte, ideato nel 1976 da Hans Werner Henze, prevede l’interazione tra professionisti internazionali e giovani talenti che si esprimono in una residenza creativa ambientata tra le ricchezze architettoniche e paesaggistiche di Montepulciano. L’edizione numero 40 va in scena dall’11 luglio all’1 agosto 2015 e s’incentra su un tema ambizioso: Terra, guerra e pace. La programmazione si pone diversi quesiti culturali, a partire dalla riflessione sul centenario dall’entrata dell’Italia nella Prima Guerra Mondiale. Dall’attenzione alla Terra e alle terre, concetto che tra l’altro ispira anche l’EXPO 2015, emerge lo spirito di un festival che si estende sugli scorci più pittoreschi di Cetona, Chianciano Terme, San Casciano dei Bagni, Sarteano, Sinalunga, Torrita di Siena e Trequanda. 

Hans Werner Henze e i ragazzi di Montepulciano, foto di Antonio Fatini
story_txt:
Il
Cantiere Internazionale d’Arte di Montepulciano compie 40 anni, con la direzione artistica del maestro Roland Böer. Nello spirito
del suo fondatore, il compositore Hans Werner Henze, la musica, l’opera, il
teatro, la danza, animeranno di nuovo lo splendore delle piazze, dei vicoli,
delle chiese; e le terre della Toscana più autentica. 

Il Cantiere non è un festival come gli altri: in questi 40 anni, artisti di
fama internazionale provenienti da tutto il mondo hanno offerto spontaneamente
e senza compenso il loro lavoro per i giovani del territorio, coinvolgendo
cittadini, turisti, appassionati, in un vortice di idee creative che diventano
progetti didattici e culturali unici in Europa. 

Quest’anno, per il nostro compleanno, unisciti a noi! 

Regala anche tu un’emozione a Montepulciano. Per far proseguire la musica, dai
il tuo contributo alla cultura e alla bellezza. Sarà il più bel dono per i
nostri primi 40 anni. 
Cantiere
Internazionale d’Arte of Montepulciano turns 
40. In the spirit of its founder, the composer Hans Werner Henze, music,
opera, theater and dance will once again enliven the splendor of squares,
alleyways and churches; and the heartlands of truly authentic Tuscany. 

The Cantiere festival is unlike any other; in these 40 years, internationally
renowned artists the world over have offered to work, spontaneously and without
pay, for the youth of the area, involving citizens, tourists, and enthusiasts in
a whirlwind of creative ideas that become didactic and cultural projects unique
in Europe.  

Join us this year for our birthday! 

You too can give an emotion to Montepulciano. Keep the music happening - make
your contribution to culture and beauty. It'll be the nicest gift we get for
our first 40 years. 40° CANTIERE INTERNAZIONALE D'ARTE
TRA MONTEPULCIANO E LE TERRE DI SIENA11 LUGLIO - 1 AGOSTO 2015

Opera lirica, concerti sinfonici, danza contemporanea, musica, teatro50 eventi dislocati in 8 Comuni della Valdichiana, dall’11 luglio all’1 agosto. La Banda dell’Aeronautica ricorda il centenario della Grande Guerra"Idroscalo Pasolini", la prima opera su Pier Paolo Pasolini"La finta semplice", l'opera di Mozart con la regia di Caterina LiberoviciTre celebri direttori d’orchestra per il Concerto di Chiusura 

Opera lirica, concerti sinfonici e cameristici, danza contemporanea, teatro, jazz e concerti di mezzanotte: 40 appuntamenti dislocati su 8 centri delle Terre di Siena nell’arco di 22 giorni, conoltre 400 artisti internazionali coinvolti. Il Cantiere Internazionale d’Arte, ideato nel 1976 da Hans Werner Henze, prevede l’interazione tra professionisti internazionali e giovani talenti che si esprimono in una residenza creativa ambientata tra le ricchezze architettoniche e paesaggistiche di Montepulciano. L’edizione numero 40 va in scena dall’11 luglio all’1 agosto 2015 e s’incentra su un tema ambizioso: Terra, guerra e pace. La programmazione si pone diversi quesiti culturali, a partire dalla riflessione sul centenario dall’entrata dell’Italia nella Prima Guerra Mondiale. Dall’attenzione alla Terra e alle terre, concetto che tra l’altro ispira anche l’EXPO 2015, emerge lo spirito di un festival che si estende sugli scorci più pittoreschi di Cetona, Chianciano Terme, San Casciano dei Bagni, Sarteano, Sinalunga, Torrita di Siena e Trequanda.

story:
27 million. 12-14. 7200.

27 million people enslaved worldwide. 12-14 is the average age of entry for trafficking victims in the United States. Each month in the state of Georgia, 7200 men purchase sexual services from under-aged victims.

What can we do to help end the injustice that is modern-day slavery? This is the very question that our founder, Cameron Harris, asked himself when he started the Breaking the Shackles benefit concert in September 2011. The purpose of Breaking the Shackles is to educate people about the horrors of human trafficking and specifically shine a light on the exploitation of children. 

Breaking the Shackles has hosted three events, in which almost $9000 has been donated to youthSpark's A Future. Not a Past. campaign, Wellspring Living, Out of Darkness, and the International Justice Mission. Through our events, we have been able to raise funds that have been used to help rescue victims, and with your help we can help free others who are in bondage. Past Breaking the Shackles performers include The Museum, Unhindered, Brett Younker of Passion, Capital Kings, and Grammy-nominated bands Fireflight and After Edmund. 

This is where you come in! We have had very successful events in the past, but we need your help to bring Breaking the Shackles to Athens, Georgia. We have estimated that the total amount that we need to raise within the next two months is sitting at $2850. Any amount that we raise after that will go towards promotion and filing for 501(c)3 non-profit status. The event will be on Thursday, April 23, 2015 at the 40 Watt Club.

Our perk levels include everything from an IndieGoGo limited time t-shirt to event tickets to hand-crafted bags that were made by former trafficking victims! Join us in our fight to break the shackles of modern-day slavery.

Thanks,

BTS Team

story:
Welcome to New Music Horizons! 

Our mission is to support new and emerging contemporary jazz and classical composers by presenting them in concert and helping them to build new audiences for their work. It is our goal to help these composers reach people of diverse backgrounds by offering our concerts for low or no cost to the community. New Music Horizons seeks to share the excitement of listening to new music and help people experience music in a new way.

We will be presenting a series of 4 concerts in the spring and fall of 2015 in partnership with two great cultural institutions - The Clemente Soto Velez Cultural Center and Flushing Town Hall. At these concerts, audience members will get to hear the composers discuss and explain some examples of their music beforehand, and afterward meet the artists in an informal Q&A. 

Here's How You Can Help

We need to raise $3000 to help pay for the artists' fees for the series. Every dollar you give helps us bring this music to life. We're offering an array of perks for joining our campaign - music downloads, CD giveaways, house concerts, and the unique opportunity to see the music-making process in action. 

The Impact

This series will help to give emerging composers the critical support they need to get their music heard. Concerts at respected arts venues like these will help to raise each artist's profile and move their art forward, while sharing the excitement of new music with new audiences. 

Long term, your support of this project will show that this music matters and allow us to gain the support of sustaining foundation and corporate sponsors.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to contribute at this time, you can still make a difference by sharing this campaign with your friends and contacts. Thank you for supporting new music!

story:
THE ALBUM COVER

If you look closely you'll see the five members of Swim in the background.
Shot in Beautiful Stony Brook,NY
Photo courtesy of Caroline O'Callaghan

Who is SWIM?

- Dan M. / Nicky R. / Tyler A. / Brian D. / Justin I.


What is Swim?

- A rock band that does a lot of originals and a lot of other things, like the funk of Stevie Wonder and the folk of George Ezra. 

LISTEN TO OUR DEMO HERE

Our pride & joy: originals

- We spend a long time (months, sometimes) writing and arranging original songs. We want every second of them to be interesting, to be worth listening to. You will hear 5 of our best on this record. 

Where are we at?

- We're right now recording our very first EP (half-length album) and it's a thrilling experience. We're quite giddy about it, and we can guarantee it'll knock your socks off.




THE SONGS:

1) "Natural Feeling"

2) "Stay Up for the Moon"

3)"Only Jewels"

4) "Shake"

5)"Late Nights, Lately"



Where are we headed and what do we ask?

- We've covered the recording costs (which were higher than we'd thought they'd be) with all our $ made from playing shows over for the past year.

- We're also covering some of the packaging, artwork, etc. but ask your help in covering the rest. 


How much are we asking for?

- Our goal is $1000. 

  This will mostly cover the cost of physical copies of the CD's.  

Why contribute?

- First of all, let us introduce ourselves if we haven't met already:

swimrock.com/about

- We're not asking for donations but investments - and the return is guaranteed. Further, we're actually taking a loss on the physical albums (which will cost us more than $5 to make). 
- What we want is for you to throw on our EP in the car and have "Natural Feeling" blast through the speakers. Make "Stay Up For The Moon" one of your go-to party songs. Turn up "Late Nights Lately" during a midnight drive. 
- We're also eager to hang with you (at breakfast, in the mall, etc.) if you'd like to hang with us. Look for these perks under "Perks". 

The Rewards:
This IndieGogo Exclusive T-Shirt!



Any risks in contributing?
- NO RISKS. If we don't raise the full goal, we'll scrape together enough to finish the project and cover your perks.
Let us end with a full-hearted THANK YOU for all the Support!

story:
Who We Are

Formed in 2007, after the onset of the Saffron Rebellion, The Rebel Riot has been using music to fight against injustice, poverty, harsh censorship laws, and violent government crackdowns. In a country where the average musician struggles to get their hands on an instrument, let alone practice, The Rebel Riot has given a voice to those who are angry, frustrated, and disenchanted with the injustice around them, while creating an outlet to work for social change by any means possible; for example, by playing shows to raise money for different causes, caring for the disenfranchised, like HIV positive children and the mentally ill, feeding the homeless during weekly Food Not Bombs donation nights, and exposing the harsh living conditions and human rights violations of the Burmese people.

"Dressing in Punk style is a serious act of rebellion in Burma where most men still wear traditional dress...even in the economic capital Yangon (formerly Rangoon). But for the band Rebel Riot--- a leading force in the small punk scene ---punk is far more than just a superficial copy of its Western counterpart. Here, what is probably the most rebellious of all subcultures in the Southeast Asian country is going up against one of the world's most authoritarian regimes. Punk gives young Burmese a chance to symbolically spit in the face of the hated government, which took power in 2010 in the wake of what was widely considered a fraudulent election. Although the government has shown initial signs of greater open-mindedness, which included the release of political prisoners in recent months, Burma is still far from a state that embraces the rule of law (http://www.spiegel.de/international/zeitgeist/r...".

What We Need

We regularly play shows to raise awareness about the Burmese government and our work with Food Not Bombs (https://www.facebook.com/fnbmyanmar). Unfortunately, while we've had the chance to release two E.Ps (Puppet Society [2013] and Fuck Religious Rules [2014]), we still cannot afford our own instruments (we make about $65 USD a month). As a result, we need to save all our money just to rent them ($200 USD for 4 hrs!) and a place to practice, while still fighting for opportunities to play shows – a harsh reality not just for punks, but all musicians in Burma. This campaign will help us to raise the money to buy the instruments and gear that us and our community can use to play shows and spread our message to as many people as possible.

  • We priced out the gear at the local music shop, here in Rangoon, and it comes to about $4500 USD plus tax (and indiegogo fees).
                        Randall guitar amp
                        Bass amp
                        Schecter diamond series
                        TAMA drum w/ sambyl
                        Ibanez bass
                        Microphone w/ stand
                        Pod HD guitar effect
                        Monitor
               
  • This is a flexible fundraising campaign, so if we don't raise the goal, all donated funds will be used to purchase as much of the above gear as possible.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Sometimes you just can't give money, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

    • Share this campaign with your friends in-person and on blogs and social media.
    • Come to the fundraising event in Toronto and let your friends know about it (https://www.facebook.com/events/1516104308681617/)
    • Support your local Food Not Bombs chapter (http://foodnotbombs.net).

    Media

    • http://www.spiegel.de/international/zeitgeist/rotten-vicious-times-burma-s-punk-scene-fights-repression-underground-a-817185.html 
    • https://www.vice.com/en_ca/read/the-myanmar-punks-feeding-yangoons-homeless
    • http://www.thehindu.com/news/international/world/punk-bands-break-myanmars-silence-on-religious-attacks/article4991824.ece
    • http://www.daynews.com/world/local-news/2015/07...
    • https://therebelriot.bandcamp.com/
