story:
My name is Ascension Vargas~ Medicine Singer/Songwriter and activist with a mission to cultivate awareness and healing through the power of song and living truth!

I've got a potent bundle of songs that highlight the universal concept of love and light. These songs reflect the wonders of mother nature, transcendence, consciousness and my travels and transformation in Peru these past few years. Here's another example of my message through songwriting: songs: https://soundcloud.com/zstowasser/manyseeds-003-ascension-new

 I've been a folk musician for over 14 years with well over 50 original songs in my songbook. With a nice array of experience in solo/duo performing and band projects, I'm ready to record my 1st. Fully Mastered Studio Album.

  1. 11 original tracks
  2. 4-5 days in the studio ( Choosing between 2 studios in Nor Cal)
  3. 1 week of Mixing and Mastering
  4. 1 week of Hard Copy construction
  5. Poof!! 1 Debut Studio Album


What I Need & What You Get

$4,000 will cover HALF of my studio/mastering/distribution/reward fees
  • I really need $8,000 but I want to meet you and your donations, half way!!
  • $4,000 will be covering reward costs and mainly studio fees~ Stretch rewards will be offered if I exceed this amnt. By Nov 1st., which is when I'll be recording the full-length-album~ 
  • Along with the medicine of my album in digital or hard form, a lot of your rewards will be hand made, timeless medicine such as: Sage Rolls, Hand written original poems, Medicine pouches (loaded w/magic), Tobacco pouches, charged crystals, leather braided bracelets, Hummingbird feathered earrings and Silk Prayer Flags.
  • Even if my $4,000 goal to fund my album is not met half way, all donations will be processed and rewards granted in full by the End of February 2016!! Win-Win situation

The Impact

Authenticity has always been crucial to me and my music is rooted in this ideal

  • These are songs for creating awareness and praising Ancient Ancestral Wisdoms 
  • Your donations are lifting this praise into reality and investing in many more Albums to come! Its not cheap to make a quality product so your donations speak to your ethics in supporting quality and conscious material. 
  • Like a full circle, gratitude has no end and it is an eternal honor to offer thanks and contribute to the platform of already existing artists and musicians who also produce music with an illuminated message. Here's an interview I had on the radio show ManySeeds that gives you a deeper look into my evolution as a musician and activist for the healing arts: 
    • https://soundcloud.com/zstowasser/manyseeds-003-ascension-music
  • To speak to previous experience in studio work: I've been apart of recording a 5 track mastered EP with a previous Americana/Bluegrass project in Seattle called Lavender Lucy. Here's a video of one of my songs during that recording process: http://youtu.be/zBNLlguiBhk

Risks & Challenges

Life is tricky sometimes and can be overwhelming to balance priorities

  • I have no other major endeavors for the rest of the year and have put my travels on hault to complete this album by the end of the year and distribute all rewards by the end of february 2016. 
  • I have a few excellent friends that are helping me make sweet rewards and are keeping me on track with fulfilling my hearts purpose! 
  • I'm also extremely determined to get this done and I've completed every endeavor I've ever set out to accomplish!

story:
Background on Skyside 6

Skyside 6 is made up of Branden, Jake, Anthony and Delsin. They are not only band mates, but also best friends. With Branden on lead vocals and guitar, Jake on the drums, Delsin on guitar and heavy vocals, and Anthony on bass and backing vocals, they create a dynamic group seeking to make an impact. 

The Purpose and Perks

  • The funding raised by this campaign will go straight to helping us get the EP printed and distributed. Also an allotted amount will be put toward new sound equipment we will use during our live shows. 
  • The campaign perks range from $1 to an awesome "#1 Fan Pack". With multiple options to choose from we hope you find the one that best suits you! 

Don't Want To Donate?

Donations and perks are not the only way you can support us!

  • Give us a shout out on Facebook and Twitter! We will more than happily follow you and help spread the cause!

We hope you find a way to help support this cause and we appreciate you stopping by! Have a great day!!

Milestones

  • The funding raised will help us reach multiple financial milestones, thanks to your donations here are the goals we will be able to reach! 
  • $2,500 we will be able to print the E.P. and purchase the hardware needed for a portable P.A. system.
  • $3,000 we will be able to purchase a wireless monitor system and the cables necessary for the P.A. system.
  • $3,500 we will be able to afford a condenser microphone for our current home recording studio setup. Also if we reach our $3,500 goal we will throw a Free Pizza Party Concert for backers in the Omaha area! 
  • $354,678 AND WE WILL LOVE YOU FOREVER AND A DAY....AND DO A FREE NORTH AMERICA TOUR! 
IF WE REACH OUR $3,500 GOAL BRANDEN WILL CUT OFF ALL HIS LUSCIOUS HAIR! DON'T MISS THIS ONCE IN A LIFETIME OPPORTUNITY.....
 The physical E.P. will come with 4 bonus tracks.....
The First two will be announced here at $2500!
The Second two will be announced here at $3000!



Perk Examples!


Propoganda Package

Logo Shirt (xxxl pictured, Logo will normally take up much more of shirt).



A Tempting Deal


Suns Out, Guns Out!


Fan Girl


Mother Approved Package

'Fan'ny Pack


Personalized Concert Pack

 

Ultimate Fan Pack


Lover Pack

story:
My Story

My name is Jennifer Bellor and I am a composer who is passionate about producing music that crosses boundaries between contemporary classical, jazz, rock, and hip hop. I write music for big band, opera, large ensemble, small ensemble, dancers and artists. I have enjoyed so many wonderful opportunities along the way collaborating with talented musicians and artists from diverse musical and artistic backgrounds.

I was raised in Northern NY and became a classically-trained performer focusing on violin, French horn, piano, and voice. As an undergraduate at Cornell University, I began pursuing composition. This project will encompass and enhance my composition of the music, and my performance as a vocalist.

My passion to bring musicians from various backgrounds together started with musical relationships created with friends and colleagues back when I was studying at Eastman School of Music. In 2009, The New Jazz Ensemble Director Dave Rivello approached me about writing a piece for his ensemble, and I was inspired and encouraged to take pieces  that I wrote for a classical ensemble and create alternate versions. I was hooked; creating music that incorporates improvisation with my style of music was exactly what I wanted to do artistically. I experimented with different styles and instrumentation, and continued on an exciting path collaborating with musicians who were equally enthusiastic with what I was doing.

This is an mp3 of a recording from a performance of a piece originally written for jazz players, then arranged to combine both jazz and classical: jazz trumpet, string quartet, vibraphone, piano, bass, and drums. Jazz trumpet player Mike Kaupa approached me about writing this piece for him and his colleagues at Eastman School of Music in 2012. This piece is titled "Out of the Shadows":


Currently residing in Las Vegas, while teaching at UNLV, I have another opportunity for my growth as an artist; sharing ideas and collaborating with and getting to know the musicians. Last May, in a discussion with a fellow composer, I was introduced to the short story by Charles Baudelaire titled, "The Generous Gambler", and  encouraged to create a concept album based loosely off the story. While envisioning what my own concept album would be, I re-listened to some influences of mine such as Wax Tailor and Pink Floyd. I revised older pieces, composed new ones, and incorporated compositions like "Out of the Shadows". The album will be a tour through different levels of her own faults and desires. This is a recording from the first rehearsal of "Familiar Stranger" involving UNLV musicians. You can see the full video recording below, or access an excerpt by going to this link:

https://youtu.be/OkpKr0OYUyM?t=2m24s


This summer was spent composing and planning out how, when and where I will record. I will be using both the UNLV and Eastman studios to record. After rehearsals , December 4-6 will be the days I will record with UNLV musicians. Over winter break I will be traveling to Rochester, NY in order to record with Eastman musicians the pieces that involve jazz improvisation.  The pieces have varied instrumentation, ranging from smaller ensemble pieces featuring soprano, piano, electric guitar and bass, to larger ones that feature voice, string quartet, woodwinds, percussion and a rapper.

Creating an album has been a longtime dream of mine, and I am thrilled to have the opportunity to share and create my music with such wonderful musicians here in Las Vegas and in Rochester, NY. In order to complete this album, I need to make sure that I have the necessary funding for: time in the recording studios, mixing, and fair compensation for the talented performers taking time to prepare and record my music.

Please help me in making my dream a reality by contributing in any way you are able, whether it be by donation or sharing with your friends on social media.

What I Need & What You Get

In my discussions with the UNLV and Eastman recording studios, I found that in order for me to successfully record all thirteen tracks on my album,  mix each track, and compensate the 21  performers, I will need to raise at least $10,000.  After recording, I will spend the majority of winter break and early spring working with sound engineers to mix the recordings.

I have exciting perks for all of you so I can thank you for your contribution:

  • $15 Contribution: digital download
  • $25 Contribution: digital download, hard copy of CD, and video from the live performance of my album from the November 30th concert in Las Vegas.
  • $75 Contribution:  digital download, hard copy of CD, 2 bonus tracks, video from the live performance of my album, and a 'thank you' in the liner notes of the album.
  • $100 Contribution: digital download, hard copy of CD signed, 2 bonus tracks, video from the live performance of my album, a 'thank you' in the liner notes of the album, and one 10-15 minute video on how I wrote one of the pieces.
  • $250 Contribution: digital download, hard copy of CD signed,  2 bonus tracks, a 'thank you' in the liner notes of the album, video from the live performance of my album, one 10-15 minute video on how I wrote one of the pieces, and a hard copy of 1 signed score.
  • $500 Contribution: digital download, hard copy of CD signed,  2 bonus tracks, video from the live performance of my album, a 'thank you' in the liner notes of the album, one 10-15 minute video on how I wrote one of the  pieces, one 30-45 minute 'meet & greet' Skype session about my music, hard copy of 2 signed scores, a personalized handwritten 'thank you' note, and 1 ticket to Blue Man Group (up to $100 value).
  • $1000 Contribution: digital download, hard copy of CD signed, 2 bonus tracks, video from the live performance of my album, a 'thank you' in the liner notes of the album, one 10-15 minute video on how I wrote one of the pieces, one  30-45 minute 'meet & greet' Skype session about my music, 2 tickets to Blue Man Group (up to $100 value each), hard copies of 6 signed scores, a personalized hand-written 'thank you' note, and a private local concert (date and time TBA) within 25 miles of Rochester, NY or within 25 miles of Las Vegas, NV featuring music with small ensemble.
  • $ 2500: digital download, hard copy of CD signed, 2 bonus tracks, video from the live performance of my album, a 'thank you' in the liner notes of the album, one 10-15 minute video on how I wrote one of the pieces, one 30-45 minute 'meet & greet' Skype session about my music, a personalized hand-written 'thank you' note, 2 tickets to Blue Man Group (up to $100 value each), hard copies of all of the signed scores, a private local concert (date and time TBA) within 25 miles of Rochester, NY or within 25 miles of Las Vegas, NV featuring music with small ensemble, and dinner with the composer at a restaurant within 25 miles of Las Vegas, NV or within 25 miles of Rochester, NY, and one gift card to the Smith Center (up to $150 value).
  • $ 7500: digital download, hard copy of CD signed, 2 bonus tracks, video from the live performance of my album, a 'thank you' in the liner notes of the album, one 10-15 minute video on how I wrote one of the pieces, one 30-45 minute 'meet & greet' Skype session about my music, 2 tickets to Blue Man Group (up to $100 value each), a personalized hand-written 'thank you' note, hard copies of all of the signed scores, a private local concert (date and time TBA) within 25 miles of Rochester, NY or within 25 miles of Las Vegas, NV featuring music with small ensemble, one gift card to the Smith Center (up to $150 value), dinner with the composer at a restaurant within 25 miles of Las Vegas, NV or within 25 miles of Rochester, NY, a personalized composition dedicated to you or whomever you would like, and one night hotel stay on the strip ($175 value)!

Risks & Challenges

The risks are financial in nature as it is difficult for composers to create without patrons. It will be a challenge to work within deadlines in two different recording locations, and to successfully combine the different playing styles.

The Impact

The impact of overcoming all of these challenges will be a product of the best quality that I can deliver as an artist. It is important for composers to create and support new ideas in order to keep music alive. As a donor and supporter, you will have contributed to the creation of original work.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please check out all of the perks that are listed on my campaign site. Contributing to this campaign will make my dream a reality, and I thank you from the bottom of my heart for your support. Even if you are unable to contribute financially to this album at this time, I encourage you to share my campaign with all of your friends! Thank you!

story:
Why Fund Great Noise?

For the past ten years, Great Noise Ensemble has worked hard to grow, promote, and change the new music scene in Washington, D.C., bringing new ideas, new opportunities, and new sounds to venues around the D.C. area and beyond. With our 11th season, we're Looking Forward: expanding our reach to new locations such as Baltimore's War Memorial, adding to our repertoire with new pieces and new productions, and searching out new ways to present the important music being created right in this moment in time to new audiences. 

GNE has worked hard during its first ten years to create a firm foothold in the cultural life of the nation's capitol, and has succeeded in providing excellent productions of wonderful and rarely-heard masterworks of modern music, from large ensemble pieces such as Louis Andriessen's  De Materie and La Commedia to smaller yet equally important and engaging pieces like Martin Bresnick's Pine Eyes and Steve Reich's Music for 18 Musicians. Equally important is our mission of promoting the works of composers who are building careers or who have already started to make their mark on the new music world such as GNE members Armando Bayolo, Mark Sylvester, Kevin McKee, and Blair Goins as well as longtime GNE friends and collaborators like Robert Paterson, D.J. Sparr, Marc Mellits, Josh Bornfield, Alexandra Gardner, Sean Doyle, and others.

In addition to supporting and promoting the composers whom we champion, we're committed to supporting the performing lives and careers of our GNE members who have committed so much time, energy, and professionalism to our first ten years of growth. Our members perform in many and varied capacities as professional musicians in and out of the D.C. area, and we're working to provide the very best professional support and compensation to allow them to bring you even more exciting and moving performances than ever before  and to allow them to more fully channel the enormous enthusiasm and expertise they have for the music we love to present.


Why Now?

Great Noise is in the middle of a growth period this season: 

We've expanded our performance schedule to include a whole new series in cooperation with Baltimore's War Memorial Arts Initiative in addition to continuing our partnership with Washington D.C.'s Atlas Performing Arts Center, are participating and performing for national events such as the 2016 New Music Gathering, and will be pursuing touring performances at out-of-town venues such as Brooklyn's National Sawdust.

In addition, we're beginning to explore and formulate educational partnerships to share our love of new music with students of all ages including local and national residencies, workshops, concerts, and ongoing collaborations. 

As we work to build up the processes and systems to manage all of these things, we're also in the process of building our audience and our donor base and putting in place all of our mechanisms for better communication, better planning, and better cooperation with our partners and patrons to achieve all of these goals. 

In short: this requires funds. We need to ensure we have the financial springboard to hit the ground running with these goals as we add new board members, work with current venues, donors, and patrons as well as promote our upcoming performances. While ticket sales cover a portion of the costs of presenting our programs, they're only part of our plan. 

How Will My Donation Help?

We're hoping to successfully raise $6,500 or more to help cover the following items this season, which will give us momentum to springboard future fundraising and offset production costs: 
  • Help partially fund performer compensation and travel costs for high-profile performances at the 2016 New Music Gathering and at National Sawdust in Brooklyn, NY
  • Promote and support marketing of our current concert season, including professional head shots and group photos for our performing members, website updates and maintenance, and print material creation 
  • Secure rehearsal space for upcoming concerts
  • Provide backline funds for percussion rental and sound and lighting crew
Seriously, any amount helps, and we'll be happy and thankful for whatever you can contribute. 

What Are Other Ways I Can Help?

If you can't provide a donation at this time, there are lots of other ways you can help us reach this goal: 
  • Share this campaign on social media: do you have Facebook friends or Twitter followers who might be interested in helping us out? Share and help us get the word out about the campaign. Every little bit helps. 
  • Check out our upcoming concerts and buy a couple of tickets to come hear us: it's important to us to see you in the audience and hear your thoughts on what we're doing! 
  • Follow us on Facebook: get the latest news on our upcoming performances, events, and join the conversation.  
  • Keep up with us on Twitter and join the larger new music discussion.

Secure rehearsal space for upcoming concerts
Provide backline funds for percussion rental and sound and lighting crew

Seriously, any amount helps, and we'll be happy and thankful for whatever you can contribute.

Check out our upcoming concerts and buy a couple of tickets to come hear us: it's important to us to see you in the audience and hear your thoughts on what we're doing! 

Follow us on Facebook: get the latest news on our upcoming performances, events, and join the conversation.  

Keep up with us on Twitter and join the larger new music discussion.

story:
Puedes ser parte de Travelling!

Mi pasión por la música se inició desde que, en mis primeros días de vida, escuchaba a mi abuelo, Oscar Gacitúa, tocar al piano Chopin, Beethoven, Bach, Schubert y la música de los grandes maestros en la sala de mi casa. La fuerza emocional de esta música me llevó a mi segunda gran pasión, el teatro. Junto a la Compañía Tryo Teatro Banda he podido vivir la fusión de ellas, en obras que han sido vistas por miles de personas como La Expulsión de los Jesuitas, La Tirana, Afrochileno y La Araucana, y junto al director Cristián Plana en las obras Comida Alemana, Castigo, Paso del Norte y Almagro. En el cine también he podido expresarlas, cantando en la película El Club, de Pablo Larraín y actuando y cantando en Te amo, made in Chile, y Perla, de Sergio Castilla.

La composición musical siempre me acompañó y hace tres años lancé mi primer disco, Still Me, iniciando mi camino solista. Mi universo musical se ha ido nutriendo de diversos lenguajes, popular medieval, celta, rock, pop, folk, que hoy se plasman en canciones que integrarán mi segundo trabajo, Travelling, trabajando con maravillosos músicos chilenos como Tata Barahona y Jorge Matamala de Calenda Maia, Marcelo Córdova, Esteban Sumar, Andrés Pérez, Pedro Foncea, Daniel Baeza y Roberto Gacitúa, entre otros.

Porqué Necesito tu Contribución?

He querido grabar este segundo disco con los más altos estándares artísticos y técnicos, por eso, junto al Sello Discográfica del Sur haremos el registro en Estudios del Sur, uno de los mejores a nivel continental. 

El financiamiento de este proyecto contempla un monto final de U$ 8.000 que considera honorarios de los músicos (U$ 1.500), costo Estudios del Sur (grabación, mezcla y masterización U$ 4.000), Reproducción Copias del Disco (U$ 2.500).

Todos estos costos son asumidos por mí y te invito a ayudarme a financiar este sueño. 

Cuál es el Aporte de mi Música?

Este disco significa mucho para mí, refleja una maduración en mi creación y lo realizaré a todo evento, porque tengo la convicción de que será un aporte en la escena musical chilena ya que logra una fusión de diversos lenguajes musicales que enriquecen el sonido del rock y el pop, columnas vertebrales de mi propuesta.
story_txt:
Puedes ser parte de Travelling!
Mi pasión por la música se inició desde que, en mis primeros días de vida, escuchaba a mi abuelo, Oscar Gacitúa, tocar al piano Chopin, Beethoven, Bach, Schubert y la música de los grandes maestros en la sala de mi casa. La fuerza emocional de esta música me llevó a mi segunda gran pasión, el teatro. Junto a la Compañía Tryo Teatro Banda he podido vivir la fusión de ellas, en obras que han sido vistas por miles de personas como La Expulsión de los Jesuitas, La Tirana, Afrochileno y La Araucana, y junto al director Cristián Plana en las obras Comida Alemana, Castigo, Paso del Norte y Almagro. En el cine también he podido expresarlas, cantando en la película El Club, de Pablo Larraín y actuando y cantando en Te amo, made in Chile, y Perla, de Sergio Castilla. 
La composición musical siempre me acompañó y hace tres años lancé mi primer disco, Still Me, iniciando mi camino solista. Mi universo musical se ha ido nutriendo de diversos lenguajes, popular medieval, celta, rock, pop, folk, que hoy se plasman en canciones que integrarán mi segundo trabajo, Travelling, trabajando con maravillosos músicos chilenos como Tata Barahona y Jorge Matamala de Calenda Maia, Marcelo Córdova, Esteban Sumar, Andrés Pérez, Pedro Foncea, Daniel Baeza y Roberto Gacitúa, entre otros. 
Porqué Necesito tu Contribución?
He querido grabar este segundo disco con los más altos estándares artísticos y técnicos, por eso, junto al Sello Discográfica del Sur haremos el registro en Estudios del Sur, uno de los mejores a nivel continental. 
El financiamiento de este proyecto contempla un monto final de U$ 8.000 que considera honorarios de los músicos (U$ 1.500), costo Estudios del Sur (grabación, mezcla y masterización U$ 4.000), Reproducción Copias del Disco (U$ 2.500).
Todos estos costos son asumidos por mí y te invito a ayudarme a financiar este sueño. 
Cuál es el Aporte de mi Música?
Este disco significa mucho para mí, refleja una maduración en mi creación y lo realizaré a todo evento, porque tengo la convicción de que será un aporte en la escena musical chilena ya que logra una fusión de diversos lenguajes musicales que enriquecen el sonido del rock y el pop, columnas vertebrales de mi propuesta.

story:
Making A Record

Hello. My name is Andrew Johnson and I'm here to recruit you.
While I may be a shade of the man Harvey Milk was, I do have something I've been working very hard on for the past two years that I'm eager to share with you all. I have a collection of new material that is both personal and political. I've enlisted some of the most talented musicians and engineers I know to bring this monster to life and get it on the road and into your ears.

Yeah Yeah, Music

No really! I think this combination of Americana and indie-rock is actually pretty exciting. I'm looking to raise $4000 to offset the costs of recording and paying the people playing on the record. For your donations there are a bunch of rewards you can receive ranging from the record itself to a guitar lesson with me and a whole lot in between. Everything is DIY, so rest assured that my fingerprints will be all over everything I'm sending your way. 

What This All Means

You get some cool swag that I designed, and you help me realize a dream I've had for a long time. I truly mean it when I say that every donation received means the world to me, and that I wouldn't be asking if I didn't have to. The whole point of this project is to give back, and I have plans to release some singles where the proceeds will be entirely donated to charity. I also have plans to make my tours based around the concept of public service. Your support now helps bring those ideas to life. I think that music is one of the things that brings us closer as fellow humans and is one of the most efficient delivery systems of joy that exists. You can help bring some into the world! 

Risks & Challenges

I've been writing, recording and playing music for most of my life and this is absolutely the scariest project I've ever been involved in. I feel that I'm ready to truly put a stake in the ground and make a record that I'm proud to call mine. Luckily my team is great and I've been working hard to get the songs as airtight as they can be.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't worry, if you can't donate that's perfectly ok. If you are interested in what I'm doing, you can share the link and direct more eyes to the project, send me an encouraging email or give me a hug! You can also get on my mailing list and follow me on social media through my page at iamvicepresident.com. Thank you all, I'll see you on the other side!

A Small Taste of What's to Come...

Here's a demo to give you an idea of the sound of the project:

https://soundcloud.com/andrew-johnson-11/false-flag-demo

story:
The Goal:

Release an amazing FREE album full of music that touches hearts, tells stories, inspires, and brings the jam:

  • What's good everybody! My name is CAMM, I'm a Hip Hop artist, songwriter, and producer born and raised in the Home of the Blues, (Memphis, TN). I  bring a refreshing and soulful sound to the genre by resurrecting traditional Hip Hop influences such as A Tribe Called Quest and Biggie and incorporating elements of Pop, Soul, Jazz, and Gospel music. I just want to create and tell stories in ways they've never been told before. As the son of a pastor, I got my start in the church. My gift as a musician and an artist were discovered and flourished there. But instead of pursuing Gospel music, I wanted to make an impactful splash on the Hip Hop industry. I'm gospel, not in the sense that I sing or write gospel music, but that I bring good news. I'm going against the usual grain of "money, hoes, and clothes" in Hip Hop. My music has and always will project a spirit of fun, love, and consciousness.

  • “Higher Learning” is my debut album, set for release on January 14th, 2016. It is the culmination of years of development and soul searching for me, as an artist and as a man. “Higher Learning” is a concept album with themes, recurring motifs, and socially relevant issues depicted in many of the 1990s Black Films such as John Singleton’s 1995 classic “Higher Learning”. This album is an opportunity for me to further educate the community on socially relevant issues. It will also serve as an enhancement to the culture of Hip Hop and the usual degree of content spread.

  • With your help, this album will portray an exponential amount of growth and maturity in comparison to previous projects. It will include professional visuals, live instrument recording, and professional mixing and mastering, in order to provide the best representation of my music and its message.

The Vision:

This FREE album is a passion & career project for me, but passion alone can't cover production costs. Picture this with me...

  • Full length album, professionally mixed and mastered.
  • Tracks produced & performed by professional engineers and the best musicians Nashville has to offer.
  • Visuals and artwork that portray the music and message in the most professional and immaculate way.

My Endgame:

I have no aim to make a profit here, but it would be awesome to cover the costs involved with producing this album. In the end, your support would help me release an AMAZING debut album. I love the good that comes from music made with PURPOSE and I would love for you to be a part of that by helping me out.

story:
Stafford Hunter here. 


Have you every had a few burning ideas in your head that you thought... If I only had some help, it would be something that EVERYONE would love. Well, I've had that same feeling for a while now. 

間違いなく素晴らしい！と思うようなアイデアを思いついたことはありませんか？誰かの協力さえあれば、そのアイデアは誰もが満足する素晴らしいものになるはず。私もそんな思いをずっと持っていました。

I have a 2 part CD project in mind that I think needs to come to life. And, I think that with your help, it will be a great success. It will include some of the best young & veteran musicians in New York. And, original music by me. Check out the video to get a better idea of my music.

ぜひ実現をさせたい、2種類のCD作成プロジェクトを考えています。あなたの協力で、必ず素晴らしい成功になります。このプロジェクトでは、ニューヨークで活躍する若い才能溢れるミュージシャンやベテランのミュージシャンを起用します。そして、私とのオリジナル曲です。私の音楽を知っていただくためにも、ぜひビデオを見て下さい。

Let me tell you a bit about myself. I'm Stafford Hunter; Grammy nominated trombonist & sea shells player (and sometimes vocalist) from Philadelphia (but born in Atlantic City, NJ). I've been active on the music scene in New York City for more than 25 years. Performed and/or recorded with some great folks like Illinois Jacquet, McCoy Tyner, Lester Bowie & Brass Fantasy, Charles Tolliver, Tony Bennett, Roy Hargrove, Donald Byrd Dance Troupe, Joss Stone, Orrin Evans, the Mingus Big Band, Lauryn Hill, Clark Terry, Reggie Workman, Toshiko Akiyoshi, Dionne Warwick, Lenny Kravitz, Oliver Lake, Amy Winehouse, Steve Turre and has been a member of the Duke Ellington Orchestra since 1998 among other groups.

私について少し紹介をいたします。私はスタッフォード・ハンター。グラミー賞ノミネート・トロンボーン/シェル奏者（ときにヴォーカリスト）。ニュージャージー州アトランティックシティーに生まれ、フィラデルフィアで育つ。ニューヨークの音楽シーンで25年以上活動しています。演奏やレコーディングを、イリノイ・ジャケット、マッコイ・タイナー、レスター・ボウイ&ブラスファンタジー、チャールズ・トリバー、トニー・ベネット、ロイ・ハーグローヴ、ドナルド・バード・ダンス・トゥループ、ジョス・ストーン、オーリン・エヴァンス、ミンガス・ビッグバンド、ローリン・ヒル、クラーク・テリー、レジー・ワークマン、秋吉敏子、ディオンヌ・ワーウィック、レニー・クラビッツ、オリバー ・レイク、エイミー・ワインハウス、スティーブ・トゥーレ等の素晴らしいミュージシャンと行う。さらに、1998 年よりデューク・エリントン・オーケストラ等の楽団に所属。

Besides music, I've model in the December 1992 issue of L'Uomo Vogue (the Italian Vogue magazine for men), acted in a movie entitled "the Day the Ponies Come Back", and even appeared in a diet Coke television commercial with the great Elton John.

演奏活動の他に、L'Uomo Vogue (イタリアのメンズ向け ヴォーグ誌) の1992年12月号にモデルとして登場。映画「ザ・デイ・ザ・ポニーズ・カム・バック」にも俳優として出演。また、エルトン・ジョンをフィーチャーしたダイエットコークのテレビCMにも出演している。

It IS Christmas time. PLEASE give whatever you can :)

クリスマスの時期。できる限りの支援をよろしくお願いいたします。

********* 日本からでもクレジットカード払いで簡単にできました。*********


Please Share :)

story:
• I am Shawn Majors, an artist from Kansas City, MO.  This campaign is important to me because it is allowing those that believe in ensuring that Kansas City music stays alive with not only the music that you want to hear but the experience along with it.  Each campaign has something special for each contributor.  Each package comes with a pre-sale copy of the album titled, "No MOre Love."  As you enhance your contributions you will experience more and more options to not only to the music but other business ventures that I have pursued and will share with the world.
  • The album will not only be a music narrative by way of Hip-Hop but a visual by way of short film.  This campaign is to give those that have followed, supported, and look forward to an artist that will not only provide motivation and substance through music but by way of action.  I ensure that the short film will paint a very vivid picture of the culture, our surroundings, what we are doing to move forward, how we continue, and acknowledging those that are making their mark.  It is important to support this movement every step of the way.
  • Each campaign is designed to support and maintain the movement through music and art, a passion that I feel obligated to share with you.  Support and tell others about your contribution.  Thank you and always remember to Love Yourself!


  • Contact Information:
  • Shawn Majors
  • kerrshawn.kimble@gmail.com.com
  • 816-343-4001

816-343-4001

story:
Who am I?

Hello Everyone!  For those of you who don't know me, allow me to introduce myself.  My name is Chip Ratliff, and I am a musician, writer, producer, and speaker born and raised in Chicago, IL.  If you really want to learn more about me, there's all kinds of bio info and opportunities to hear my previous recordings on my website www.chipratliff.net.


Inspiration

Recent events in my life have made me realize that NOW is the time to share my gifts with all of you!  This album brings me back full circle to the reason I started writing and performing: to share MY original music with the world. The album will also serve as a launch pad that will allow me to positively entertain and inspire the global community!  It will consist of new original titles that span across the various musical styles that have influenced me: funk, groove, blues, dance, even some acoustic stuff!

Here's a sample of previous releases:


About the recording

I really want this release to have a “live band” feel to it.There’s nothing like the creative energy of musicians in a studio, feeding off each others energy. Since I have had the pleasure and honor of meeting and working with some extremely talented musicians throughout the years. With this album, we are coming together in the studio to record! Some of the artists that have agreed to lend their talent are:

Saxophonist Chris Greene 

Bluesman, Fernando Jones 

Guitarist, Thomas Yurik 

Guitarist, Chip Dubos, Jr.

Drummer/Percussionist, Charles “Lil’ Chip” Dubos III

Keyboardist, Tony Cazeau

More musicians TBA!

I’m also hoping the music will inspire young people to play an instrument, be original, and not afraid to create from their heart. I am also looking to make this a launch pad to perform at more concerts and events; local, national, and international!  Together, we can make this a reality!


So, how does this all work, Chip?

I’m so glad you asked!

We've teamed up with Indiegogo.com, an incredible and unique service for independent artists. Through Indigogo, we artists can finance our projects through donations from friends, fans, family, and anyone else who catches the buzz. And in return, you get something very cool for your donation. The more you donate, the cooler and more expansive your gift will be. 

$6,200 is the minimum for this project which would pay for:

•Musicians/ production/studio/producer 

•Mastering 

•Art work

•Physical CD's

•Promotion & Marketing

I am hoping, with the help of everyone, we might be able to go over funding which will allow me to do a few more exciting things!  Let's call these:


Stretch goals!

The "making of" video

As an artist, I have always loved watching and reading about the creative and technical process. Not only is it entertaining, but it has helped me so much with understanding the creative process, and inspired me in many ways. This is why I want to do a "making of" video for this CD. I want to take the mystery out of making a CD by going behind the curtain and reveal what it takes to bring a project like this to life! Hopefully, it will inspire and motivate others to make their dream happen! If we reach $5000, the "making of" DVD will be a part of the CD package!


If we reach...

•$9000 - Limited edition vinyl LP!

•$10,000 - We get to make a music video for one of the songs!

WE WILL BE UTILIZING ALL FUNDS DONATED TO THE PROJECT, REGARDLESS OF THE FINAL AMOUNT RAISED. If you find it in your heart (and wallet) to donate to the cause, you'll get everything from (pre-release) digital and/or signed physical CDs, to being listed as an ASSOCIATE PRODUCER on the liner notes, to "forever" guest list status at any public Chip Ratliff  performance, to having Chip Ratliff & the Electric Chittlin' Stew perform at a private concert in your home!  Remember, every dollar counts!

Thank you all in advance for your support of this project!  I can't wait to deliver this record to you!  God bless!

Join me in the creation of this musical endeavor!

$6,200 is the minimum for this project which would pay for:
•Musicians/ production/studio/producer 
•Mastering 
•Art work
•Physical CD's
•Promotion & Marketing
I am hoping, with the help of everyone, we might be able to go over funding which will allow me to do a few more exciting things!  Let's call these:
Stretch goals!
The "making of" video
As an artist, I have always loved watching and reading about the creative and technical process. Not only is it entertaining, but it has helped me so much with understanding the creative process, and inspired me in many ways. This is why I want to do a "making of" video for this CD. I want to take the mystery out of making a CD by going behind the curtain and reveal what it takes to bring a project like this to life! Hopefully, it will inspire and motivate others to make their dream happen! If we reach $5000, the "making of" DVD will be a part of the CD package!
If we reach...
•$9000 - Limited edition vinyl LP!
•$10,000 - We get to make a music video for one of the songs!
WE WILL BE UTILIZING ALL FUNDS DONATED TO THE PROJECT, REGARDLESS OF THE FINAL AMOUNT RAISED. If you find it in your heart (and wallet) to donate to the cause, you'll get everything from (pre-release) digital and/or signed physical CDs, to being listed as an ASSOCIATE PRODUCER on the liner notes, to "forever" guest list status at any public Chip Ratliff  performance, to having Chip Ratliff & the Electric Chittlin' Stew perform at a private concert in your home!  Remember, every dollar counts!
Thank you all in advance for your support of this project!  I can't wait to deliver this record to you!  God bless!
Join me in the creation of this musical endeavor!

story:
Story Behind

Over 20 years ago, I wasn't a DJ yet, my best friend used to call me Kamikaza for my character. Later, another friend asked me if kamikazas were Japanese Georgians, because it sounds like a mixture of these two languages. I laughed then and loved the idea. So when I've started writing this album it came naturally to call it "Japanese Georgians", because all what you are going to hear is very personal.

I think that contemporary music, especially techno, is missing a concept behind it. Nowadays all modern art has become conceptual, but not so many underground musicians are making videos or writing about their creations. This album is different. Every track of the album has its own story and will have its own video as a visualization of emotions I've put in each and everyone of them.

I have several releases already, still a debut album is something special. As I've found a vision and inspiration for my first LP only now, I've put a lot of emotions into the record, as well as all my passion to electronic music as a DJ and music journalist. 

I don't want to release the album on big label, as I wish to have a freedom to make design, promotion, videos etc as I see it. So I have chosen my home Platz fur Tanz label. However, being an independent artist without the major funding is not easy.

My Goals

With your help I am hoping to raise $2500 towards the overall promotion of the record. That includes publicity, video editing, promotion and hard copy release. All of these are incredibly important and costly at the same time. 

My main goal has always been to promote electronic music worldwide to bring it to the widest audience possible. That is why I am hosting Intelligent Beats radio show for more than 12 years now. 

I am hoping that with your help a new audience of listeners will be exposed to electronic music worldwide.

I’ve put my heart and soul into the making of this album and I strongly believe that music makes people come together! You are welcome to donate as much as you can in exchange for exclusive presents offered on this IndieGoGo page.

Give Away

You can get a download link, a signed CD copy and tour poster and/or various T-shirts in exchange for your donation. There are 2 kinds of T-shirts available:

– The “We (dance) Riga” conceptual T-shirt, that connects all clubbers and music lovers of my home town, Riga;

– Tour T-shirts with album prints in Japanese/Georgian on the front side and country flags (colors) on the back.


Any Help Counts

There are other ways you can help, all you have to do is share this page with people you know who might like my music and support this cause.

Thank You Everyone!

story:
Short Summary

The music you have just listened on the video is composed by Sergey Akhunov, a Ukrainian-Russian composer. We are planning this peace of music to be a part of a new CD, which is to be accomplished by the end of the year. 

This crowdfunding campaign is organised to raise money for the recording of the piano trio, called “Tchaikovsky”. 

I have composed this trio in June 2014. It was a prestigious commission made by Levitan’s Festival in Plyos (Russia) , and it is written for violin, cello & piano. A premiere of the trio became a prominent event of the Levitan’s Festival in September 2014. Here is a small excerpt from the world premier:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1Z7BGZPQvGo&feature=youtu.be

The main idea of this trio was to create an atmosphere of Tchaikovsky’s music or, in another words, to try to imagine how Tchaikovsky’s music could sound if he were our contemporary.  

What We Need & What You Get

I am aiming to get 1200 $. This money will cover all studio expenses - recording time, mixing  and editing. This sum also includes artist's fees.

Of course, there are some souvenirs as a gratitude for you support. 

The Impact

In a process of a music creation I can face with a lot of problems, but in one thing I am definitely lucky - I work with highly professional musicians! 

This trio will be recorded by Julia Igonina (violin), Evgeni Rumyantsev (cello) and Alexei Goribol (piano)

We have already worked together in different projects. 

“Big Elegy to John Cage” (violin - Julia Igonina):

https://sergeyakhunov.bandcamp.com/track/big-elegy-to-john-cage

Quintet in memory of a musician (piano - Alexei Goribol):

https://sergeyakhunov.bandcamp.com/album/quintet-in-memory-of-a-musician

Also you can listen some of my music here:

http://www.youtube.com/user/sergakhun

Or here:

https://soundcloud.com/sergeyakhunov

If you like my music, please, support it!

Thank you!


p.s. Here is a small excerpt from Russian critic Anna Kocharova's article for the inside booklet of  Sergey Akhunov - CHAMBER WORKS CD: 

When viewed against the background of incredible sound experiments, the music of composer Sergey Akhunov (b. 1967) is traditional. The author uses familiar methods of working with instruments, and his compositions always manifest a harmonic scale that is distinct and clear to the ear and have a clear-cut form. The composer himself stresses that the continuation of traditions and rethinking of what has already been accomplished is important to him. However, any simplified attitude to himself is the personal view of the author, which may be too exacting. When speaking of his work as a composer, Sergey Akhunov stresses that any piece takes on a definite shape only when he has a revelation and music “comes” to him. This admission is highly characteristic of his creative work. Fortunately, it is completely devoid of any opportunism and desire to please the listener and surprise professional musicians. This music is profoundly sincere and open, which gives it an undeniable advantage.

However, there is a catch for the listener in this seeming simplicity, because this simplicity cannot in any way be equaled to primitiveness. Behind each composition, there is a whole chain of meanings and associations, poetic lines and picturesque prototypes. Behind the harmony and transparency of sound, there is the author’s interest in music of the pre-Bach period. And not only in the pre-Bach period but also in the earlier Greek modes or scales of music and numerical interval construction theories. Behind his ideas there are specific performers and friends who have somehow or other influenced the author. But all of this is only the impetus for composing, by no means providing us with any definite code for deciphering.

story:
Only Believe Foundation

We are a 501c3 that supports educational and professional development through training and fund distribution. We currently have an Angel-Investor that is willing to match anything we raise up to $10,000.
  • Help us touch lives by providing academic scholarships, testing scholarships, book scholarships and seed money for specials social action projects. 
  • A few dollars here and a few dollars there add up quickly and can help us reach our 2015-2016 goal of $10,000. Then bam bam boom it becomes $20,000.
  • So we invite to join this campaign to help a generation soar to new heights!

Help a youth or young adult finish strong!

  • Tell a friend a family member or even a stranger.
  • Give more than once. Smaller amounts over time can become that one big number you have on your heart.  
  • In September we will launch our website and you can see how your contributions  turn into scholarship checks. 
  • You gotta admit we picked a nice sized number $2,500 that ought to get us moving in the right direction:-)  

Thank you in advance!!

Give more than once. Smaller amounts over time can become that one big number you have on your heart.   In September we will launch our website and you can see how your contributions  turn into scholarship checks.  You gotta admit we picked a nice sized number $2,500 that ought to get us moving in the right direction:-)      Thank you in advance!!

story:
Words Are Not Enough 

Thank you very much for checking out our Indiegogo campaign! 

My name is Gregory Agid, a New Orleans based Clarinetist. I have had the great privilege of playing clarinet for the past fifteen years; It has been such a incredible journey that has provided so many wonderful experiences and lessons. 


I grew up in Honolulu, Hawaii and moved to New Orleans, Louisiana when I was twelve years old. Upon my arrival, I was blessed to meet the legendary clarinetist, composer, and educator, Alvin Batiste. Mr. Bat, as we called him, was a visionary who improved the lives of others through his music. He pioneered the renowned jazz department at Southern University, recorded and played with artists such as Freddie Hubbard, Cannonball Adderley, and Ron Carter, and educated the most influential musicians of our time. I consider my experience with Mr. Bat to be one of the greatest blessings in my life. It is my duty to continue these traditions by empowering others through musical performance and education.


The Gregory Agid Quartet was started in 2010 with musicians Joshua Starkman, Max Moran, and Darrian Douglas. Our debut cd, “Mystery Blues,” was released in 2013 and received wonderful reviews and feedback. 

"Coming across Mystery Blues or Agid’s band should bring with it a sense of satisfaction akin to discovering a forgotten copy of Time Out or What Is There to Say?"

-Aaron Lafont Off Beat 

We strive to continue exploring our musicianship with this next release, “Words Are Not Enough.” This record will explore the sounds of the clarinet in a quartet setting. Since the rise of the saxophone, the clarinet has steadily fallen out of the mainstream in the jazz world. We wish to continue the rich traditions of Sidney Bechet, Jimmy Hamilton, and Alvin Batiste. “Words Are Not Enough” will feature original compositions, music written by New Orleans’ finest composers, and jazz standards. The record will showcase members of the original quartet: Joshua Starkman, Max Moran, Darrian Douglas quartet's current drummer AJ Hall. Over the past several years, our experiences have led us to the conclusion that words are not enough. The record is dedicated to exploring those intangible truths behind words. 


What We Need & What You Get

We are aiming to raise $10,000 to create this record. 

$2,500- Recording at Esplanade Studios 

$1,500- Mixing and mastering of the record 

$2,000- Salary for five musicians 

$1,300- Printing 1,000 physical copies of the CD

$1,000- Photography and video documentation of session and live concert 

$800- Licensing fees  

$500- CD artwork 

$400- Miscellaneous

Thank you! 

Thank you so much for your support! We greatly appreciate your generosity and belief in this project. It is critical that we continue this musical tradition. In a time where instrumental music programs are being cut from schools, it is essential that we continue to create and develop art in America. Thank you for allowing us to create and share our art with the world. 
Gregory

story:
The Vivants recorded a Bluegrass Album. It's called "Bluegrass Special." We need your help telling the world about it. 

We are the Vivants and we're a string band from San Francisco, known for our soulful sister style harmonies and retro sounding original material. We love classic American Music. Our first two albums we're very influenced by Western Swing, Cajun, and Old-Timey Country Music. 

For our third album, we made a bluegrass record featuring a couple of new original songs, plus tunes by Bill Monroe, Charlie Louvin, Arthur Teal, and other traditional American Songs. We've already recorded it, mixed it, mastered it, and manufactured it, all out of our own pockets. We really worked our little tail off making this thing and we're dang proud of our new recordings. Now it's time to start promoting the album. That's where you come in! 

What We Need & What You Get

We're trying to raise $3,000 to spend on the PR of "Bluegrass Special." Let's face it, one of the big differences between an independent artist (like us) and the major labels is PR. The corporate music industry has an enormous budget for PR. As a supporter of our campaign, you'll be helping us tackle the beast that is publicity. If this campaign is successful and we raise the entire $3,000 goal, we'll hire a professional PR team that specializes in music to promote "Bluegrass Special." If we don't meet our $3,000 goal, your contributions will help us pay for the cost of mailing the album and other promotional material to media outlets and other people in the music industry who need to hear our new album.  
As a backer of our campaign, you can get awesome perks, such as a copy of "Bluegrass Special," one or both of our previous albums, a band t-shirt, a music lesson, or a house concert! Yeeho!!!

The Impact

Our previous album, "Western Addition," was partially funded by a Kickstarter campaign. To be honest, that album would not have happened without crowd funding. Hopefully, this campaign will be a success, too. We're an independent "Mom 'n' Pops" band and we need your help!
We feel like we've made a unique album. It's a legit bluegrass album featuring the accordion, which, correct us if we're wrong, is something we've never heard another band do since Bill Monroe's first incarnation of the Bluegrass Boys (did you know that the Father of Bluegrass had an accordion in his first band?).

Risks & Challenges

The album has already been recorded and was just recently manufactured. However, the challenge is sharing "Bluegrass Special" with the music world and the bluegrass community. Unfortunately, we've already tapped out our financial resources recording and manufacturing this project. The risk is if we are unable to raise enough capital to promote "BLUEGRASS SPECIAL," we made an album that less music lovers will get a chance to enjoy.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! Please, feel free to share this campaign with people who enjoy classic American Music like bluegrass as well as sharing it on Facebook, Twitter, and other social media platforms.

story:
Brought to you by the letter, P


Patrons

produce • print • promote


PAMELA MEANS 

Plainfield


The new album!



First Things First...

First of all, THANK YOU. Because you are each individual, invaluable, mighty patrons of the arts (ahhts, in Massachusetts), I have been able to make music for a living, since quitting my day job in 1997. You have come to live shows. You have bought CDs and downloads. You have shared this music with your communities. You have posted and shared music, videos, tourdates and more on social media.

You are, quite literally, the solid frame of the vehicle I exist within, doodling around on the guitar and scratching lyrics into dime store notebooks. Even if you didn't know it. It's You. You. You. Thank you. 


Why Are We Here?

I made you something special: "Plainfield," my best record to date. An intimate, stripped down, solo acoustic, live in the studio recording. With gratitude and humility, I ask you, esteemed patrons, to join me in co-creating, releasing and promoting "Plainfield," helping it find a footing and new audiences further than previously possible.

I've released seven albums (seven!) with virtually zero budget for serious promotion. Ugh! That's like starting a road trip with an empty tank of gas. In the desert. You're not going to get very far. This time, let's fill the tank and pack all the provisions! Hire a publicist, get a radio promoter on the horn (is that a thing?), sidle up to savvy social media captains, bestie a blogger, cruise a critic (wait, that came out wrong), and promote, promote, promote. I've thought up a long list of special perks and one of a kind incentives to add fun, flair and inspiration to the campaign.


What Makes You So Special, Anyways?

Inspired by the likes of Audre Lorde, bell hooks, James Baldwin, Woody Guthrie, Pete Seeger, Angela Davis and more, I embrace my identity, my duty, my innate responsibility, within the skin I'm in, to speak the truth as I see it. Tagging alongside a lineage of political artists, critical thinkers, and outspoken writers, tirelessly illuminating hidden power structures and institutions of oppression, whether visible, invisible, internal or external. And, although, it may be the road less commercially traveled (um, much less, much much less traveled), I remain committed to this path, this long road, this musical journey. And, it would not be possible, at all, if you weren't there to listen, groove, share, care.


Modern Day Movers and Shakers 

So, patrons of the ahhts, you happen to be the best record label around. A grass roots collection of like-minded individuals in common appreciation of, support for, and encouragement toward outspoken, uncensored art from independent artists who maintain complete control of their work.

This is what the modern music industry looks like. This is how it's done in the 21st century. Let's keep it goin'. Let's do 'dis. 


What Are You Gonna Do With All The Money?

Right off the top, before anybody gets anything, Indiegogo takes 5%, Paypal takes another 3 to 5%, and there is an additional 3%+$0.30 in processing fees for each credit card transaction. For every 10,000 raised, roughly 3,000 will go toward fulfilling the rewards. The rest goes toward the costs of the project: paying for studio time and the recording engineer; musicians and producers (but, in this case, them is me), graphic designers, web designers, radio promoters, publicists, videographers, and promoting the videos online; plus, design and manufacturing of posters, promotional materials and merchandise. The more of a creative team's time, energy, and effort I can pay for, the further this record will go.

"Plainfield" was, actually, already recorded this summer. It still needs final mixes and mastering. Studio fees have been accruing and still need to be paid. It will cost $8,000 to finish paying for the recording, artwork production and first pressing of CDs alone. The crucial focus of this campaign, hiring the bare minimum publicity team for radio and press, could easily cost $1500-$5000 or more, and in some cases per month! With $20,000 I can extend the publicity campaign, produce a video or two, and promote them online. $30,000 or more will allow me to push harder and even further with a longer PR campaign, and solidify tour support in key regions of the country that are wonderful but expensive to build upon. (West coast!) A stretch goal of $40,000 or more would allow me to tour more in regions where I rarely visit (Southeast, Southwest and the space between Austin and Seattle). And in some cases, I could afford to bring a band on the road! It would be such a thrill and a treat to take a band on the road, but they keep wanting money and food. Whatever. Currently, only the rare New England venue gets to see a full band show. The more we have to work with, the better the chances that this record will reach a wider audience than I have in the past. That's what you will be a part of: sharing this work that you've enjoyed for years out in the wide world. You will make this magic.


Other Ways to Help...

Remember, a smile and a share go a long way. If you ain't got no money, honey, that's alright! Share this campaign, like a link, tweet a tweet, post a post. You never know how far it could go. Use these:

#PamelaMeans

#plainfieldthealbum

http://igg.me/at/PamelaMeans

Thank you!!!


Perfect Perks, Pour Vous


Curated content just for you.

Exclusive, LIMITED EDITION items

only available during this campaign!


Please peruse our plentiful perks! Deep thought went into the groovy goodies, but if there are additional perks you were hoping to see, let your voice be heard!

New perks may be added throughout the campaign!

Check the campaign Image Gallery for pics of perks!
story_txt:
Brought to you by the letter, P

Patrons
produce • print • promote

PAMELA MEANS 
Plainfield

The new album!


First Things First...

First of all, THANK YOU. Because you are each individual, invaluable, mighty patrons of the arts (ahhts, in Massachusetts), I have been able to make music for a living, since quitting my day job in 1997. You have come to live shows. You have bought CDs and downloads. You have shared this music with your communities. You have posted and shared music, videos, tourdates and more on social media.
You are, quite literally, the solid frame of the vehicle I exist within, doodling around on the guitar and scratching lyrics into dime store notebooks. Even if you didn't know it. It's You. You. You. Thank you. 

Why Are We Here?
I made you something special: "Plainfield," my best record to date. An intimate, stripped down, solo acoustic, live in the studio recording. With gratitude and humility, I ask you, esteemed patrons, to join me in co-creating, releasing and promoting "Plainfield," helping it find a footing and new audiences further than previously possible. 
I've released seven albums (seven!) with virtually zero budget for serious promotion. Ugh! That's like starting a road trip with an empty tank of gas. In the desert. You're not going to get very far. This time, let's fill the tank and pack all the provisions! Hire a publicist, get a radio promoter on the horn (is that a thing?), sidle up to savvy social media captains, bestie a blogger, cruise a critic (wait, that came out wrong), and promote, promote, promote. I've thought up a long list of special perks and one of a kind incentives to add fun, flair and inspiration to the campaign. 

What Makes You So Special, Anyways?
Inspired by the likes of Audre Lorde, bell hooks, James Baldwin, Woody Guthrie, Pete Seeger, Angela Davis and more, I embrace my identity, my duty, my innate responsibility, within the skin I'm in, to speak the truth as I see it. Tagging alongside a lineage of political artists, critical thinkers, and outspoken writers, tirelessly illuminating hidden power structures and institutions of oppression, whether visible, invisible, internal or external. And, although, it may be the road less commercially traveled (um, much less, much much less traveled), I remain committed to this path, this long road, this musical journey. And, it would not be possible, at all, if you weren't there to listen, groove, share, care.


Modern Day Movers and Shakers 

So, patrons of the ahhts, you happen to be the best record label around. A grass roots collection of like-minded individuals in common appreciation of, support for, and encouragement toward outspoken, uncensored art from independent artists who maintain complete control of their work.
This is what the modern music industry looks like. This is how it's done in the 21st century. Let's keep it goin'. Let's do 'dis. 



What Are You Gonna Do With All The Money?
Right
 off the top, before anybody gets anything, Indiegogo takes 5%, Paypal 
takes another 3 to 5%, and there is an additional 3%+$0.30 in processing
 fees for each credit card transaction. For every 10,000 raised, roughly
 3,000 will go toward fulfilling the rewards. The rest goes toward the 
costs of the project: paying for studio time and the recording engineer;
 musicians and producers (but, in this case, them is me), graphic 
designers, web designers, radio promoters, publicists, videographers, 
and promoting the videos online; plus, design and manufacturing of 
posters, promotional materials and merchandise. The more of a creative 
team's time, energy, and effort I can pay for, the further this record 
will go.
"Plainfield" was, actually, already recorded this summer. It still needs final mixes and mastering. Studio fees have been accruing and still need to be paid. It will cost $8,000 to finish paying for the recording, artwork production and first pressing of CDs alone. The crucial focus of this campaign, hiring the bare minimum publicity team for radio and press, could easily cost $1500-$5000 or more, and in some cases per month! With $20,000 I can extend the publicity campaign, produce a video or two, and promote them online. $30,000 or more will allow me to push harder and even further with a longer PR campaign, and solidify tour support in key regions of the country that are wonderful but expensive to build upon. (West coast!) A stretch goal of $40,000 or more would allow me to tour more in regions where I rarely visit (Southeast, Southwest and the space between Austin and Seattle). Thank you!!!

story:
As of today July 25,2015 Doug Perry has passed away. We are asking for help for funeral cost and Creamation funding. 

He was a very fun loving nice guy. He loved to go fishing, liked to watch wrestling, and loved his family and dog Eclipse. I now have his dog in my care. I love him. 
His wish was to be creamated and his ashes to be placed in water, he loved the ocean. Our plan is to spread his ashes off the coast in Oregon. 
We need help raising funds for this to happen. His life being taken away was and is still very shocking. 
Thank you to everyone who helps, every little bit gets us closer. God bless and stay safe!

story:
How did it start?

Life has been quite a journey. After growing up, surrounded by the beautiful latvian country side, filled with wild days in the mesmerizing nature, I quickly realized, that everything I wish for in life is connected with music. A bunch of songs and music projects later, after having great times in Jazz and cover bands, I started to perform my own music. Played shows in bars, cafés and on folk festivals, and then eventually moved to Innsbruck. Here I work in a culture centre, where I organize concerts and open stage events for local musicians. 

What is the project about?

Through my work-related cultural network I met Christoph Holzknecht, with whom I started to perform in concerts and create a new program - mix from older songs and fresh material. So far we have played shows, festivals, parties and managed to create a sound that we both believe in. We still hold on to my simple and melancholic melodies (although Christoph did put some effort into changing my mind, but I am a stubborn lady). Mixing my songs with Christoph's electronic arrangements, beats and beautiful atmospheres, we managed to create our own little playground. And we would like to share it with you!

Your investment in pre-ordering the material (and by doing so, also showing your trust in us) would mean the world to us. Everything that we put into the recording is hard work and love (and also some glasses of wine and sleepless nights) and we do hope (like all musicians do) that it brings joy to you as a listener.

What We Need & What You Get

Releasing music can been quite expensive. I have been saving money to pay all the wonderful people who have helped me so far and have showed trust in us even knowing my limited budget. All raised money is going to be invested into the production costs of our CD and Vinyl and therefore will be be completely bound to music (no, this really isn't a vacation fund).

In more details, your investment will help to cover:

  • Mixing and mastering of the album
  • Printing and packaging of CD's and Vinyl's
  • Costs for cover art
  • Costs for studio time

Check out the perk list and hopefully you can find something attractive for you! From simple and common perks as pre-ordering the CD or a vinyl and digital thank you, to special home gigs and home made poetry collections (believe me, you want to see this, I have always been a terrible visual artist, but I will try my best and put my heart in it). As most of my songs on the album have been inspired by the people surrounding me, you can also get your own special and unique song! I will write and release it especially for you (credits included)!

If we won't reach our goal of 2500 Euros, we still want to release the record. However, we would have to cut everything down to a minimum (and I will have to save money for another year to repay all the amazing people who have invested work in this project). 

If we get a little extra money, we would invest it in the promotion, as this is an expensive and time consuming task.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that a lot of you out there have different priorities and we completely understand that. There are tons of people in need and as long as we all are aware of that and try to help each other, I feel blessed and happy!

However, there are still several ways how you can help us on our journey:

  • Please spread a word about the campaign, show it to your friends, show it to your family! Maybe there is someone out there, who would be interested in supporting us. Or maybe there will be a new face on the concert, which would be amazing as well. Indiegogo has share tools that are easy to use!
  • You can also give us a like on Facebook, as a lot of bookers check out the FB pages. This helps us to get gigs: https://www.facebook.com/baibadekenamusic/?fref=ts
  • You can also follow us on youtube in order to keep yourself updated: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UClMTBmVX4yC65E...

THANKS A LOT FOR YOUR HELP!

Huge thanks to:

  • Pogo Mir, who created our beautiful crowd funding video
  • Benjamin Leingartner from Super + Records, who is helping us to bring the album out
  • Gregor Blösl for lending me his piano for the video and bringing it up the hill
  • The guys from tummelplatz. for helping us with the video
  • IWANA for the amazing album art!

story:
Hello all,

My name is Will. I am a musician and a DIY recording engineer obsessed with vintage recording gear. I love recording music as much as I love writing and playing it. My project is Skinshape - a sort of trip-hop/funky/souly/something-like-that project. It's ultimately a bedroom studio thing, and I started making Skinshape when I was a little-un at the age of 16. Nine years later, here I am still cooking tunes in the bedroom... I've put out two albums in the last two years, the first of which was self-titled (2014) and the other called 'Oracolo' (2015) - make sure to check them out!

The time has come for my third album to be released, it is about 90% done - and I am really really excited about getting the music out there for people to hear. If you've checked out the video; that song will be on the album too!

The dilemma: recording and releasing an album tends to be quite an expensive process. With me it is no different! I have with me the music, recorded and very nearly finished. BUT I don't have the finances to make the last part of the process happen and make my dream a reality. 

All Money Raised Will Go To:

* Mastering & manufacture of the vinyl for the release (500 units).

* Getting the Musicians Paid - The album would not have been possible without these guys, they really really deserve it.

* Artwork Costs - although not finished yet, this artwork is going to be pretty special - and I wish to pay the artist as much as he deserves for his work!

If You Aren't Able To Contribute...

It's no big deal - I appreciate you checking out my project anyway - and hopefully you enjoyed the music. If you'd like to share it to anyone else that would also be fantastic!

Thanks Everyone.

Will

story:
About Me and My Campaign

Thank you for dropping by my campaign page! My name is Lisa Nicole. I call a small town in BC, Canada home, although I spend a lot of the time on the road performing across Canada and song-writing down South in Nashville.

I come from an authentic country upbringing and was heavily influenced by the sounds of Shania Twain, Martina McBride, and the Dixie Chicks. My own love of singing started at the age of 18 and by 15, I was playing regular jam sessions in Kootenay-area bars. I’ve never looked back.

After releasing my first EP in 2013 and touring across Canada, I won the BCCMA/Music BC Artist Development Project in 2015, which led to the 2016 release of my sophomore EP, Come Find Me, produced by Tom and Carly McKillip, and a national publicity and radio tour.

This year, I’ve released the title track from Come Find Me to radio, showcased at Canadian Music Week and even shared a duet on stage in Nashville with Keith Urban. With your help, I want to continue my career momentum by giving the single release of “Mad About It” the biggest combination of radio, publicity, and social media exposure to date. This campaign will bring more Canadian country music to more fans across the country and give them a song that is catchy and relates to them on a personal level.

What We Need & What You Get

I am very fortunate to have received a grant from Creative BC to pay for 50% of my funding for this project. The remaining funding I need to execute this project is $6787. The funding I am asking for will cover the following costs:

  • Filming a music video with Vancouver with director Edward Platero from Toronto. My photographer, Erich Saide will be present to capture single photos. Other costs for the video include lighting and equipment rentals, a hair and make-up person, a stylist, and location costs.
  • A radio and Spotify campaign by Pitbull Promotions.
  • Publicity from Nova Current Creative Solutions to seek out PR outlets and set up interviews.
  • A social media campaign and single artwork graphics designed by Feisty Creative.

To give back to you for giving to me, I have set out some unique perks I am really excited about! I have exclusive photos from my Come Find Me photo shoot and fan packs. I am giving away my VERY first pair of cowboy boots I ever bought. A couple of my favorites are the Bootcamp with Lisa Nicole where I get to kick your butt! The “Day in the Kootenays” because I love and am proud of where I am from. It is the most beautiful place, summer or winter.

My Influence

Over the years of building my career, I have created a fan base that I am overly grateful for. I want to continue inviting new and old fans to appreciate my music. It’s an incredible feeling to have your songs touch other people in the way they did when you wrote it.  I love writing and performing relatable music. If I feel it, I’m sure someone else will.  I don’t sell party songs very well, I’m not the party hard every weekend beer sluggin’ type of girl. Although I do have friends that like to let lose and so I write about them.  This song represents a different side of me. The side that shows I am real and I can get angry.

Risks & Challenges

The music industry requires a lot of dedication and perseverance. Finance can always be a struggle for independent artists like myself. One needs to be well funded to keep up with the conventional standards. Criticism can be hard to deal with because not everyone will love you. The stress that often coincides with a rejection call or email can derail your motivation.

That said, I do persist and I have always been the type of artist to push forward and not focus on the negativity. It can be hard to ask for help, like I am now, but I have to put my pride on the table and just ask.  I have had many part time jobs to support my career and still do. Every penny I make goes directly to my music. I don’t own a house. I own a career. My ‘mortgage payment’ goes towards my career and that is a sacrifice I decided to make.  I have not drifted from my goals since I started pushing my career in 2012 and will persevere.

Can't donate? You can still help!

If you can’t help monetarily, that is okay.  There are other ways! You can share this campaign by emailing it, txting it, shout it out to the world! You can also simply follow me on any of my social media channels @lisanicolemusic. 

And please join my mailing list at www.lisanicolemusic.com. If Facebook ever disappears I need to make sure I have all my fans emails tucked away for safe keeping :) Much love and I thank you all kindly, xoxo

Lisa Nicole

story:
Alrighty - here is the nitty gritty. I'm doing everything I can to make this album in a thrifty sort of way - but what I won't compromise on is paying the folks who are helping me out. I need moolah to help pay for the art / design, the recording studio time for folks who are contributing remotely, stipends for the musicians (or at least $$ to buy them drinks and snacks while they're recording), printing the CDs, promotion for the album, and that's about it.

I'm not printing vinyl this time around (although if we do well it could totally be a stretch goal).

I've gotten permission from the indie artists whose songs I'll be covering. I've gotten buy in from all of the musicians that I want on the recordings. I'll be using home equipment whenever possible to keep costs down.

These songs are the ones that have absolutely brought me the most joy to sing-a-long to. My goal is that they'll do that for you too. Now come gather round the campfire and let's make some queer country music!
