Alrighty - here is the nitty gritty. I'm doing everything I can to make this album in a thrifty sort of way - but what I won't compromise on is paying the folks who are helping me out. I need moolah to help pay for the art / design, the recording studio time for folks who are contributing remotely, stipends for the musicians (or at least $$ to buy them drinks and snacks while they're recording), printing the CDs, promotion for the album, and that's about it.
I'm not printing vinyl this time around (although if we do well it could totally be a stretch goal).
I've gotten permission from the indie artists whose songs I'll be covering. I've gotten buy in from all of the musicians that I want on the recordings. I'll be using home equipment whenever possible to keep costs down.
These songs are the ones that have absolutely brought me the most joy to sing-a-long to. My goal is that they'll do that for you too. Now come gather round the campfire and let's make some queer country music!

story:
What the Hell is this about and who the Hell are you?
Hey Good Humans.
I’m Madame Dolores, an artist making music.

These are strange times and strange times need strange music: The Pantry of Salt and Sugar.

the Pantry of Salt and Sugar project is a means to an end; killing 2 birds with 1 fundraiser
There are two things I love
Making ART and supporting my fellow ARTmakers!!!

A salary can help you achieve dreams like owning a car, house, vacation, but it can't actually help you launch projects and programs to support your Arts Community.

Means to an end---meaning that at the very least, 1 brokered song would provide a bulk sum to launch multiple initiatives and programs (as an example..affordable housing for artists)

 

For the past year, I’ve been composing micro-songs, musical responses to the strangeness of each day on my iPhone via the Garageband platform. I will select 15 songs from “The Pantry of Salt and Sugar” for professional treatment by renowned Producer, Kevin Reynolds.

After 30 years of creating, performing, and exhibiting, I intentionally decided to abandon the linear progression of art making and return to the initial space where it all began. PLAY. Pure abandon, pure joy.

All music and lyrics are unplanned, improvised responses to the outer and inner world. The Pantry of Salt and Sugar is celebration of accidental discoveries, glorious imperfections and stream of consciousness haikus. Each micro-song in the Pantry of Salt and Sugar is a ritualistic dedication to the enigma of creation.

The new, professionally produced tracks will then be brokered for feature opportunities on the international market. I am working to share the Pantry of Salt and Sugar with the world.

I want to pursue other opportunities for music, such as:

  • Public Art: giant projections of the music videos on the side of a building
  • Gallery- different rooms, each featuring a video
  • Multi-media presentations
  • Dance companies for performances
  • International Television/film placement (like a Norwegian crime show)
  • Theme song for  sci-fi, horror film
  • Segues for DJ sets
  • Remixes
  • etc...

What do I need to do this, you ask?
$ 20,000

Grane Entertainment services

$14,000.00

Kevin Reynolds of Grane Entertainment, to provide professional

arrangements & mixes of 15 micro-songs
$1,000.00 per song) and broker [I’ve already paid for one: skin in the game] {FYI for my my good folk, these are not PGH prices}

Mastering

$1,200.00

Kevorkian Mastering based out of New York
($ 150 per song) I've worked with Kevorkian for over a decade and love, love their work.

Videos

$ 2,320.00

4 videos at $ 580.00 each (this may seem low, but I'm shooting for imagery that matches the simplicity of the tracks)

PR

$ 1,500.00

Flipswitch PR firm based out of New York (they did a great job on my first solo release)

Computer (refurbished)

$ 980.00

MacBook Pro 2017 (because the Garageband is newer on my phone and I'm unable to edit and share tracks with the Producer, ugh)

Total

$ 20,000.00

  


This will cover the costs of the Producer, the mastering of the songs, 4 videos, PR firm and last but not (rainbow spinning wheel) least, a refurbished (I’m not too picky) iMac computer to do the preliminary edits and send the songs to the Producer so I can get all of this work done!

The funds raised will pay for 15 micro-songs from The Pantry of Salt and Sugar, to be professionally produced and brokered and mastered.

A refurbished Mac computer will allow me to transfer the files with integrity, since the Garageband version on my phone is now newer than on my computer which is too old to be updated to the new operating system. I can then continue learning and evolving my process on other Digital Audio Workstations (for example Logic Pro) and to use Ableton Live for live performances.

Who is this Producer? & why do you need to work with him?
The goal is to have Kevin Reynolds of Grane Entertainment, produce the songs by sifting through the selected pre-recorded material and polish the mixes. This process involves rearranging the structure, adjusting the eqs, dealing with pitch, tone, and sonic mood. There will be times when I may need to re play a part or re-sing a section, or an instrument needs to be replaced with a different sound, or additional instrumentation needs to be added. 

Kevin Reynolds is a self described "industry guy" who began as a Recording Engineer at Def Jam and then went on to work at labels like Bad Boy, RuffHouse, Columbia, Universal music group, Arista Records Edmonds entertainment, Sony entertainment group, Atlantic records, DEF jam or island DEF jam, I heart radio, Univision, and transition Music Group

What do you get?
Cool art stuff made by me, cool art experiences with me and the amazing friggin joy of supporting the Wyrd.

If I don’t reach my entire goal, I will get as many micro-songs produced as I can. I will do what I'm good at, innovative adaptable flexibility.

Support is the Revolution
My music career has been built on the foundation of collaborating with phenomenal musicians. I have performed with multiple projects (Soma Mestizo, 3 Generations Walking, Indigenous Resistance), performed in hundreds of shows, and released several albums. 

This is the first time I’m composing the music and production, everything.

While several of these songs will be released as an album, that is not my focus.  My focus is on brokering them for international film and tv spots and other atypical opportunities to build a legacy.

In addition, 4 micro-songs will be chosen and made into 4 mini-films, videos. As stated in Music Consumer Insight Report, 82% of all YouTube visitors use it for music. The videos will augment the musical release and provide a larger platform for discovery and monetization.

I can’t wait on funding, the lottery, nor will a day job cut it. The opportunity is now, while the Producer has time in between projects to work on my project. I need the resources to pursue opportunities to broker these songs and to use the earnings to build a legacy of support for my fellow artists. What do I mean by support? Funding, purchasing, turning my garage into an artist residency. The arts are intrinsic to maintaining our spirit, our dreams, our progress towards a more equitable society. I want to be a catalyst for others to make work in these strange times.

My track record of other successful projects can be found on my website.

However, given the state of the world, I completely understand if you are unable to contribute, Sharing is Caring and easey-peasey and I would be greatly appreciate meeting your friends.

Thank You for listening
Put a little sugar in the bowl, if you got the cubes

Much Love

Madame Dolores

story:
Short summary

My ideas are not original, including vinyl-on-demand. What’s unique is my plan to offer high quality, low quantity vinyl records at an affordable price. With an anticipated cost of less than half of most vinyl cutting services it will be possible for musicians to sell records at a competitive price and still make a profit. For short runs lathe cutting is the best option around and I plan to make it even better by offering services at an unbeatable price.
 

I heard lathe cutting is bad! 

The mono lathe cutters from the 1930s that many people use do sound bad! The system I will be is using is a contemporary German manufactured unit with full stereo and a dynamic range of 20 Khz. It’s a real time cutter and has a diamond stylus to insure the cleanest cut possible. Using high quality materials, the records stand up to many dozens of plays with little effect in quality. In fact you can hear an audio sample of the cutter here. (Song: Move on - Josef Saddler).

 

What is vinyl on demand?

Vinyl on demand is an arrangement to make records only as they are sold. There are no up front costs for the artist, and therefore no risks and no unsold inventory. For the consumer it costs a little more than pressed records; but allows artists to offer their music in this great format.

What We Need & What You Get

I am trying to keep the expenses at a bare minimum without getting into DIY solutions. The setup requires a high quality record cutter and amplifier, professional turntable, specialized vacuum equipment, cutting stylus, supplies, etc. What you get is special pricing on top of an already amazing vinyl cutting deal, and the satisfaction that you are helping on demand records to be accessible to great new artists.

The Impact

In supporting this project you do a couple of important things.
First you will help launch and amazing new service, one that will help fill a void in the industry, quality affordable vinyl. Some of the most interesting music being made is by small bands and artists with limited resources and this is the best way to get their music on vinyl.

You also give a young and ambitious kid the resources to take the next steps in something I am really interested in. Many kids my age like music but I live for music; I have a FM pirate radio show, I make my own music and I have a record label that represents several talented artists. I do all of this because I enjoy it but I am also learning to run a business better at the same time.

Risks & Challenges

There are more challenges than risks in accomplishing the goals of this campaign if its funded. The biggest concern relates to the amount of time it may take to learn the system well enough to offer professional quality services, which is my top priority. Fortunately my budget includes in depth training on this particular cutter so I can learn every feature, and how to prevent most mistakes in operating the machine. I am also part of an active forum with many knowledgeable people and have the support of others who can help me when I can’t find it elsewhere.

I want to contribute but I am nervous!

I understand that I am asking for a lot of money, and you have may have questions. You may be wondering if I have the dedication to follow through with my plans or what will happen if I don't reach the target goal. 

First let me assure you that this is not an idea I thought of last minute This is a project I have had in mind for almost a year and dedication to music production and promotion goes back several years. I have a weekly low power FM radio show and a record label with 5 signed artists from Europe. I have a home studio with lots of gear I have collected over the past few years and I make my own electronic music. I know a ton about the genres of music that interest me and am a total nerd for technology and music. I couldn't be more motivated or dedicated to my music interests. I also play percussion in my schools band which is one of the best ranked bands in the state. If you trust me with this project I promise to follow through and keep you updated on the progress.

If I don't reach at least $6000 of my $8000 goal I will refund all of the money I have received minus the campaign related fees I am required to pay. If I get at least this amount I will trim some items from the budget or raise money through other sources. I will not spend your generous donations on gear for my studio or fancy hats!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just cant donate, you can help by getting the word out. You can do this any way you want but also consider using the indiegogo share tools which streamline the process for sharing.

story:
SOBRE LA CAMPAÑA

Hola somos  rioSQUAD, y desde ya te agradecemos por unirte a este proyecto, nos alegra mucho saber que nos puedes ayudar. Tu ofrenda es sumamente importante para nosotros y nuestra evangelización y sin tu apoyo no podemos llegar a la meta final.

Honestamente, esta nueva producción a durado mucho para nosotros terminar. Muchas pruebas, obstáculos y situaciones familiares han prolongado el proceso de terminar el album. Pero gracias a Dios estamos en las etapas finales. Hemos sido bendecidos de poder producir nuestra propia música y grabar en nuestro propio estudio. Hemos trabajado con grandes músicos los cuales nos han ayudado a desarrollar las ideas musicales. 

Esta nueva producción se titula “La Revelazion 2”, porque Revelación con Z? Zion tiene el significado de “Tierra prometida” y como nuestro primer album ( La Revelazion) Dios sigue revelando canciones que la juventud se puede identificar. Nuestro mas grande anhelo es que la juventud pueda llegar a la tierra prometida y ser verdaderos adoradores en espíritu y verdad. 

Tenemos claro que la música impacta la vida de aquel que la escucha. La música tiene un gran poder para motivar e influye hacer algo bueno o malo. Si nos damos cuenta, el joven  de hoy se pasa la mayor parte de su vida escuchando música o viendo videos musicales. Es por esto que es necesario ofrecerle a nuestra generación una clase de música que pueda agradar sus oídos y a la misma vez envagelizar sus vidas. 

Oramos para que La Revelazion 2, la cual contiene 14 temas sea de gran bendición en las vidas de cada uno que la escuche y para nuestra iglesia.

Si deseas apoyar A este proyecto, el cual esperamos que si :), te invitamos a hacerlo primero con oración y con tu aporte financiero. A cambio recibirás distintas recompensas, la cuales encontraras en la sección de “perks”. Claro que no te vas con las manos vacias. 

Muchas gracias, muchisisimas gracias por tu donacion y confianza en estos Locos Por Jesus, estamos seguros que Dios te devolverá mucho mas!

 

DETALLES DE LA PRODUCCION.

Hemos sido afortunado de tener un lugar adonde podemos hacer música sin limites de hora, un lugar para grabar las ideas y voces. Pero como todo en la vida, aspiramos hacer mejores las cosas. Al siguiente podras ver lo que necesitamos para concluir el proyecto.

  • Mezcla $2,800
  • Master $3,000
  • Reproducción, distribución digital y registracion de canciones $2,000
  • Tarifas de Indiegogo y transferencias bancarias $680
  • Total redondeado =$ 8,500

 

EL IMPACTO 

Han sido cientos de testimonios que hemos recibido a travez de nuestros videos de YouTube, Instagram y en presentaciones en vivo. Las bendiciones que nuestra música a causado no tiene palabras y en realidad nos sentimos muy humilde al saber como Cristo nos a utilizado para llevar un mensaje de vida a través de esta música. 

Por gracia de Dios, hemos viajado por casi todo Estado Unidos y varias parte del Mundo llevando nuestra música y testimonio. Ver a jóvenes cantar nuestras canciones y escuchar sus experiencias no tiene debscripcion.

Es por esto que queremos seguir dandole mas duro. Dando lo mejor para Cristo y ustedes. Queremos que tengan otra opción de adoración, escuchar música con propósito, música que da vida y esperanza. Es por esto que necesitamos tu ayuda.

 

RIESGOS Y DESAFÍOS  

"El que confíe en él, no quedará defraudado" - Romanos 10:11.  Confiamos en un Dios todo poderoso y en fé proclamamos que lograremos la meta. Trabajaremos fuertemente para recaudar lo necesario y seguir con nuestra misión de evangelizar con nuestra música. 

Si de alguna forma se supera la meta, todos los fondos serán usado para las grabaciones de audio visuales y la promoción del album. Todo esto sera detalladamente dicho aquí en la pagina de esta campaña.

 

OTRAS FORMAS EN LA QUE PUEDES AYUDAR

Entonces, que tal? Estas animado? Claro que si. 

Pero si por algún motivo no puedes aporta a esta causa todavía hay muchas formas que nos puedes ayudar. 

  1. Con tu oración. Tu aporte espiritual es sumamente importante, orar por este proyecto para que otros se motiven sera de gran ayuda. Orar por nosotros para que Dios siga obrando a través de nuestra música tambien es necesario.
  2. Corre la voz. Talvez conoces de alguna Comunidad, Iglesia, Líder, Compañías, Organizaciones, Familia, Amigos que creas que puedan estar interesados en apoyar nuestra causa. 
  3. Share/Comparte. Que gran poder tiene el internet! Compartir nuestra campaña por tus redes sociales nos puede ayudar también. 

Otra vez, muchas gracias.

Si tienes alguna pregunta nos puedes escribir riosquad2@gmail.com

Es por esto que necesitamos tu ayuda. RIESGOS Y DESAFÍOS  "El que confíe en él, no quedará defraudado" - Romanos 10:11.  Confiamos en un Dios todo poderoso y en fé proclamamos que lograremos la meta. Trabajaremos fuertemente para recaudar lo necesario y seguir con nuestra misión de evangelizar con nuestra música. Si de alguna forma se supera la meta, todos los fondos serán usado para las grabaciones de audio visuales y la promoción del album. Todo esto sera detalladamente dicho aquí en la pagina de esta campaña. OTRAS FORMAS EN LA QUE PUEDES AYUDAREntonces, que tal? Estas animado? Claro que si. Pero si por algún motivo no puedes aporta a esta causa todavía hay muchas formas que nos puedes ayudar. 
Con tu oración. Tu aporte espiritual es sumamente importante, orar por este proyecto para que otros se motiven sera de gran ayuda. Orar por nosotros para que Dios siga obrando a través de nuestra música tambien es necesario.
Corre la voz. Talvez conoces de alguna Comunidad, Iglesia, Líder, Compañías, Organizaciones, Familia, Amigos que creas que puedan estar interesados en apoyar nuestra causa. 
Share/Comparte. Que gran poder tiene el internet! Compartir nuestra campaña por tus redes sociales nos puede ayudar también. 
Otra vez, muchas gracias.Si tienes alguna pregunta nos puedes escribir riosquad2@gmail.com

story:
I've Made It This Far...

Some of you know me, some of you don’t, but all must know the difficulties of being an artist.

This seems especially true for musicians and yet I still wouldn’t change it for the world.

But as I’ve been getting a little older and even after all my years of experience

I’ve still never really had the same opportunities that others (funded by record labels) have had

with regard to creating industry standard, high production value recordings and music videos.

 

It's All About Stories

I’m talking about quality

In an ocean of creativity - my aim is to bring quality stories to the surface

It’s taken me a while to get here but I’ve built up a lifetime of stories and I'd like to share them with the world!

 

I’m just getting started!

The one thing throughout all this that has been a constant, and which has kept me whole, the one skill I’ve stuck to and have been gradually slowly getting better at is, telling these stories through music.

Let me share those stories with you

By donating (even a small amount), you will be a part of something so benificial that will help to create quality content allowing the possibility to share these inspiring stories with the world.

Thank you!

Darren McStay

story:
After two years of intense touring and musical apprenticeship with some of the greats, Ryan McNally has got another album ready to press...and he needs your help to make it happen! 

A mix of originals and covers (including some of the earliest country-blues songs ever recorded!) the collection has a whole new sound inspired by everything from Calypso to old-time fiddle music. The 10 songs of Ryan's third full-length album will be recorded live off the floor at Bob Hamilton's renowned Old Crow recording studio in Whitehorse, Yukon. Along with a whole exciting line-up of instruments (tuba, baritone sax, drum,harmonica...) and Ryan's regular foot-tapping good guitar licks,  this will also be the first album on which he'll be presenting his recently acquired fiddle skills!  

If you know Ryan's music then you probably just want to skip straight to the Perks section and support the project! Otherwise, read on...

You Don't Know Ryan McNally???

Quebec native and Yukoner these last 10 years,  Ryan McNally has been performing both originals and covers on stages across Canada, the U.S. and China for over 15 years. 

From apprenticeships in old blues song and history with Andy Cohen in Memphis, to rockabilly and jazz solo guitar with Paul Pigat in Vancouver; to studying fiddle with Sammy Lind and jazz-blues aficionado Aaron Gunn in New Orleans Ryan never ceases to push beyond his own limits and sharpen his musical chops. 

With this new album he plans to do just that by exploring new band arrangements,  different guitar styles and connecting the dots between the old blues and Calypso that he's been immersed in through his travels to New Orleans, Memphis and elsewhere. 

The musicians who'll be recording on the album are all incredibly talented; Marc Lindy on tuba ; Olivier de Colombel on baritone sax and Patrick Hamilton on bass drum and vocals.Two out of three have been accompanying Ryan in his live performances for quite a while and the easy cohesion of bandmates is apparent in their live and recorded material. 

What We Need & What You Get

In reality, the album will end up costing a minimum of $15,000. We're asking for $7,000 because that will cover the majority of urgent costs and will make for a true collaboration on all fronts between you, the project supporters, and Ryan. 

Funds will go towards all aspects of the production, from hiring musicians and paying for the studio and technician, to mixing and mastering the album, to printing cds (and vinyls if we make it to our full goal!)...and hey, maybe even some promotion of the album if we pass our goal a bit so more people can hear this awesome music!

We've decided to opt for Flexible Funding, which means that even if for some reason we don't reach the full amount your contribution will still be able to go towards completing the project! 

PERKS

Perks are what you get in gratitude for your support of the album project!

You can get full details on each perk by clicking on them in the right hand column where they're all listed, but here are the basic details...

For a $ 20 contribution you get a digital album & personal thank you note 

$ 35 = a signed copy of physical album 

$75 = a vinyl of the new album (***note that this perk will only be available IF we reach our full goal!)

$100 = a private guitar lesson with Ryan McNally (in person if in Whitehorse or at a tour location, or via skype)

$200 = full anthology of Ryan McNally's cds, plus a signed poster and t-shirt

$500 = a song written for you by Ryan!

$ 700 = Ryan will be your personal chauffeur for a day in his classic 1965 F100 Ford pickup (***limited to Whitehorse residents)

$1000 = a house concert in the Yukon 

$2000 = a house concert anywhere in Canada!

ALBUM RELEASE GOAL: Fall 2018 

Our goal is to send out all the perks by late fall or early winter 2018!

**Please note that for house concerts we'll need to be in touch about booking a date and we're aiming to have them all scheduled for winter 2018 or spring 2019.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We're deeply grateful for any amount you can contribute to help this album get off the ground! We also totally understand that not everyone will be able to support the project financially, so...

If you're not able to support the campaign financially at this time (or even if you are) it would be GREAT if you would share the campaign around with your networks...(P.S. A little tip: it always helps a lot if you write something recommending the campaign in your post instead of just sharing the link, though either way we'll appreciate it :)).

story:
Important News!
Our tour to England has been postponed due to circumstances beyond our control.
We will however be touring to England in the Spring of 2019, so if you are happy to still help us, we thank you very much!
Your Contributions will still be put to our tour to England in April.
Thank You very much Sidizens, keep Rockin!

11 backers already, 1123 to go!
We can do this Sidizens :)

In today's modern music industry we see less bands pounding the pavement touring and more internet related means of making an income. It seems the real essence of what it means to be a real touring musician gets somewhat lost. For us in Uncle Sid, the idea of bringing our music and show to you, the fans in person is what we strive for.

Uncle Sid stays true to the roots of rock and roll, we have our own little modern nuances up the ol sleeve, and we have also been on the road several times, mostly out of our own pocket. However, for this tour we will be traveling to distant lands in a galaxy far far away and some with haunted Castles (actually it's in the UK , but still farrrr!!!) and with your help we will also become a touring juggernaut just as our forefathers in Rock'n Metal once were and still are.

Just recently on April 28th, 2018 Uncle Sid was very fortunate to be given the opportunity to support one of Britain's finest acts : URIAH HEEP and with our UK tour just around the corner we may have another opportunity to share the stage with them again, with your help Uncle Sid will be able to keep the touring roots of rock alive and hopefully inspire others to take the torch and pass it on as well.

Uncle Sid is seeking your help as we need funds to rent a Van, for our equipment (Guitar and Bass Amp and cab, 3 vocal mic's, a drum kit with cymbals and our Hotel rooms.

If we break it down, we are seeking 1134 donors @ $15. to achieve our goal.
We also have some really cool perks for those who want to contribute a bit more.

This is the currency exchange in England at the moment:

$17,415.40 CAD = $10,000.00 GBP

This is what we need help with:
Transportation Rental - $4000.00 GBP

Band Equipment Rental - $2000.00 GBP

Lodging -  $4000.00

We feel our very strongly from talking with people in the Business and Fans that Europe is a very good market for our music.
There are many bands that tour Europe and end up making a very good living making music and playing live!
We had a contributor help us get our band to Japan in 2017 and the promoter wants us back and also wants to book us in Taiwan for a couple Festivals in 2019.
So we feel if we do the same thing in Europe it will be an even bigger impact!
This tour will pave the way to touring for several months in many Countries around Europe in 2019 and beyond.
By contributing to our cause you will be helping us as an Independent band get to the next level which is to get picked up by Professional Management, Booking Agency or Promoter.
We have everything else in place and are ready to tour.

Risks & Challenges

This band works very hard on our music and the business. In return all we want is to be able to tour and make a living playing our music. A lot is riding on this particular album and tour. It will determine the longevity of the band for the next several years  and see if Uncle Sid will get the fan base to continue tour Europe in the future. We are Independent and we book our own tours. Europe is a market we feel will be very strong for us. It will give us access to many people with a small amount of traveling with way more people to play for, which should in turn give us the success we are looking for to keep Uncle Sid touring for years to come. We feel very strongly that this will be a great market for us and get us on the road to furthering our careers.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, You can still help us! 
Share our story with your friends and family by tagging us via Facebook or Twitter.
Taking a few moments to share our story, via a click or swipe, is a valuable gift that Uncle Sid really appreciates.

See you on the road Sidizens!

Horns UP! \m/

Uncle Sid

story:
The Riverview Jazz Festival is a community-based series that brings world-class music to the people through a week-long run of over 40 free events happening all throughout Hudson County, New Jersey.



This event has been responsible for giving many people their first true taste of the wide world of jazz. As a non-profit, RiverviewJazz.Org aims to build audience for America's original art form by introducing this incredible music in a creative, fun, and relaxed setting. 

The 6th Annual Riverview Jazz Festival begins June 1st and culminates at its flagship event on Saturday, June 9th at Riverview Fisk Park in Jersey City Heights, a beautiful venue that overlooks the iconic Manhattan skyline. This year, there'll be two stages, world-class musicians, market vendors, food trucks, delicious beer, an art walk, a record riot, and an unparalleled VIP experience.

The Myriad Sounds of Jazz

This year, attendees will be treated to everything jazz has to offer, running the gamut from classic bebop to Brazilian forró; from 1920s trad jazz and tap dancing alongside a full-on salsa orchestra to soul jazz and swamp blues. Trust us, there's a little something for everyone.



Some of the amazing artists that will be featured at our flagship event include Wallace Roney, Winard Harper, Lakecia Benjamin & Soul Squad, Doug Beavers, Brian Charette, Walter Parks, Andrea Brachfield, and Rob Curto's Forró for All.

The cost of an event like the Riverview Jazz Festival runs well over $70,000. As many of you may know, we don't charge for any of the events happening during the festival; we rely strictly on donations to make all of this possible. The majority of the funds are raised through private investment and support from our partners, community event productions, grants, and the support of jazz lovers and people who simply want exciting events happening in their community.

This year, we want to get you, the fans, our community, more deeply involved with the Riverview Jazz Festival and invite you to become a patron of the greatest art around. We are seeking $10,000 to help us subsidize the cost of the musicians' fees. This will enable us to pay the performers more generously so that they can generously give you more of what you've come to expect from them and us. It's also important to us that we keep the festival free to the public, and by helping directly support the musicians, you will become an integral instrument in helping us fulfill our mission of bringing jazz to the people.

Again, all of the funds raised from this Indiegogo campaign will go directly to the artists performing at our flagship event on Saturday, June 9th at gorgeous Riverview Fisk Park, located atop the Palisades and overlooking the Hudson River. In exchange for your donation, you'll also be getting our 2018 Riverview Jazz Festival swag (new mugs and T-shirts illustrated by Robert Marks) at substantial discounts –– including passes for our VIP Experience, CDs from the musicians (coming soon!), and some truly exclusive perks, most of which will only be available during this campaign. 

Here's a hint of what our main merch will look like. (Though please note, final colors, etc. may be a little different than these mock-ups.)

With eight bands, two stages, and thousands of attendees anticipated this year, the 6th Annual Riverview Jazz Festival will strive to continue the long-standing tradition of being a community gathering in the truest sense, with residents and tourists sitting together sitting on blankets, sipping ice cold beer on a warm summer day, and taking in the view, the food, and the spectacle that makes up the Riverview Jazz Festival.



RiverviewJazz.Org is committed to building a self-sustaining audience for the arts by presenting various forms of jazz to the community in a combination of traditional and non-traditional spaces. This is achieved through year-round programs that feature world-class musicians in accessible settings, including but not limited to our annual Riverview Jazz Festival in Hudson County, NJ.

RiverviewJazz.Org was founded in 2013. RJO is a recognized 501(c)(3) non-profit organization.

We firmly believe in respect. Respecting the artists. Respecting the audience. Respecting the vendors and respecting the job. When we receive support for large-scale community projects like the Riverview Jazz Festival, it encourages us to not only continue, but to keep pushing for bigger and better events in our community. For this, we not only respect you –– we thank you.

All photography courtesy of Alexis Rotter.

story:
Hello! I'm Magenta - a singer-songwriter, choir leader and singing teacher based in London. I've been writing songs since my early teens and I am finally self-releasing my debut single - Circles - on June 8th. This is a real passion project and an incredibly exciting step - I can't wait to share my music with you all. I'm at the start of my promotional campaign and i've already been picked up by BBC Introducing East Midlands and Circles is Song of the Week. 

So, why do I need your help? I am looking for your support in helping me to continue my musical journey, releasing a four track EP and creating more music. Producing music is extraordinarily expensive - my single cost in the region of £500 to record, and that involved a lot of mates rates along the way (I am hugely grateful). I would love to release my EP in late 2018 but to do this I need your backing to cover session musicians, a producer, recording vocals, mixing and mastering as well as a promotional campaign. All of these elements are essential for my music to reach you. 

During my career I have worked with jazz star Wynton Marsalis, Disney, trance DJs Genix and Solarstone, as well as singing lead vocals for leading major dance labels. Most recently I have been writing with songwriting veteran Michael Garvin (23 #1s including Jennifer Lopez’ Waiting for Tonight and George Benson’s Never Give Up on a Good Thing) and I am currently writing with the DWB production team. Alongside songwriting, I conduct choirs and appeared on The One Show in 2015 when I was named BBC ‘Unsung Hero’ for my work with community music. In 2017 I had the opportunity to work with Gary Barlow on his West End musical GIRLS. I led two mass choirs assembled to perform with Barlow at the Royal Variety Show and the Olivier Awards and also recorded a track with him that I later performed with the cast of GIRLS on the BBC’s Strictly Come Dancing. My music is influenced by artists such as Joni Mitchell, Carol King and the Cardigans. 

Within this site there are various offers - everything from receiving a signed copy of my single to a bespoke lullaby written especially for a little one in your life, written and recorded by my wonderful musician friends Karen and Mike Eaves. 

If you are unable to support me financially I am still incredibly grateful for your help - please share my music on social media or this campaign using the Indiegogo share button.

Thank you so much, as always, for your support - I truly truly appreciate it. 

Much love,

Magenta
story_txt:
Hello! I'm Magenta - a singer-songwriter, choir leader and singing teacher based in London. I've been writing songs since my early teens and I am finally self-releasing my debut single - Circles - on June 8th. This is a real passion project and an incredibly exciting step - I can't wait to share my music with you all. I'm at the start of my promotional campaign and i've already been picked up by BBC Introducing East Midlands and Circles is Song of the Week. 
So, why do I need your help? I am looking for your support in helping me to continue my musical journey, releasing a four track EP and creating more music. Producing music is extraordinarily expensive - my single cost in the region of £500 to record, and that involved a lot of mates rates along the way (I am hugely grateful). I would love to release my EP in late 2018 but to do this I need your backing to cover session musicians, a producer, recording vocals, mixing and mastering as well as a promotional campaign. All of these elements are essential for my music to reach you. 
During my career I have worked with jazz star Wynton Marsalis, Disney, trance DJs Genix and Solarstone, as well as singing lead vocals for leading major dance labels. Most recently I have been writing with songwriting veteran Michael Garvin (23 #1s including Jennifer Lopez’ Waiting for Tonight and George Benson’s Never Give Up on a Good Thing) and I am currently writing with the DWB production team. Alongside songwriting, I conduct choirs and appeared on The One Show in 2015 when I was named BBC ‘Unsung Hero’ for my work with community music. In 2017 I had the opportunity to work with Gary Barlow on his West End musical GIRLS. I led two mass choirs assembled to perform with Barlow at the Royal Variety Show and the Olivier Awards and also recorded a track with him that I later performed with the cast of GIRLS on the BBC’s Strictly Come Dancing. My music is influenced by artists such as Joni Mitchell, Carol King and the Cardigans. 
Within this site there are various offers - everything from receiving a signed copy of my single to a bespoke lullaby written especially for a little one in your life, written and recorded by my wonderful musician friends Karen and Mike Eaves. 
If you are unable to support me financially I am still incredibly grateful for your help - please share my music on social media or this campaign using the Indiegogo share button.

Thank you so much, as always, for your support - I truly truly appreciate it. 
Much love,
Magenta

story:
TRACKLIST  [D I G I T A L]
01 Eldorado cuts by DJ Lil Cut
02 Mirame
03 Masterchef feat. Lexotan
04 Payaso feat. Jack The Smoker
05 Para Siempre
06 Guantanamera feat. Ernia, Francikario
07 Apprezzo il consiglio
08 Caracas feat. Axos, Lanz Khan

**All tracks produced by Weirdo**

IL PROGETTO

• Ciao siamo Jangy Leeon e Weirdo e oggi vi presentiamo il nostro nuovo album: ELDORADO.
Facciamo parte entrambi di Mad Soul Legacy, rispettata crew milanese attiva dal 2006. Rispettivamente rapper e producer, abbiamo unito le forze per realizzare questo progetto a 4 mani.
Si tratta del proseguimento di una collaborazione nata già dal disco precedente di Jangy (L’Era Della Bestia) di cui Weirdo ha gestito la direzione artistica, oltre ad aver prodotto gran parte dei beat (Bodas De Oro, Welcome To My Hell, etc.)
Con “Eldorado” abbiamo consolidato questo rapporto collaborativo gestendo insieme ogni fase del progetto e creando un disco hip hop vario ma con un filone ben preciso: la musica latina.
Per intederci alcuni degli artisti che ci hanno ispirato per le sonorità di questo album sono: Cypress Hill, Tony Touch, Psycho Realm, Beatnuts, Big Pun...

DI COSA ABBIAMO BISOGNO E COSA VI OFFRIAMO

• La musica è la nostra passione, ma non ancora il nostro lavoro. Le dedichiamo praticamente ogni momento libero a disposizione e non è sempre facile perchè non avendo un'etichetta alle spalle facciamo tutto da soli.
Il vostro supporto diventa fondamentale per rendere concreta la visione che abbiamo del progetto.
Avremmo potuto distribuire l'album semplicemente in digitale ma siamo legati a un'era in cui i supporti fisici per ascoltare la musica avevano un valore, anche affettivo. Da qui la nostra decisione di voler stampare in CD una versione limitata dell'album: dedicata a chiunque apprezzi davvero la nostra musica e gli sforzi fatti per realizzarla. 250 copie autografate di cui NON FAREMO RISTAMPA.
Chiunque compri il CD di Eldorado riceverà in omaggio una copia digitale dell'album!
Comprare l'album non è l'unico modo per supportarci, infatti nella campagna trovate molte altre opzioni tra cui magliette, vinili o addirittura la possiblità di farsi produrre un beat esclusivo da Weirdo per il vostro progetto!
Ogni centesimo raccolto da questa campagna verrà utilizzato per stampare/distribuire questo disco e offrirvi un prodotto con la maggior qualità possibile.

COSA SUCCEDE SE NON DOVESSIMO RAGGIUNGERE IL NOSTRO OBBIETTIVO?

• Assolutamente nulla, il disco verrebbe stampato comunque e tutti riceverete ciò per cui avete pagato.
Naturalmente questo comporterebbe maggiore sforzo da parte nostra e la possibilità concreta di non ripetere più operazioni simili in futuro.
In sostanza se credi in noi e nella nostra musica il momento di agire è adesso.

METODO DI PAGAMENTO [CLICCA SU "BACK IT"]
• Indiegogo accetta pagamenti tramite carta di credito. Se non dovessi avere la carta no problem, potrai procedere ugualmente tramite paypal/ricarica postepay.
1) Contattaci alla nostra email ufficiale della campagna: eldoradoalbum@gmail.com
2) Inserisci come oggetto "ELDORADO" e indicaci nella mail quale "pacchetto" vorresti ricevere tra quelli elencati nella campagna.
Tutti i prezzi sono inclusi di spedizione!

VUOI SUPPORTARE LA CAMPAGNA MA NON PUOI PAGARE?

• Condividi questo pagina sui tuoi social, parla di noi e del nostro progetto a chiunque reputi potrebbe essere davvero interessato e abbia la possibilità di contribuire. Ogni persona in più ci avvicina di un passo al nostro obbiettivo, ogni piccolo contributo diventa importante.
Noi speriamo davvero di poter realizzare questo disco insieme a voi.

story:
THIS IS ME

Daniele was born in Rome on February 10th 1992. 

He has been singing since the age of 10 and over time, what seemed like a simple passion, has become a true profession. In the his early years as a singer, Daniele perfected the Voicecraft Method thanks to Gabriella Scalise and continued his studies abroad while attending various Singing/Performing Arts academies. Among the most important are the MALTA ACADEMY OF PERFORMING ARTS (Malta) , WEST FINLAND COLLEGE (Finland) SETH RIGGS ACADEMY (Los Angeles), where he studied SLS - Speech Level Singing. 

At the age of 16 he was chosen as the protagonist of the first season of the tv show “Ti lascio Una Canzone,” broadcasted live on RaiUno by the Ariston Theater. 

A turning point in Daniele’s career came in 2012 as a semi-finalist on the TV show "The X FACTOR”.  On November 29, 2012, during the semifinal of the show, he presented his first original song “UN GIORNO IN PIU,’” written especially for him by American songwriter Gavin De Graw. 

On April 18 2014, iTunes and all digital stores released his second single "ORA CHE SEI GRANDE”

In January 13 2018, ITunes and all digital stores released his third single “GAME ON”. The song represents the Daniele’s true artistic soul: an international sound that unites pop and rock.

The song has been broadcast on various Radio Stations throughout The United States and won an award as "BEST VIDEO POP OF THE MONTH" .

WHY I NEED YOUR HELP

This project will be impossible without your contribution to help me cover the costs associated with producing a CD and the Official Videoclips. I have set my funding goal at 15,000 Euros in order to help us cover these aspects of the project: 

- Writing Sessions with the best songwriters

- Production of tracks, which will be new and original arrangements.

- Recording of live musicians to offer the best quality of sound possible

- Vocal recording studio sessions and final mixing and editing by professional sound engineers

- Album art and design and production

 

CONTRIBUTIONS AND THEIR BENEFITS

Music is my life and i can't live without it. Nowadays major recording labels sponsor and help only a few artists and most of the contracts they offer are ridiculously binding, That's why i need to do it by myself. I hope that if you have ever enjoyed one of my performances, live or on TV, you will consider donating.

THANK YOU VERY MUCH.

story:
Lumina is a professional women’s ensemble dedicated to the mystery, beauty, and hope inherent in music. Based in the Twin Cities of Minneapolis and St. Paul, Minnesota, Lumina has collaborated with faith communities, schools, and choral organizations to present concerts, special church services, and educational workshops. Our programming draws from a rich and diverse well of musical sources, including Medieval chants, Renaissance motets, and folk song traditions, as well as works by living and local composers. Our goal is to share the spiritual experience of music through performance, participation, and education.

Lumina has been singing together for four years, and we focus on music with hope, healing, and light. We've had fun singing together and for our wonderful audiences, many of whom have asked about a recording—so, we're about to answer that request and further our mission to adding a little light and compassion in the world!

In this campaign, we are looking to fund a recording to give away to individuals in hospice care, their families, and care partners as they look to music as a source of healing and hope.

Any amount will help defray printing cost of rehearsal, recording, studio time, and printing. The American Composers Forum (ACF) has generously agreed to be our fiscal sponsor for this project in order to make your contributions tax-deductible.

You, of course, can help us fund this and receive all the tracks! We would ideally need $10,000 to get us to that first printing of 1000 CDs for distribution to hospitals and hospice organizations. You can contribute $25 or higher to receive your own digital copies of the tracks, and many rewards also include Lumina swag or appearances WITH the ladies of Lumina. Any additional funds raised over our campaign minimum will be used to print more CDs to give away. Not for sale! 

Our rewards are just like us: UNIQUE. Do you want to sit in on the recording experience and hear the bloopers in real time? Would you dare to have coffee with Lumina for an hour?! All these rewards go toward helping comfort patients and their family and friends!

Specifically, do you have an event (a party, a BBQ, etc.) on Saturday, May 26th? Lumina will come to you!

We're hitting the road in an RV to come to sing for you! May 26th, we'll be able to pop by your celebrations to offer you all the perks of being a supporter, plus 15 minutes of music to entertain your guests. We know: How do you even begin to plan your day a month away? Let us help you! Find some friends, find some food, relax into the lovely Saturday that we know it will be, and let us serenade you! Your schedule will have to be a bit flexible, but we will be in contact with you to schedule our trip so it's convenient for you and efficient for us. We can only stay in the metro area, but perhaps if you live outside, consider sending a surprise singing telegram to someone you know (or don't know?)! As a Firework Supporter, you also get an exclusive access to a secret perk, to be redeemed at your event!

With your help, we can provide this free access to music—we will not sell these tracks once they are recorded! Our campaign ensures a grassroots movement of compassion and love, and we are so grateful to share this with our community of healers.

If a financial gift isn't in your budget, please consider sharing this with your friends on social media, members of your choirs, and most of all, reach out to us so we know you're just as excited about this as we are!

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
About This Campaign

We are a band of guys who share a lot of life together.  We began the project of what is now Shiny Penny in the heart of Kokomo, IN years ago.

We enjoy nature adventures, long boarding, playful experiences with yorkies, and really good pizza (amongst other things).

We also like community a lot. As a result of the music we've written and the shows we've performed throughout our journey, we've been able to be in community with so many of you (and it's beautiful). 

Through the years, we've experienced ups and downs along the way. We've worked hard, played hard, and invested much into what we do. With all of this, we've also grown. Through our growth, we've recognized a desire to do more with Shiny Penny than we ever have before.

We started this campaign because we have new music to make and to share with you, and though we have big ideas for the band's future, we simply don't have the means to do it all on our own. 

We've created what we believe is our best music to date, and we're passionate about the message and story it brings to the table. We also have new ideas to enhance our shows and the overall experience that we believe will bring us closer together with you all.

Our dream is take Shiny Penny to the next level on all fronts, and with your help, we believe we will get there soon.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal for this campaign is to raise $25,000. All of the money received will go towards the many aspects of what we plan to achieve with the future of Shiny Penny, including:

  • Fresh, high quality recordings of our new music 
  • Purchasing a new, reliable vehicle and trailer for our travels
  • Music videos
  • Stage production (sound, lights, props, etc)
  • Camera gear and computers to help us provide more higher quality video content to you on a regular basis
  • Fresh, official Shiny Penny merchandise
  • And more
As a thank you for donating, we are offering unique perks at many levels of contribution. With options like your own private shows, date nights with us, and more, we can't wait to give back to you in lieu of your support.

    Why This Is Important

    Though we're just a small part of a really big world, we recognize that extraordinary things usually come from the seemingly ordinary. We've been given gifts to write, share, and perform music, and we believe that God is calling us to share these gifts with as many of you who will listen. We seek to inspire, encourage, and help our fellow humans in any way we can, and this music gives us an avenue to do it.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Even if you're unable to financially help us, you can still:

    • Pray for us
    • Share this campaign by posting on your social media pages (you can easily do this by using the Indiegogo share tools)
    • Text, call, and/or direct-message your friends, family, and as many people as you can

    Feel free to reach out to us at shinypennymusic@gmail.com if you have any additional ideas as to how you can help us spread the word.

    Thank you so much.

    You are a huge part of what keeps us going. Thank you for your time, consideration, and most of all - your love.

    Much love,

    Stix, Brad, Eric, and Dean

story:
La Vaghezza is an ensemble performing music of the 17th and 18th centuries on historical instruments. We met last year, and felt a musical and human bond that made us want to create an ensemble together, despite our living in three different countries. It's been a bit difficult to coordinate meetings and concerts for the five of us, but we've managed to meet every 2 months to plan, rehearse, and perform. While we realize the challenges ahead of us, we think that by participating in competitions, festivals, and young artists schemes, we will be able to make our ensemble a sustainable and long term project. 

We've been very working hard and doing whatever we can to create opportunities for ourselves.
We had a small, self organized tour of central Italy, during which:

  • we competed in the Maurizio Pratola International Music Competition in L'Aquila and were awarded first place,
  • we performed concerts in L'Aquila, Roccantica, Forano, and Montebuono.

In August, we've been invited to perform fringe concerts at the MA Festival in Bruges and Utrecht Oude Muziek, two of the world's most important early music festivals:

  • August 8, 14:00 - Provinciaal Hof, Bruges, Belgium
  • August 27, 15:30 - Polman's Huis, Utrecht, Netherlands

In September, we will compete in the Premio Selifa International Music Competition, and also audition for Eeemerging (Emerging European Ensembles), which would allow us periods of residencies, concerts, and the possibility to record a CD together.

In October, we will be making a demo recording in Berlin, where we will be working with a sound engineer we know well and trust. 

Why we need your help
We need your help, because wanting to realize our plans, our expenses are growing. Having members from the UK, Italy, and France, we have to budget about €1000 just for travel and very basic accomodation expenses. 
On top of that, the cello and lute often require their own seats on the plane, which require extra tickets.
When we meet, we are responsible for our own accommodation. With a group of 5, even in budget accommodation, it can cost €200/night. We do what we can to keep expenses down, but there are some things that we cannot do without.
When we meet, our harpsichordist often has to bring his own instrument (for which we must rent a van), or we must rent a harpsichord in the area. This, depending on the amount of time, can cost upwards of €400. 
Competitions and schemes often require inscription fees of about €150 per group. Wanting to take our group to the next level, we treat these as an investment.

Risks and Challenges
We have set this campaign up to ask for your help in realizing our plans. In reality, there are no risks to this project not succeeding. Even if we do not reach our goal, we are prepared to borrow and to invest our own money in this undertaking. Any extra funds raised will be used towards fees for further competitions and festival applications, further travel expenses,  and promotional material such as recordings and a website that is easy to navigate.
We are very dedicated to making our ensemble move forward and we will continue our very hard work in order to do everything to succeed. 

How you can help
We value your support. Please take a look at our perks!
If you cannot make a monetary contribution, please consider helping us out by sharing our campaign on social media, email, or word of mouth.

Thank you so much!

La Vaghezza
Victoria Melik, Mayah Kadish - violins
Anastasia Baraviera - violoncello
Gianluca Geremia - lute
Marco Crosetto - harpsichord

vaghezza.wordpress.com
facebook.com/lavaghezza/
@lavaghezza
#lavaghezzasummertour
story_txt:
La Vaghezza is an ensemble performing music of the 17th and 18th centuries on historical instruments. We met last year, and felt a musical and human bond that made us want to create an ensemble together, despite our living in three different countries. It's been a bit difficult to coordinate meetings and concerts for the five of us, but we've managed to meet every 2 months to plan, rehearse, and perform. While we realize the challenges ahead of us, we think that by participating in competitions, festivals, and young artists schemes, we will be able to make our ensemble a sustainable and long term project. We've been very working hard and doing whatever we can to create opportunities for ourselves.We had a small, self organized tour of central Italy, during which:
we competed in the Maurizio Pratola International Music Competition in L'Aquila and were awarded first place,
we performed concerts in L'Aquila, Roccantica, Forano, and Montebuono.
In August, we've been invited to perform fringe concerts at the MA Festival in Bruges and Utrecht Oude Muziek, two of the world's most important early music festivals:
August 8, 14:00 - Provinciaal Hof, Bruges, Belgium
August 27, 15:30 - Polman's Huis, Utrecht, Netherlands
In September, we will compete in the Premio Selifa International Music Competition, and also audition for Eeemerging (Emerging European Ensembles), which would allow us periods of residencies, concerts, and the possibility to record a CD together.In October, we will be making a demo recording in Berlin, where we will be working with a sound engineer we know well and trust. Why we need your helpWe need your help, because wanting to realize our plans, our expenses are growing. Having members from the UK, Italy, and France, we have to budget about €1000 just for travel and very basic accomodation expenses. On top of that, the cello and lute often require their own seats on the plane, which require extra tickets.When we meet, we are responsible for our own accommodation. This, depending on the amount of time, can cost upwards of €400. Competitions and schemes often require inscription fees of about €150 per group. Wanting to take our group to the next level, we treat these as an investment.Risks and ChallengesWe have set this campaign up to ask for your help in realizing our plans. In reality, there are no risks to this project not succeeding. Even if we do not reach our goal, we are prepared to borrow and to invest our own money in this undertaking. Any extra funds raised will be used towards fees for further competitions and festival applications, further travel expenses,  and promotional material such as recordings and a website that is easy to navigate.We are very dedicated to making our ensemble move forward and we will continue our very hard work in order to do everything to succeed. How you can helpWe value your support. Please take a look at our perks!If you cannot make a monetary contribution, please consider helping us out by sharing our campaign on social media, email, or word of mouth.Thank you so much!La VaghezzaVictoria Melik, Mayah Kadish - violinsAnastasia Baraviera - violoncelloGianluca Geremia - luteMarco Crosetto - harpsichordvaghezza.wordpress.comfacebook.com/lavaghezza/@lavaghezza#lavaghezzasummertour

story:
Rant Maggie Rant came together in 2008. Our debut album "World's Edge' was released in 2009. Since then, two live albums were released: 'Frost & Fire: A Celtic Christmas Celebration' in 2011 and 'Rant Maggie Rant: Live at Hugh's Room' in 2013 - all independently.  The band continues to grow and evolve.

The process to record "Latitude" began in early 2015. We wrote, sourced, chose and arranged new material that really emphasized each member's influences, likes and strengths. We have created a record that is as diverse and representative of the band as our live shows. We are extremely proud of it and cannot wait to share 'Latitude' with you.

For 'Latitude', Lindsay, Glen & Barry were joined by regular band members Rob Larose, Steve Clark and Daev Clysdale. In addition, the band invited some very special and talented friends to be involved. Linda McRae (formally of Spirit Of The West), Katherine Wheatley, Alberto Suarez (Jesse Cook/Sultans Of String) and Ravi Naimpally, all joined in to help us take this project to that special place we were striving for - a world class recording. And we can't thank each and everyone of them enough.

We have to send a special shout-out to Alberto Suarez, not only for his contribution on this recording, but for performing dozens of shows with the band live over 2015 and starting the recording process with us, adding some incredible percussion that perfectly illustrates what we always set out to accomplish.

With the engineering and mixing wizardry of Nicholas Tjelios, the band was in expert hands. We became ensconced in the process with Nik, recording at Andrew McPherson's (Eccodek) Monastereo Studio in Guelph, Ontario, Canada. The album was mixed at Scott Merritt's studio The cottaGe also in Guelph. Huge thanks goes to Nik for his tireless efforts, focus and attention to detail. Also to Andrew & Scott for the use of their studios! Awesome creative spaces!

Mastering and manufacturing are our next goals, along with the most important aspect of any record - promotion - getting it out there. The recording is paid for, now we have to raise funds to get it mastered, manufactured and promoted to the world (as much as possible). And you can become part of our team as we head into this next chapter. Did we say we were excited about it!

What's Needed & What You Get

While the band has completed and funded the recording, (engineering, musicians, studio time and guests of "Latitude" spending close to $15,000 so far),  there is more to complete and much more needs to happen before the release date. What you get is to follow our journey with this record, with regular updates, daily interaction if you want and special messages only pledgers will receive. Plus of course you get the pledge you choose.

The Impact

Your help will get this album completed and into the hands of not only fans of Celtic and World Music worldwide, but taste-makers, radio stations, the music press, record companies, booking agents and venues! Like our last campaign where we raised over $6,600 to showcase at the world's largest International Folk Conference in Kansas City in front of hundreds of industry professionals from all over the world, we need to plant even more seeds now. Thanks to everyone who donated to that, our very successful first campaign. Now we need your help to get this record to the next level and through the next several phases.

So, here we go again....ready to jump on board?

There are a lot of folks we need to send this record to around the world who we met in Kansas City. This is really the followup of what we did in Kansas City. We can't wait to hear what you and they have to say about this record and what can come from this push into new territories.

Phase One - raise ~$3000 to release the record (Mastering, Artwork, Manufacturing) will press an initial 1,000 units.

Phase Two - raise ~$1500 minimum to create a professional video to promote everywhere

Phase Three - raise ~$1500 to promote in Canada (publicist, materials and postage to radio, press, taste-makers and web-blogs)

Phase Three - raise ~$6,000+++ to promote to several territories including USA, Europe, Australia and elsewhere (limited only by the budget available and this will determine numbers, length and scope). The more we raise, the more we promote. There is no limit really, but $6,000 covers an initial campaign into the US (500+) and about 50 packages targeted around the world.

Risks & Challenges

There are no risks. The record is done and we will manufacture it and send it out. But without the budget above, it will limit what we will be able to do. Ideally, the band would like to be able to follow all of the steps of the release, especially the aspect of promotion here in Canada and globally. The more funds that are raised, the more we can move forward to promote 'Latitude' around the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize that not everyone can help financially. If you would like to help in some other way, the band will need folks to assist with the mail-outs (locally), postering (wherever we are playing), or even simply sharing the campaign with your friends! Please talk to any of the band if you can help! Share, share and share some more. As much as you can! It will help more than you might think. Let's start a tweet trend! Haha! Thanks for any way you can assist. It is very much appreciated! Lindsay, Glen & Barry

story:
Hi everybody! 

My name is Zander Schloss. Perhaps you may have heard of my from my work in such bands as the Circle Jerks and the Weirdos as a bass player. Or maybe as a guitar player and musical director for the legendary Joe Strummer. Oh I know. Kevin the nerd in Repo Man. Well, I've done a lot of things in this long life of mine but the one thing that I've never done and always wanted to do is make a solo album. And so it begins with a five song EP. Don't get me wrong, I got 50 more where these came from. You see, I don't have a choice in the matter. I was put on this great earth to make music. But at this point in history, us musicians need a little help from the people. The giant dinosaur that is the music industry has closed the castle doors and only mousketeers can dwell within its walls. That's good news because now us old veterans and craftsman don't need the shitty committee to approve our content, age, game plan, etc. It's in our hands and now a new renaissance can and will begin. Please help me bring my songs to you the people. My music is heartfelt. I'm on a mission to make the world a less shitty place one song at a time. This is just the beginning.

story:
What is This All About?

Aurorae is an experimental postmetal band. Creating music with emotion, passion and intense atmosphere that spans many genres (jazz, grindcore, black metal, etc.). We have written material for our debut EP, "Transcendence". To read more on Aurorae, please visit BIO page on our website.

We also have some demos up on Soundcloud of tracks in the works. While some of these may or may not be on the final EP, they will provide foundation for our future releases.

Soundcloud Demos: https://soundcloud.com/auroraeofficial/sets/demos

How Will The Money Be Used? 

We have already begun the recording process. We have studio time booked at Epilogue Sound in South Florida. We are working with Travis Orbin of Darkest Hour on drums and percussion. Mastering is being done by Chris Common, who's list of work include the likes of The Mars Volta, ISIS, Chelsea Wolfe, Pelican, Mouth of the Architect, and many, many more. 

What Perks Are You Offering?

These are examples of what can be had with your contribution to our campaign, along with a digital download copy of the Transcendence EP, CDs, signed posters, and more.

How Do I Know If I Will Like Your Music?

Our music, while diverse in its influences, may not be for everyone. We appreciate any support you can give. Maybe you have an aunt, uncle, sibling, spouse or neighbor that would be interested what we offer. Maybe just a roommate that you'd love to annoy. Whatever your reason for donating, we appreciate it in every single way. To better ensure that everyone will have something to listen to, we will be providing an instrumental version of our first single, "Transcendence", to every contributor.

What If You Surpass Your Goal?

If we exceed our goal, we will record more songs and turn the current 5 song EP into a full length album and develop additional merchandise, something specifically for those that participated in the campaign. This items will be unique and just for our supporters.

I Would Love To Help, But I Don't Have Any Money. How Else Can I Help?

We understand that not everyone has the ability to participate financially. We have all been there. If you are unable to donate money, you can still help by spreading the word about Aurorae, and telling your friends about our campaign. Here are some immediate things you can do...

  • Tell your friends about Aurorae and this new project.
  • Post the campaign to Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr or Instagram. Any social media outlet for that matter.
  • Follow Aurorae on social media to like/share/retweet our posts, etc.
If you have any further questions about this campaign, the Aurorae project or any concerns send us an email at info@auroraeband.com.

story:
Campaign Summary

Hello, and thank you for visiting my Indiegogo campaign. My name is Steve Fulton (Boise, Idaho). I create, live and breath music. I’ve always been moved by music- even when I was a child, and as I've grown music has become my solace, my passion and my lifelong career. 

I have been a record producer/engineer and recording studio owner (Audio Lab) for over 24 years. I’ve been in countless bands, released many records, performed hundreds of live concerts, produced music-oriented events around the nation, sat in as a session musician for countless numbers of bands, and have stories from the road that have molded me into who I am today.

I am hoping that sharing my songs can provide this place of solace for others.

photo, Mati Young

It's time to share this musical milestone

With the years of experience I have gained helping others launch their musical dreams, it’s time for me to bring forth my musical milestone of songs I have been composing over the last several years. I’m ready to open up my writing journal again and share it with all of you. I hope you’ll continue to read and be a part of this musical journey “Eponym.”

Here is the breakdown

This is where the money goes:
Studio Time - Recording, mixing and mastering all songs (approx 35) $5000
Video Editing - $2000
CD Manufacturing ($1575 x2) $3150
Vinyl Manufacturing - $1600
Art Design - $1800 ( Designing the artwork for 2 cds, Vinyl, Posters, Merchandise, and more)
Purchasing of Merchandise - $1000
Marketing - Campaign for releasing these records - $2000
TOTAL cost - $16,550 

Photo, Jim Reidenbaugh


Perks 

Each donation will help fund this dual album, plus downloads, totaling 35 songs and with your contribution comes various gifts of thanks. We have selected many great listening and visual “thank-yous” in addition to rare musical opportunities that most people don’t have exposure to; private home concerts, studio recording attendance and joining in on the recording process. We believe everyone should have a glimpse into a musicians soul and quite honestly, what good is a funding campaign if you’re just going to keep your music to yourself, right? 

Thank you!

Crowd funding is another example of community and I am grateful for your involvement and support! Thank you!

Video Shot by Skytower Films. Video Overlay Photo Dave Meadows

story:
Greetings Music Lovers!

Thanks for checking out our campaign. We are the Mosey Boys, from Sonoma, California, and we would like you to pre-order our very first recording project, which will help us get it published!

  • The Mosey Boys are Adam, Jack and DT. Each of us are involved in music professionally aside from the Mosey Boys, but love playing together and have been wanting to put a recording of our sound for quite a while now.
  • We've already got all of the recording done. DT has a home studio that he produces other acts with, and he put up the time and equipment. We took the money from a couple gigs and are going to use that to pay for the mastering, which will be done by David Glasser at AirShow Mastering out of Boulder, Colorado.
  • Unlike other fundraising campaigns, we are not asking for donations, per se. We are offering up our recording for pre-order, which means you are actually buying something! With your help, we intend to have the finished product look, feel AND sound fantastic.


What We Need & What You Get


  • We are trying to raise $1999 for the printing of the CD, which includes the shipping costs (you wouldn't believe!)
  • A download, a CD, or a combination of both
  • Any funds raised will go to this end, even if we don't hit our goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • If you are able, we'd love your help in getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign. Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much for your support and love!
