story:
Hello world!

Català | Español | Português | Française | 

Skate Love Barcelona 2016 - International Skate Music Festival needs your ♡

Last year over 500 people travelled from 20 countries across all 5 continents to join our 2015 Festival weekend. It was a truly amazing experience with great music, dancing and skating.  Many connections were made. Great energy was shared. We felt the Skate Love in Barcelona! This year we expect over 1000 participants. 

Join our community and experience the love with us!


Photo by Salomon Kronthaler


Photo by Salomon Kronthaler


Photo by Remy van Donk - Origin Design

Photo by Maga Illustration / Graffiti Workshop by Soem

////////

The Festival

Skate Love Barcelona - International Skate Music Festival is a unique international music festival on wheels, dedicated to those with a passion for music, dancing and roller skating in a social and multicultural environment. BCN Roller Dance, founded in 2011, is the driving force behind this festival.

Our festival attracts some of the most impressive DJ's, athletes, skaters and life artists from all over the world! 

Skate Love Barcelona 2016 rolls out on Friday 16 September in Barcelona and continues throughout the weekend Saturday 17 - Sunday 18 September with the wide expanse promenade on Badalona beach as our main location. We have the support of the Barcelona Sports Institute, the Catalan Skating Federation and the City Council of Badalona and now we need your support too! 

You can't miss this unique event!

Web: www.skatelovebarcelona.com
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/events/881426128622548/
Tickets: https://skatelovebarcelona2016.eventbrite.es


Official Video 2016 by Knowmadlab


Promotional video 2015 by La Isla


SkateLoveBarcelona 2015 report on Catalán TV - Àrtic BTV


////////

The Team

A group people with passion! Roller skaters and enthusiasts that want to spread the love for this magical environment. Dreamers, believers and creators!

  • Michelle Barrios / Director
    Visual Communication Designer and BCN Roller Dance Founder.
    "This festival is a great way to spread good energies and to create connections through music, dancing and roller skating, 3 of my favourite things in life! Thanks for giving me the opportunity to work on a common dream!"
  • John Langwig / Business Developer
    Business owner in Somerville, Massachusetts and a roller skater since 1979.
    "In the 80's heyday of Skating, I spent two years living in San Francisco and Venice Beach CA. For me this festival manages to recreate the magic of those days, which is why I wanted to be involved."
  • Thérèse Hoben / Events Coordinator
    Event planner and organizer.
    "I don't even skate (yet) but I'm very excited about this project and I'm loving every minute of the preparations!"
  • Jordi Fernández / Sound & Production Partner
    Technical and Musical Producer and Director at SOIART.
    "Now I have experienced it in person, I understand the feeling."

  • Iván Alemán / General Collaborator
    Socio-cultural Projects Manager and Skating Instructor.
    "I'm passionate about music and roller skating and living my dream since I discovered BCN Roller Dance. Proud to be part of this project as often as I can!"
  • María Moreso / Logistics and Production

    • Independent Events Planner and Founder of Events and More. 
    "This is a cool, growing project that I want in my portfolio."

  • Jay DrRollerSkate / General Consultant

    • Long time roller skate expert, builder and now blogger at RollerSk8Berlin.
    "I am very happy to support this European approach and I'm proud to talk about this when I am in the US with the style skaters. Skating... without rinks."


////////

What We Need and What You Get

Up to now our festival has been a labour of love. This year we are working hard to be able to offer all collaborators and participating artists a small recompense for their time and work. 

By next year we could be almost entirely covered by sponsorship and ticket sales, but this year we need your help to cover the expenses involved in the organisation of a festival, such as: 
  • Marketing & Communication (promotional material, print costs, web...)
  • Logistics & Production (stands, market, transportation...)
  • Infrastructure (outdoor bathrooms, generator...)
  • Program coordination (DJ's, performing artists, workshop hosts...)
  • Permits, taxes, insurance, etc...
What if we don’t reach our goal?  
We won't be able to include some aspects in this year's festival but hey, the show must go on! Every cent raised here will go toward staging the best festival we can.
THE PERKS! Buy your tickets now and get a great deal on the price and additional crowdfunding extras. We've also included other ways for our supporters to help us MAKE the festival even if they can't join us this year.


////////

The Activities

We're still finalizing the program details but you can already look forward to...

  • Skate Love Disco! Friday 16 Sept. / Barcelona
    The meet, greet & official opening party with awesome activities and surprises! This year we want to include a business directory so that you can connect with other skaters for fun and also for business. You never know where your next opportunity might come from! 


    Photo by Salomon Kronthaler

  • Roller Jam! Saturday 17 - Sunday 18 Sept. / Badalona
    Roller dancing is the main activity and the soul of this festival! We will witness the world's premier men and women dancing to the awesome skate music in the best freestyle form.


    Photo by Remy van Donk - Origin Design


    Photo by Julie Bruhier

  • Workshops! Saturday 17 - Sunday 18 Sept. / Barcelona & Badalona
    Roller Skating, Hula Hoops, Skate Dancing, Jam Skating, Inline Dancing,
    Artistic Skating, Bowl Skating, Slalom     and more to come!


    Photo by Mark Cline Photography

  • Skate Show! Saturday 17 - Sunday 18 Sept. / Badalona
    This year we want to create a special showcase for the professional artists, a Skate Show by the beach area for everyone to shine! Get your camera ready! * The show will be one of the highlights of the festival, even for non-skaters who are looking for unique shows with great vibes. A great opportunity to witness passion, talent and joy on roller skates!


  • AND ALSO! Saturday 17 - Sunday 18 Sept. / Badalona
    Roller Dance Battles, Roller Derby exhibition, Bowl Skating, Urban Art, Meet ups, Movie Screening, Routes, Yoga, Custom Skates, ChiroMassage and more to come!

////////

Skate DJs Line Up

Our DJ's are roller skaters and/or dancers! A unique concept that we want to promote - new DJ’s and musicians dedicated to the skate-music style. We've got great representatives from different cities and varied backgrounds that makes this experience even more memorable. 
DJ Kapi - DJ Kisa - DJ Bart - Rollers HiFi + Angel Moraes - DJ Dr. Drew


Photo by SkateDJ Bart


Photo by SkateDJ Kapi (It's a selfie! Duh!)

////////

Risks and Challenges
  • Budgeting: The 20,000€ financial goal of this crowdfunding campaign covers 1/3 of what we need. Combined with additional ticket sales it will make up 2/3 of our total 2016 income. Having this money in advance will allow us to make all the festival improvements a reality this year.
  • Sponsors: As a startup we don't have established sponsors yet - we're completely self-funded. We're attracting growing sponsor interest and estimate that sponsorship will cover the remaining 1/3 of this year's expenses. By promoting our music festival on wheels, we're extending the appeal to other target markets and  potential sponsors.
  • A lot to do: Insurance, liability cover for attendees, city council meetings and permits in two cities, booths, outdoor bathrooms, power, music systems, taxes, ticket promotion, communication... there is a lot for us to do to get all the moving parts working together for a successful festival. 
  • Infrastructure: As we are outdoors by the beach, we have to create the entire infrastructure from scratch. This year we want to include a skate park area right there to have all the workshops in one place.
  • Better ticketing controls: This year we are using a new platform with better secure payment options and improved customer experience. One of the best ways you can support us is by attending and experiencing it for yourself!
  • Biggest challenge: to be able to enjoy the festival ourselves! We would LOVE to be able to enjoy the festival dancing with you! If we have resources in advance, we can do just that. Thank you!

////////

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help us out financially, please help sharing our campaign through Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and other social media platforms to spread the love!

If you are part of the roller skate community you can also help us by putting word out locally to skaters of all stripes, and help us share this experience with more and more skaters.

The impact of this event on peoples lives and the quality of the attending DJ's, musicians, artists and athletes, positions our festival as a benchmark for skating events.

We are the world's premier skate music festival and we hope to count on your support!

THANK YOU ♡


Together we can make our dreams come true! ♡


Photo by Maga Illustration

story:
Great Poet. Great Composer. 

Great Project. 

 

Short Summary

I am a soprano working in the music field since twenty years. I am dedicated mostly at the XX and XXI Centuries repertoire. During the last years I recorded for iTinerant the new works Cantata Concertante N.3 Phos Hilaron (Joyful Light)  and Symphony N.4 Nezahualcoyotl Icuicahuan (Chants of Nezahualcoyotl) by Mexican-American composer Juan Trigos. I have been invited at Eastman School of Music (Rochester, NY) to premier his most recent new work the String Quartet II, for soprano and string quartet in April 2017. In May of the same year, I will fly to Mexico to record one of his operas Historia de Cabeza (Head's History).

With your help, in 2015 I have been able to produce Juan Trigos' opera DeCachetitoRaspado in Atlanta receiving a mention as one of the five most important new productions in the Atlanta's music scene 2015.

 

Now you have the opportunity to be part of another great, amazing, project! Commission Juan Trigos a new song cycle with texts by Ezra Pound to the renowned Mexican-American composer and realize the world premier recording of this new work for iTinerant. This CD is truly important for my career in this moment because it is my first CD completely produced by myself.

Juan Trigos is one of the greatest living composer, especially for voice. His music is alive and original. In it, every note is part of a perfect structure without loosing the depth of the emotions. His vocal works' catalogue includes works for solo and ensemble, three Cantatas and a Mass for solos and chorus with ensamble and/or orchestra, five operas and a symphony with voice. Is missing just a song cycle for voice and piano!!! 

 

"A Girl" by Ezra Pound

The tree has entered my hands,
The sap has ascended my arms,
The tree has grown in my breast - 
Downward,
The branches grow out of me, like arms.

Tree you are,
Moss you are,
You are violets with wind above them.
A child - so high - you are,
And all this is folly to the world. 

 

Commissioning a song cycle for soprano and piano to Juan Trigos with texts by the famous poet Ezra Pound and publishing a CD including this work, me with this project and you with your support, altogether, we will contribute to promote American Art and enrich contemporary vocal repertoire.  

 

What I Need & What You Get

Your support is extremely important for the realization of this project in order to cover:

  • The commission of a new song cycle $5000
  • Recording costs $5000 (including travel expenses sound engineer and producer, their fees, mastering, cover and booklet design)
  • Soprano and Pianist fees for preparation and 3 days of recording $2000
  • Publicity $2600
  • Indiegogo fees $1,400

 

Why my goal has been fixed at $2,000 dollars if my project needs $16,000? Because to be sure to reach my goal I am using Indiegogo InDemand

It means that if at the deadline of my crowdfunding campaign I reached the goal indicated ($2,000), I will be able to raise money and build my community for as long as will need, no fundraising target, no deadline limits, until I reached my final goal of $16,000. For this reason is extremely important to reach at list the first $2,000 dollars during the first 20 days of this campaign.

WITH INDIEGOGO YOUR DONATIONS ARE

TAX DEDUCTIBLE!!!


To thank your so important collaboration, among the others, I will offer some unique perks like:

  • Download of Cantata Concertante N.3 "Phos Hilaron" by Juan Trigos where I sing a soloist soprano
  • Download of a selection of the greatest hits of the opera DeCachetitoRaspado (orchestral version)
  • Receive the published score signed by the composer, and including also my personalized written special thank

What if I do not reach my entire goal? 

Any project presents risks! If I will not reach my entire goal, I will start it anyway because is really important to me do not loose this opportunity. I will use your funds to commission the new piece and publish its music score with PromoMusica International. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also promote this campaign on your preferred social medias and spread the voice with your friends and family

 

Are you thinking in some publicity for your business in the CD's boocklet*? 

  • $500 full page image or logo
  • $300 half page image or logo
  • $150 a quarter of page image or logo
  • $100 Name of your business on the sponsor's page

(*) Subject to approval, please contact me directly for more information.

story:
THANK YOU! to everyone that has donated to help us capture this dream! We have raised 20% of our goal of $15,000 needed to pay the expenses related to this awesome opportunity. Our hard work, talent, show and songs got us the gig. No buy-ons. no politics. Just four hard-working, hard-rocking girls, doing their very best. That's what got us the gig, and we are so very honored to support Adam Ant, one of the most original superstars in the history of rock and roll. So please help spread the skank! This trip is very expensive, but the exposure is priceless. Everyone that donates will receive special, Glam Skanks Glitter Gear, so check out the perks, and make your donation today. We might not be saving the world, but with your help, we might just save rock and roll. THANKS! from Glam Skanks!

 

  • We are trying to raise $15,000 to pay for travel, rentals, lodging and food.
  • Everyone that contributes will receive special, limited edition Glitter Gear.
  • Whatever we raise from this campaign will go towards the May, 2017 tour.

When a hard working, original band earns genuine respect from critics and crowds, magic happens. Adam Ant could have had any number of bands jumping at the chance to support him, but he personally picked Glam Skanks!

As it turns out, it was a great fit, and Adam's fans accepted us with open ears and eyes wide open. We traveled all over the states, and made many new fans and friends. We have also become friends with Adam Ant's band: Joe, Will, Jola and Andy, as well as the management and crew. We can't wait to see them all again. Adam was super nice to us, and we are so proud to perform on the same stage as an artist of his rock-star stature.

Now for the first time, (and thanks to Adam Ant) Glam Skanks have the opportunity to take our show to an international audience, take our careers to a new level, and our music to the other side of the pond. With your help, we can bring our forward thinking, girl powered glam rock to Great Britain; land of Bowie, T Rex and so many others!

We understand how difficult it is to make a living in the music business. However, this is what we do, what we have always done, what we will always do. This opportunity comes with many new challenges that we embrace with passion, as four very independent, very strong, women. Together we are Glam Skanks...Bad bitches that leave a trail of glitter wherever we go!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, all good! We would appreciate anything you can do to share our social media links with your social media network. Share the glam!

  • Any ideas you have to help make this campaign a success are much appreciated!
  • Indiegogo offers tools to help you spread the word. Check it out!

 

Thank you!

We truly appreciate when people are inspired by what we do. On our recent tour, we met so many girls and young women, all with so much potential and very excited to see a girl band that totally rocks. Thank you for letting us share our dream, and the love of dreaming, as well as the knowledge that anyone, can be anything if they really want it.

Now for the first time, (and thanks to Adam Ant) Glam Skanks have the opportunity to take our show to an international audience, take our careers to a new level, and our music to the other side of the pond. With your help, we can bring our forward thinking, girl powered glam rock to Great Britain; land of Bowie, T Rex and so many others!

We understand how difficult it is to make a living in the music business. However, this is what we do, what we have always done, what we will always do. This opportunity comes with many new challenges that we embrace with passion, as four very independent, very strong, women. Together we are Glam Skanks...Bad bitches that leave a trail of glitter wherever we go!
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, all good! We would appreciate anything you can do to share our social media links with your social media network. Share the glam!

Any ideas you have to help make this campaign a success are much appreciated!
Indiegogo offers tools to help you spread the word. Check it out!

 Thank you!We truly appreciate when people are inspired by what we do. On our recent tour, we met so many girls and young women, all with so much potential and very excited to see a girl band that totally rocks. Thank you for letting us share our dream, and the love of dreaming, as well as the knowledge that anyone, can be anything if they really want it.

story:
"Song's from the Bishop" is a summer celebration of music in Stinson neighbourhoods Bishop's Park. Bishops park is located at the corner of East Ave South and Hunter St East in the heart of Stinson Neighbourhood.

We are looking forward to another great summer of music at Bishop's Park! Our audiences bring a chair or a blanket and enjoy some sounds during warm Thursday nights in the summer. Music will stat at 7:30 each week! The event is free for all visitors or residents of Stinson neighbourhood. 

The Stinson Community Association has been proudly supporting "Songs from the Bishop" in Bishop's Park for 5 years! It is one of our longest running programs and one we'd love to keep running indefinitely.

Songs from the Bishop is a small, intimate setting, local musicians & singer-songwriters play to small audiences of more than 40, with both sides of the stage enjoying the benefits of up-close interaction.

We want to pay our artists what they deserve:

Previous "Songs from the Bishop" events have been run with token payments to performers, borrowed equipment, and time hacked out of already overloaded schedules. But the first place your funding will go to is increasing the amounts we can afford to pay performers and add more more performers if possible. They love playing for us, we want to compensate them for their time, talent and love of performing. 

All funding will be used to fund the 2017 Songs from the Bishop event and any remaining funds will be held in trust at the Stinson Community Association for the 2018 Songs from the Bishop.

We're asking you to help keep Songs going.  Keep our children dancing, and our friends and neighbors having a great way to enjoy a summer evening in the park together. It's one of the Community Association/Planning Team's primary events, and hopefully this year, we can strengthen our outreach to residents in our divided community.

For the many of the residents of our neighbourhood, this is the only time they see live music, and we frequently have folks dancing with walkers or children in the square!

Free means FREE

We want to keep this going. We NEVER want to charge admission. We don't want to make anyone feel unwelcome by putting a price on participating. We need your help.

story:
ThunderCrow-Music

We are  ThunderCrow, a dutch Drum and Didgeridoo music duo.
We are going to record our first album and for this we need your help!
(check out our perks)

We both are playing music for a long time now and we think it's time to combine our musical ideas and create Hybrid World Beats, world music based on analog and digital beats.

Update:  !!!! THUNDERCROW IN THE USA !!!!

 

Update: listen to our first DEMO track here: 

Extra Perk info

You will receive info about our release party tickets into your mailbox after purchasing one of the perks that contains the release party tickets a later stadium. Location is: Altstadt, Eindhoven (NL) 
Date: 12th of February 2017
 

Hoodie or Shirt

We will contact you about your size via e-mail in time. Be patient :-) 
We expect to ship them in February 2017.


The CD

Our CD will contain inovating mixes of Didgeridoo, Drums and Percussion completed with field recordings and other instruments, for example the Ukulele, Jews-Harp and much more.
We are aiming to record our first studio album in November of 2016.

The release of "Drop It" will be in 2017
This album will contain Reggae, Afro, Drum 'n' Bass and much more. You will not be able to sit still when you hear this music. 


Different ways you can help:

You can be a part of this journey by contributing to one of the following steps:

-Buy tickets to our release party in Cafe Altstadt, Eindhoven, NL 
 at the 12th of February  (more info will be sent to your mail after purchasing this perk later)

-buy a CD or any other perk via our IndieGogo campaign

Preview of the signed framed picture: 

                                                                       (61x91 cm)

-Please help us spread the word. Use the indie-gogo 'share' tools above for your facebook and twitter. We need to get the word out and it'll be much easier with your help!!!

-Follow us on Social Media, like facebook, instagram, youtube etc. (/thundercrowmusic)
 Change your profile banner to our Indiegogo support banner:

 

 

Cheers! 

Rob and Daphyd

 

Our Special personalized ThunderCrow Hoodie:

story:
With 45% of our seed money in place form offline sources, your financial support goes directly to helping us hire the talent and studio resources that are needed to realize these compositions.  

Your contributions to this album project are both necessary and valued.  Music can not exist without an audience.  Believe it or not, professional musicians need to be paid to perform!  Recording studios, payroll, insurance, graphics, PR and disc pressing all add up.

Once completed, "The Sacred & Symphonic Works of Christopher M. Allport," will be made available as a retail and digital package in all commercially available music outlets such as Apple Music, iTunes, Amazon and CD Baby.  We will also be seeking feature film placement with music supervisors.

The music that we record will be iconic and defining of the most touching and tender moments of our lives.

The music that I have written, once recorded and distributed will have a profound impact on delivering a powerful message of peace.  We are asking for your help to hire the following artistic professional organizations:

 

Warner Bros. Scoring Stage

http://www.wbsound.com/burbank/facilities/scori...

The Historic Eastwood Scoring Stage was originally built in 1929 and continues to attract the industry’s top talent. 
Our stage features a 96 Channel AMS Neve 88RS-SP mixing console. Additional improvements include a remodeled machine room with 4 Pro Tools workstations (64X80), with Genex conversion available as an option. This exquisite 5,000 square foot stage accommodates full sized orchestras and has been the first choice for countless feature film and television composers.

 

Hollywood Chamber Orchestra

Christopher Allport, composer and Jason Gamer, conductor are honored to partner with Mark Robertson and the world-class Hollywood Chamber Orchestra to record this breathtaking album.

In addition to presenting its own concert series and chamber music series, the Hollywood Chamber Orchestrais available as a professional orchestra for hire. The variety and versatility of our musician roster lends the HCO for any style of performance or show. Our roster can be as small as a soloist or up to a 100+ piece orchestra.

Many of our musicians are veterans of the film and media scoring community, as well as traditional orchestral performance, and are experienced with providing underscore to movie scores and other nontraditional orchestral music.

http://hollywoodchamberorchestra.com

 

Tim Davis Vocals

From 6 seasons on Fox's hit series Glee, to the latest release from Tyler the Creator, Tim's collaborations as studio singer, vocal contractor, and arranger/producer span the music industry in seemingly every direction. In fact, it's hard to escape Davis's musical mark. If you've been to a Disney theme park, played a video game, bought a pop album, seen a tv show, commercial, or film in the last 20 years, it's likely your interest has been piqued by Tim's personal vocal stylings, or his innovative vocal arrangements, delivered by the army of LA's best and brightest vocalists filling his roster.

It isn't easy or inexpensive to put together a recording session of this magnitude.  Through the help of Mark Robertson, Noah Gladstone and Tim Davis we assembled one of the finest orchestras and choirs in the world.  These musicians play on the soundtracks to your favorite films and concertize around the world.

http://www.timdavisvocals.com

 

Current Investors

•Amgen Biotech

•Malibu Friends of Music

•Bruce Allport

•Marjorie Miron

•Christopher M. Allport

•Steve Johnson

•Dr. Steven Grahek

•Dr. Christopher Pearson and Mrs. Kathy Pearson

 

With seed money already in place, your financial support goes directly to helping us hire the talent that is needed to realize these compositions.  Thank you kindly in advance for your support of the arts.

 

ARISE, AWAKE O CHRISTMAS DAY LYRICS - ©2015 - All rights reserved.

Prelude - Chant

Laudamus te.

Benedicimus te.

Adoramus te.

Glorificamus te.

Chilling winter, cold and grey

Holds our blessings on this day.

Inner life and gifts untold,

linger not outside the soul.

Brother, sister, parent, child

Giving us a gift admired. 

Yearning for a human touch,

His Baby’s grasp means so much.

Christ was born to guide your soul.

If you heed His beck and call,

Angelic light won’t let you fall.

Christ has come to us today

Arise, awake: O’ Christmas Day

Sparkling dew, snow and mist

fall like crystal in the drift.

Spreading peace everywhere

His Word of Love ignites the air

Christ surrounds us, meek and mild

Holy spirit, on most high.

Faith in love, Christ abides.

Heavn’ly Father on most high.

Christ was born to guide your soul.

If you heed His beck and call,

Angelic light won’t let you fall.

Christ was born on this day

Arise, awake: O’ Christmas Day

Laudamus te.

Benedicimus te.

Adoramus te.

Glorificamus te.

Gratias agimus tibi propter magnam gloriam tuam.

Christ was born to us this day,

In love so deeply, and we pray.

Tu solus Altissimus, Jesu Christe.

Cum Sancto Spiritu in gloria Dei Patris. Amen.

 

 

 

SONG OF SOLOMON LYRICS - ©2015 - All rights reserved.

Solomon, valiant of Israel!

Naamah, fairest of Egypt!

All ye daughters of Zion,

Gazelles in the fields:

Awake Love!

In its own sweet time.

Proclaim from the mound in Gilead!

Proclaim from the mound in Gilead!

Proclaim this Love for all time!

Your lips sweet like nectar.

You have the eyes of doves.

Your body strong like David,

With your heart we can’t be wrong.

Behold, my fair love.

You ravish my heart with you eyes.

For your love is sweeter than wine.

Leaping on mountains,

Skipping on hills!

Fair is my love, divine.

Proclaim, proclaim!

Proclaim this love for all time!

I float in your shadow.

My banner’s strength is love.

Our house is fir and cedar.

Tender hearts just can’t be wrong.

Behold my fair love!

Stealing my soul with your kiss,

Gone is the rain, let the sun shine.

So rise up my love:

Bold and beloved,

Fair is my love divine.

Proclaim, proclaim!

Proclaim this love for all time!

All ye daughters of Zion:

Behold King Solomon.

Behold Princess Naamah.

Glory be their crown,

With full and tender hearts.

Proclaim, proclaim!

Proclaim this love for all time!

story:
Hi! We're Justify All Means, a hardcore punk band from The Netherlands. At The moment we're recording our first full length called 'Welcome To This World'. This album will include 10 straight to the face tracks to blow your socks off!!
To finish the recordings and get this shit out there with a bang we wanted to get some CD's pressed coming in a nice digipack, some tshirts and a killer music video,, but to do that we need YOUR help!

Help us doing what we love to do so much, so we can keep giving this shit to you!

Show that hardcore support, all that love, make some noise, spread the word! Together we can get this album out there and make our dreams come true...

story:
The Vision

Music was always playing a big part in my life, in many different forms, shapes and sounds. With a background in western classical music, singing in children's choir and then studying at the Music Academy in Tel Aviv, but also with a big love to Rock music from the 70's, and then studying classical Indian music in India and around, one day I found myself in a different and wonderful space. This was the space of the sacred sounds played in a Kundalini Yoga class I went to for the first time. This powerful practice immediately got my attention and supported me in times of transition.

I continued to practice with devotion and started to go deeper and deeper into the sacred sounds,  discovering a creative material within myself that I wasn't aware of before. It was truly liberating. So I've continued to explore and experiment more, composing the Mantras, the sacred and elevating words of the Guru's and Masters.  

The music in this project can be used in your Yoga class, in your own personal practice and even just listening in the car or at work. This project is made to elevate and support your spiritual journey as well as your human experience and everyday life.

What do I Need & What You Get

I'm working on this project for the last two years and now I need your help to finish. The money that I would like to raise will be used for:

  • Final Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Graphics and Art design
  • Cd manufacturing costs
  • Marketing and promotion

Any contribution can help and I'm offering you a mix of perks from all that I do: Music, Astrology, Yoga and Healing. 

 

The impact of Mantras

Mantras are combinations of words that were spoken by spiritual teachers and masters in higher states of consciousness. The purpose of repeating and chanting the mantras is to clear the subconscious and plant new seeds of consciousness.

There are mantras for every mood or need, like mantra for protection, for courage, healing, abundance, mental balance and more.

This is an ancient technology you can find in any spiritual tradition, and it doesn't have to come with a religious connection.  Everyone can chant and you don't need to have a musical background. 

 

 Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't afford to contribute, I'll be grateful for any help spreading the word about this project: Like, share in social media, email, twit or tell your friends and family.

Thank you for your support!

story:
Beers in Hell Fest 2016

For 1 day only, we're bringing together great heavy bands from San Jose, Oakland, Santa Cruz, Sacramento, San Diego, Oceanside, and Jerome Arizona! The band styles vary, but you can expect everyone to riff their way through some heavy duty rock and metal.

Through this pre-sale campaign you can get access to exclusive event merch  that will not be available to buy at the event, and ensure you get in; Johnny V's Bar is not huge, and we intend to pack it full and wrap a line around the corner.

Location: 
Johnny V's Bar: 31 E Santa Clara St, San Jose, CA 95113
21 and over

Date and Time:
Saturday September 24th from 5;00pm until the wheels fall off

Bands:
Blackwülf (Oakland), Zed (San Jose), Crimson Eye (Sacramento), Great Electric Quest (Oceanside), KOOK (San Jose), Mesmer (Oakland), Red Wizard (San Diego), Smoke (Santa Cruz), Supernaut (Santa Cruz), TVSK (Oakland), and War Cloud (Oakland).

Beers:
12-tap takeover with brewery reps (who happen to be music lovers) on site hanging out; we'll pick whatever is fresh and tasty from Ballast Point, Lagunitas, Firestone Walker, and Santa Clara Valley Brewing the week of the event, and Brewmaster Steve Donohue of SCVB will cook up a firkin of Hell Brew just for the fest.

Art:

A big thanks to San Jose artist Pete Krieger (AKA Kriegz) for the awesome art! 


Event Sponsors

This massive, awesome, colossal, super-mega show could only happen thanks to great sponsors, including:

But sponsors alone aren't enough to make sure this event is great, and that we get all these bands (and more) back next year...that's where you come in.

Support the Heavy Underground

We know you love these bands (or will by the end of the event), but why would you buy a presale ticket instead of just picking one up at the door the day of? 

All the great bands we're bringing to play at BHF 2016 are accustomed to grinding the road, battling adversity, and playing for little or no money. Red Wizard guitar player Miles Von Ricketson literally smashed his hand to bits moving amps around mid-tour, and kept going.

The presale money for this event goes directly to the bands. Buying presale and add-on packages ensures that you get in to the event, get access to exclusive merch, and support the bands as they continue to write, record, and tour.


Ticket Presale

We have a variety of presale ticket/merch packages as perks here on indiegogo, in limited quantities. The merch you see here will ONLY be available via Indiegogo...there will be no fest merch available at the show. Tickets will be delivered electronically (or bring your ID the day of the show and we'll keep a list).

Each presale package includes a ticket to the event, and then a variety of merch: posters, t-shirts, beer glasses, merch grab-bags, and other highly limited goodies. 


See the perks for for more detail on pre-sale packages and add-ons. All merch will be available for pick up at the show. If you buy a pre-sale package, and for whatever reason cannot attend the event, never fear...we'll ship you your goodies after the show!

NOTE: any presale packages that include alcohol (beer tickets or the Dark Lord's cellar selections) are vouchers for alcohol that must be picked up in person.

Add-On Perks

We also have add-on perks; add-on perks DO NOT include event tickets. You'll have to do an extra transaction for each perk you add. Check back often...we'll be adding perks over the course of the campaign, but we're starting with these:


Merch Detail

Here's what the pre-sale exclusive shirt will look like (you can expect the same stunning quality from all of the merch):



Not Attending, but Still want to Participate?

We've got you covered; order a merch-only pack and we'll ship it to you after the event...so it will be almost like you were there. Though it will be way better if you're there. You can also buy and gift any package to a friend...just let us know who it's for, and we'll set it up.

Meet the Bands

Want to learn more about the bands playing BHF? Here you go!

Blackwülf (Oakland, CA)

The band – featuring vocalist Alex Cunningham, guitarist Pete Holmes, drummer Dave Pankenier and bassist Scott Peterson – prowls the musical feeding grounds of stoner rock, doom-cloaked soundscapes and vintage heavy metal. Dark sonic forests provide coverage for their unholy mix of parapsychological anger and aggression, and bluesy head-banging riffs.

Website   Music   Facebook

Crimson Eye (Sacramento, CA)

Heavy tunes from 4 dudes from Sacramento. Crimson Eye is Russ Partanen - Low End, Jeff Buxbaum - Rhythms, Rob Dickson - Riffs, Carl Arana - Vocalizations.

Music   Facebook

KOOK (San Jose, CA)

KOOK is from San Jose, the origin of the heaviest of heavy, and they're from the San Jose lineage that birthed bands like Sleep and High on Fire. The music is rich, complicated, hypnotic, dark, spooky, sleazy, powerful, groovy, spooky, campy, blah, blah, blah....HEAVY.

Website   Facebook

Great Electric Quest (Oceanside, CA)

Shredding music in general. stuff you can drink beer and rock out to with some good friends..."The Great Electric Quest impressed the hell out of me standing alone in a scene saturated with either uber droney doom or trendy desert stoner rawk. They don't quite fit in with any cliché sounds and there's no gimmick, just straight up rock n roll full of energy and brimming with meaty grooves." (Bucky Brown, The Ripple Effect)

Music   Facebook

Mesmer (Oakland, CA)

"Peter, Nick, Pope, and Dave are adeptly channeling some vintage rock nuances in these over-the-top tracks. Bursting with chugging Thin Lizzy-esque riffs and no nonsense, straight forward rhythms and drumming. The harmonious dual guitars are something I always enjoy, always appreciate and they are given a full work out on this effort’s sonic contents and while the term “retro” is more than applicable, there’s more than enough modern styling to please listeners as well." (Metal Nexus)

Music   Facebook

Red Wizard (San Diego, CA)

Steeped in the pre-1978 sounds synonymous with Deep Purple, Black Sabbath and Led Zeppelin, Red Wizard have developed a sizable and almost effortless reputation in the Californian underground metal community as a unique and energetic live act. Helped in no small part by last year’s release of their self-titled/STB Records-approved EP Red Wizard, across seven new tracks, easily their heaviest collection to date, Cosmosis explores the depths and majesty of ’70s metal and contemporary stoner rock. Placing huge riffs, blazing vocals and bone shaking rhythms amid a wide expanse of progressive sonic assaults..

Music   Facebook

Smoke (Santa Cruz, CA)

Smoke is a Three piece making loud noises for your heavy memories, featuring Steve Campbell (drums), Jake Griffiths (bass), and Bobby Daly (guitar). Smoke is heavily influenced by Ralph Bakshi, poverty, classic rock, inebriation, heavy blues, boredom, existential crisis, outer space, altered states, and YouTube.

Facebook 

Supernaut (Santa Cruz, CA)

Santa Cruz rock trio Supernaut have emerged from the void to deliver heavy psychedelic fuzz to the masses. Formed in early 2014, the band features Will Lermini on bass, Oliver Niemann on guitar, and Sean Niemann on vocals and drums.

Music   Facebook

TVSK (Oakland, CA)

The brainchild of Justin Dimig and Nick Baumgartner, Tvsk was conceived in January of 2014. Nick and Justin bonded over their love of High on Fire, Sleep, Neurosis, OM, Melvins, and all other things that are metal and heavy, and decided to start writing their own music as a bass and drum duo.

Music   Facebook

War Cloud (Oakland, CA)

War Cloud is Alex Wein (vocals/guitar), Tony Campos (guitar/vocals), Sean Nishi (bass/vocals), and Joaquin Ridgell (drums/vocals). "The Oakland four-piece epitomizes everything that made and makes hard rock great, from the heavy grooves to the excellent musicianship displayed by each member. Their debut EP Hurricane is full of wailing guitars, killer drum fills and enough rockstar cool to fill the stadiums they ought to be playing." (Nicholas Schneider, The Bay Bridged)

Music   Facebook

ZED (San Jose)

The Valley of the Riff is well inhabited and plentiful in its offerings and the beauty of its vast sprawl is that there is room for many. Making their presence well-known with heavy footprints and sonically indelible marks are San Jose-based Earth shakers ZED. A sound based on core principles of the blues, heaviness, groove, and feel this San Francisco Bay Area quartet is the genuine article.

Music   Facebook
story_txt:
Beers in Hell Fest 2016 For 1 day only, we're bringing together great heavy bands from San Jose, Oakland, Santa Cruz, Sacramento, San Diego, Oceanside, and Jerome Arizona! The band styles vary, but you can expect everyone to riff their way through some heavy duty rock and metal.
Through this pre-sale campaign you can get access to exclusive event merch  that will not be available to buy at the event, and ensure you get in; Johnny V's Bar is not huge, and we intend to pack it full and wrap a line around the corner. 
Location: Johnny V's Bar: 31 E Santa Clara St, San Jose, CA 9511321 and over


Date and Time:Saturday September 24th from 5;00pm until the wheels fall off

Bands:Blackwülf (Oakland), Zed (San Jose), Crimson Eye (Sacramento), Great Electric Quest (Oceanside), KOOK (San Jose), Mesmer (Oakland), Red Wizard (San Diego), Smoke (Santa Cruz), Supernaut (Santa Cruz), TVSK (Oakland), and War Cloud (Oakland).


Beers:12-tap takeover with brewery reps (who happen to be music lovers) on site hanging out; we'll pick whatever is fresh and tasty from Ballast Point, Lagunitas, Firestone Walker, and Santa Clara Valley Brewing the week of the event, and Brewmaster Steve Donohue of SCVB will cook up a firkin of Hell Brew just for the fest.

Art:
A big thanks to San Jose artist Pete Krieger (AKA Kriegz) for the awesome art! 


  

Event SponsorsThis massive, awesome, colossal, super-mega show could only happen thanks to great sponsors, including:


But sponsors alone aren't enough to make sure this event is great, and that we get all these bands (and more) back next year...that's where you come in. 
Support the Heavy Underground We know you love these bands (or will by the end of the event), but why would you buy a presale ticket instead of just picking one up at the door the day of? 
All the great bands we're bringing to play at BHF 2016 are accustomed to grinding the road, battling adversity, and playing for little or no money. Red Wizard guitar player Miles Von Ricketson literally smashed his hand to bits moving amps around mid-tour, and kept going.


The presale money for this event goes directly to the bands. Buying presale and add-on packages ensures that you get in to the event, get access to exclusive merch, and support the bands as they continue to write, record, and tour.   
Ticket Presale We have a variety of presale ticket/merch packages as perks here on indiegogo, in limited quantities. The merch you see here will ONLY be available via Indiegogo...there will be no fest merch available at the show. Not Attending, but Still want to Participate?
We've got you covered; order a merch-only pack and we'll ship it to you after the event...so it will be almost like you were there. Though it will be way better if you're there. You can also buy and gift any package to a friend...just let us know who it's for, and we'll set it up.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Mike Glendinning and I am a songwriter from the San Francisco Bay Area. I spent a lot of my time fusing together different types of music. My experiments wound up getting the title "Grunge Jazz" I have experimented into other genres from time to time but when push comes to shove Grunge and Jazz are the two places where I wander back to relearn things.


This campaign will accomplish 4 things for me.

1)  An awesome print of a CD of my new EP "Ugly".

2) Will give this project a fighting chance  to  being promoted the best it can with ads on social media and other kinds of press.

3) Print stickers to put up next to your ex-girlfriend or boyfriends phone numbers in every bar and McDonald's in the San Francisco Bay Area. 

4) Get me back into the recording studio to redo some of the songs. 


The big help I will get with this campaign is advertising. I have enjoyed a decent amount of success running ads on a small scale. In the process I have made new friends. This campaign will help cultivate fans.  


What I Need & What You Get

I need $5,000 for duplication and promotion of the EP. Around $1000 will go to duplication and the rest will go to promoting (Print, social media) and promotional materials (Stickers, T-Shirts).

  • Perks for this campaign will include:
    A children's album that I recorded for my daughter; a copy of my older critically acclaimed album "Random Acts Of Grunge Jazz"  with some bad ass cameo's from Curtis Ohlson (Ray Charles, George Duke, Bob Weir, Pete Escovedo)Brian Collier (Lauryn Hill, Santana, Freddy Clarke) and Mick Mestek (Tower Of Power)
  • If I  don't reach my goal on Indiegogo I will use what money I do raise to get promotional materials.

The Impact

  • I have been working at making my niche in music for a half my life now. Thanks to the internet and a bunch of trial and error I have found a way  of getting outstanding results in exposure. My career could make a nice size leap with the right kind of funding.This campaign is a great opportunity to see what works  for other indie musicians. 

Risks & Challenges

some say the music industry is almost non existent. I don't believe that. With the computer age mutating into a information monster it's not a choice of throwing in the towel but finding ways to get this monster to sit and fetch a ball for us. As for risks, well, I guess this is the really good news because if you think about it with the right decisions things ave very possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute, you can still help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Please use Indiegogo share tools!
  • Tell your friends about my work and join me on the social media sites I hang out on and use to get to know people who like my music.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
More About This Project

Cindy McElroy grew her musical roots on Drummond Island in the Upper Peninsula of Michigan.The singer/songwriter draws from her life experiences and travels around the U.S., Canada, Mexico and Europe. Inspired by icons James Taylor, Carole King, The Beatles, Elvis Costello, and Eva Cassidy her music takes on an acoustic flavor. With the recent additions of Guiseppe Stella (Jerry Lee Lewis, Bobby Gentry, Stax Records) as producer and drummer, Jon Herrmann (Steppin' In It, The Lash, Larry McCray) as engineer and bassist, Ron Bretz on guitar, Michael Mleczko on keys, and many other gifted musicians involved, the current project, "Word Might Get Around", has flourished. Cindy feels they hear her music the same as she does and the sound is fantastic.

The loss of her grandmother in 1987 and her mother in 2006 to Alzheimer's Disease turned her musical focus to the disease. "The Queen of Norway", co-written by friend and author, Rich Hill (A Deckhands Tale), focuses on Cindy's personal experiences related to Alzheimer's. Any funds received above the goal of this campaign will be donated to the Alzheimer's Association. Here is a blog written by Cindy in 2012 about the disease. https://cindymcelroy.wordpress.com/2012/01/21/a...

Cindy is involved in the music scene in Lansing Michigan and feels she owes much to her friends and family who have been supportive over the years. Ultimately, she views the successful completion of this E.P. as instrumental in her desire to give back to those who have helped in her journey.

In order to continue moving forward with the recording, mixing, mastering, artwork, duplication, licensing, and general administrative costs, we need to raise some money. Your help in this regard will allow us to finish this project while maintaining a high quality in recording production.

 

What We Need

We need to pay the following musicians and engineers...

Jon Herrmann (engineer/co-producer/bassist); Guiseppe Stella (producer/drummer); Glenn Brown (mastering engineer); Michael Mleczko (keyboardist); Ron Bretz (guitarist); Jon Gewirtz (saxophone); Shawn Bell (trombone); Micah Ling (cello); and a vocal choir on "Sweep Me Away".

We also need to pay for the use of Troubador Recording Studio, Epiphany Recording Studio, artwork and layout for the CD's, and duplication. Here's a more detailed breakdown...

*other expenses include licensing for the cover songs, registration (listing on CDBaby, iTunes, Spotify, Amazon, and more), etc.

 

What You Get

Please see the Perks for what we'll offer in return for your generosity!

The Impact

This will be our first and only crowdfunding endeavor. We have a business plan in place and if we achieve our goal successfully, we will have the means to put our plans in action. That includes performing in our community, touring, writing more music, and possibly recording again in the future.

We are aware that we may not get all of the money in our goal, but everyone is still on board. We're flexible and have backup plans - we're working musicians, after all! Either way, this E.P. will be released!

Did you know

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, you can still help. Spread the word. Use the 'share' button.

Thanks so much for everything you do!

 

PS. Check the Reverbnation page for a teaser of the E.P.'s opening track, "Perfect Love"!

https://www.reverbnation.com/cindymcelroy

Also, here's a sample from a recent acoustic performance of "Unavailable", another song we're recording for the E.P.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tSaQa7jAZac&amp...

story:
pierre XO //

       aka Pierre Tran. I've had a fascination with creating for as long as I can remember. From when I was 5-years old lip-syncing in front of an old DV camera, to now, spending all of the years in between learning how to do magic, dance, paint, to playing instruments, putting on eye-liner to lastly, music production.

         For the last few years, I have gone through many serious life changes. Through these changes , I am grateful to be alive and that I still have what I have left. What I've realized transformative character-building situations; is art/music is eternal & that I know in my heart that it is my calling to deeply pursue my passion as creating is all that I've ever known.


     Please visit my site to hear & see more//
                         pierreXO.com

What We Need & What You Get

     With your support, I'm able to live out my dream & passion. Making art means the world to me, and anyone who's ever met me knows how important it really is. By funding this current project, I'm able to gather more resources to produce as much quality work as I can. I hope my passion will resonate with you, and inspire you in any way possible. I write, compose, produce and play every instrument on this record.

The 5-songs are currently in demo form, and this is where the funding is going.

  • $1500 - Mixing
  • $500 - Mastering

I'm currently in contact with a french sound engineer by the name of Nicolas Essig, who has done work with Lana Del Rey, Coldplay, Brandon Flowers, and more. I feel that we would be the perfect pairing sonic-ly and I would absolutely love to be able to be mixed by him

The Impact

              This current project as pierre XO is a 5-song compilation that encapsulates all that I've been through; love, heartbreak, joy, anger, escape & adventure. The sound is along the lines of older alternative bands such as the Cure, the Killers, to more contemporary influences such as Crystal Castles, Phantogram & Tame Impala. I am a huge fan of genre-blending and hope that what you'll hear is something new & original. Emotional depth, accessibility, dance-ability and energy are all things I want to combine & showcase.

Every project that I'm involved with I put 120% of myself in, never letting it go unfinished and following through even if that means skipped meals and lost sleep. My past work has resonated with many and I hope to inspire originality, emotional depth, and freedom with this current project.

Risks & Challenges

      I've never liked money in art, and I've always tried to stray far from it as possible. Everything I've done in the past has been for free; from performing at charity events to releasing music videos. However, to create the best work, I would need more time and funds in order to write/record & produce with a growing team. I want to be able to make the best quality work as I can, but it gets extremely difficult with the little finances and little time I have now. I have an innate desire to express myself and connect with people through art & music, and I would love your help and support in making this possible!

     Yet no matter the circumstances, I will always find a way to create regardless. I will always live, eat, & breathe art.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this page or my site (pierreXO.com) on social media!
  • Use the IndieGogo share tools to the right of "back it"
  • Listen to my music!
  • Take me out to lunch! (Tuna gets old after a while)
  • Say hey.

From when I was 5-years old lip-syncing in front of an old DV camera, to now, spending all of the years in between learning how to do magic, dance, paint, to playing instruments, putting on eye-liner to lastly, music production.
         For the last few years, I have gone through many serious life changes. Through these changes , I am grateful to be alive and that I still have what I have left. What I've realized transformative character-building situations; is art/music is eternal & that I know in my heart that it is my calling to deeply pursue my passion as creating is all that I've ever known.
     Please visit my site to hear & see more//                         pierreXO.com

What We Need & What You Get
     With your support, I'm able to live out my dream & passion. Making art means the world to me, and anyone who's ever met me knows how important it really is. By funding this current project, I'm able to gather more resources to produce as much quality work as I can. I hope my passion will resonate with you, and inspire you in any way possible. I write, compose, produce and play every instrument on this record.
The 5-songs are currently in demo form, and this is where the funding is going.

$1500 - Mixing
$500 - Mastering

I'm currently in contact with a french sound engineer by the name of Nicolas Essig, who has done work with Lana Del Rey, Coldplay, Brandon Flowers, and more. I feel that we would be the perfect pairing sonic-ly and I would absolutely love to be able to be mixed by him

The Impact
              This current project as pierre XO is a 5-song compilation that encapsulates all that I've been through; love, heartbreak, joy, anger, escape & adventure. The sound is along the lines of older alternative bands such as the Cure, the Killers, to more contemporary influences such as Crystal Castles, Phantogram & Tame Impala. I am a huge fan of genre-blending and hope that what you'll hear is something new & original. Emotional depth, accessibility, dance-ability and energy are all things I want to combine & showcase.
Every project that I'm involved with I put 120% of myself in, never letting it go unfinished and following through even if that means skipped meals and lost sleep. My past work has resonated with many and I hope to inspire originality, emotional depth, and freedom with this current project.

Risks & Challenges
      I've never liked money in art, and I've always tried to stray far from it as possible. Everything I've done in the past has been for free; from performing at charity events to releasing music videos. However, to create the best work, I would need more time and funds in order to write/record & produce with a growing team. I want to be able to make the best quality work as I can, but it gets extremely difficult with the little finances and little time I have now. I have an innate desire to express myself and connect with people through art & music, and I would love your help and support in making this possible!
     Yet no matter the circumstances, I will always find a way to create regardless. I will always live, eat, & breathe art.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this page or my site (pierreXO.com) on social media!
Use the IndieGogo share tools to the right of "back it"
Listen to my music!
Take me out to lunch! (Tuna gets old after a while)
Say hey.

story:
Why pre-sell the EP through crowdfunding or indiegogo.com? 

Even though we recently got signed with an independent label and major distribution company, there is still a business aspect in writing music, producing an EP, and getting it heard.   If we are to maintain a level of integrity we want in the songs, we'll need to work harder than anyone else.  Unfortunately, funding is just as crucial as passion & hard work.  We've seen quite a number of artists who resorted to crowdfunding and they have been very successful.  Some are even pre-selling their albums at USD $45.00 and they were able to already exceed the amount they needed.  We're hoping for your support on this but we'll make sure we won't be asking for that outrageous amount.


How much & what do you get in return? 

Here's what you get when you pre-order a copy of the EP at reasonable prices:

  • FIRST DIBS!  Receive a digital download copy a day after the official EP launch for USD $6.00.
  • Or have a signed first edition physical copy of the EP "In Transit" delivered anywhere in the Philippines at least a week prior to actual release and before it is available in record stores for USD $8.00.
  • You may also choose to pick up the signed first edition physical copy of the EP during an intimate & exclusive show (in Metro Manila) days prior to the official EP launch for USD $10.00.
  • You may also download a copy of our latest single "Losing Control" for just USD $2.00. 
  • Our heartfelt gratitude.
You may also choose to contribute any amount by clicking on the "BACK IT" button somewhere on this page.  Any amount will be greatly appreciated, and we'll try our best to think of a way to give you something back in return. 


Why help & what happens next?

We have an excel sheet of the expenses and a powerpoint file with 50+ slides but we're not going to discuss that.  Basically by helping out, we: 

  • get to produce the first edition copies of our upcoming EP "In Transit" 
  • save enough money to produce the first batch to be sold in music stores nationwide
  • shoot 2 or 3 more music videos
  • plan a really kickass EP launch for the official release
We won't give you BS.  We also stand to earn a little extra once we hit our final target.  Most probably, the little money we'll earn will be used fund the gear, instruments and equipment we'll need to play.  

Risks & challenges

Now we don't want to over promise anything.  We'll try to give the best music experience we can offer to date but there may be challenges.   

  • Once you've successfully pre-ordered the EP, you will be guaranteed a copy one way or the other (download, shipping or pick-up) but...
  • Release dates are not final yet as we would really need enough funding to finish the project.  As soon as we hit a specific target, we'll be sure to announce updates right away.
  • For those who would want to attend the intimate & exclusive show, this will also be a first for us.  Venue will be chosen based on the majority's preferred location and it will also depend on the number of attendees. There is a chance that it might be done in a residential address (house party setting), or it may be done in a bar, or maybe get creative and do it in a location least expected (warehouse, empty parking lot, etc).  


Other ways you can help

We understand that you might either lack the funds or lack a credit card so:

  • If you lack the funds, that's okay.  We've been there too.  Maybe you can help us out by sharing this page to your friends on social media.  There's a chance some of them might be interested and are able to contribute or pre-order.  Just look for the social media share buttons on this page. 
  • If you lack a credit card, we have great news coz there's PayMaya (https://www.paymaya.com)!  It's an app that let's you have a virtual credit card on your mobile phone.  Free to sign-up and loading your virtual credit card is as simple as loading up a pre-paid cellphone at 7-11, BDO, SM & Robinsons Dept Store, etc (https://paymaya.com/loadup-centers/)     
  • If you are abroad and what to have a physical copy of the EP shipped, you might be the one to shoulder the cost.  Maybe we can talk about it.  Message us on Facebook for details.  

I think we've given all of the details.  That's all there is to it. If you have questions, please send us a direct message on our Facebook page.  :)

story:
Before continuing, take a listen to the campaign video!

My name is Harrison Caldeira and I write music everyday. My dream is to write music for a living. I have written and recorded two albums previously, but this project is driven by my goal of getting onto television and film. I have learned a lot about myself from my previous works but I am ready to take my music to the next level.

While I lived in France, I took the “Mumford and Sons” approach to writing music. I wrote as many songs as I could, then from sixty or so songs, I chose my best six. I recorded these songs at Splintered Wood Records with Cameron Kennedy. We were just two people for one big project, and I can’t thank him enough for the work he did. Through endless re-recordings and re-writes, the final product came to be. With Closer I am aiming to do my first national radio campaign in order to create licensing opportunities for myself, through Tinderbox music.

It’s All About The Music:

Whether it be on national television or at a local show, at the end of the day, all I want is to make and play music that people will enjoy. That’s why this EP is not catered to a particular genre. True to my experience as a musician, it is inspired by elements of all kinds of artists – from Coldplay to John Mayer to Jack Johnson – and I believe that’s what makes it so unique. I hope you enjoy it as much as I have!

Plan and Budget:

On October 11th, Tinderbox Music will send 250 CDs to various college and university radio stations throughout the United States (this works out to approximately $7 USD per send out). With this radio campaign, I will then be able to compile a Hotsheet which generates appeal to television networks. This Hotsheet shows the networks that people are listening to my music. This is good because it means that they are more likely to consider my music for their show. With connections at MTV, Discovery, and Vice, Tinderbox can endorse my music to create opportunities for me with these networks. As a supplement to the radio campaign, on November 14th Auteur research will push my music to various press channels.

Since I have already recorded the EP, I am asking for help with:

Radio Campaign

500 CDs

Auteur Research

Album Artwork

Mastering for Instrumentals

Additional Expenses (video, licensing compensation & digital distribution)

For more information, feel free to contact me or the organizations directly:

http://tinderboxmusic.com/

http://auteurresearch.com/

http://jonnolson.com/

https://www.facebook.com/splinteredwood/

Important Updates:

1) I will release the photo of all my albums being packaged and sent to radio stations

2) I will release a document of the radio stations I have been played at

3) I will release any press that has done coverage on my music

4) I will tweet any radio station who has played my music

5) If any TV stations decide to use my music for their show, I will update you about that

story:
Hi there!

Patrick and Katie are two UAL graduates and filmmakers looking to breathe life into Cult Party's second single release "Kiss (Two)" from the album Eternal Love and the Death of Everything (2016).

Overview

Be it depression, addiction or grievance, there is a constant and underlying desire to express the struggles one goes through in an overall bid to make peace with the world around us. Cult Party’s "Kiss (Two)" will look to communicate the anxiety and frustration that accompanies such inner turmoil through the medium of dance.

The music video follows a support group and its leader, as one by one, individuals anxiously reveal their innermost turmoil and anguish. The protagonist Nina, however, struggles to rally the right words to discuss her feelings of worry and instead abandons language for dance, as her own form of individual expression. From here on, Nina dances and interprets Cult Party's "Kiss (Two)", until herself and the character hit an invisible wall and come crashing back down to reality.

Meet Cult Party

Lo-fi/folk artist, Leo Robinson.

Cult Party is a Manchester-based project born from the mind and heart of Leo Robinson. Beginning in 2011 with a tape recorder and an acute sense of longing, Cult Party has transformed over a period of five years as the recordings and live performances have grown in scale and ambition, manifesting in Leo's latest release Eternal Love and the Death of Everything, an album created in devotion to the complexities and beauty of ecological processes and the births and deaths that they encompass. The songs are bursting with Whitman-esque transcendental ideas, a flowing tapestry of personal folklore and a reverence for the traditional folk music of north America.

Leo is currently working on his visual art as well as a new album, which will be his first vinyl release, and is expected to be available before spring 2017.

facebook.com/cultparty

Stream, purchase and download Cult Party's "Kiss (Two)" and the album Eternal Love and the Death of Everything here.

Or click here, for Cult Party's back catalogue. 

Cult Party "Autumn Sweater Youth", from Eternal Love and the Death of Everything.
 

Meet Nina 

"Kiss (Two)" will star Nina de Raadt in the titular role of "the dancer". Nina is a Dutch model, director, and editor, based in New York. She has worked on a number of short films and music videos and has modeled for DKNY, Zara, and American Eagle.
 

Nina de Raadt

​Method and Approach

As a predominantly Lo-Fi artist it was clear from the outset that a certain aspect of this ideal be employed to visualise “Kiss (Two)”. With this in mind, shooting the music video on 8mm seemed the appropriate choice. And like Super 8, the DIY/Lo-Fi attitude takes its place as part of Cult Party’s overall aesthetic and charm, with a view to capture this through format at the very least. In addition to this, myself and Katie really wanted the chance to experiment with actual film stock because well, you just can't fake film.

Regarding the overall feel and message of the video, we look to capture the anxiety that comes with public speaking, especially in harkening back to those early school days in which speaking aloud in front of your peers would often terrify and disorientate. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our budgetary requirements fall down to two main factors:

  • 8mm Kodak Vision 3 200T Film x4 - £220 
  • Location Hire - £120

In return for your much needed help, you will receive:

  • A free download of Eternal Death and the Death of Everything
  • Demo's and unreleased Music
  • An online preview of the long awaited "July Wide Awake", a short film and documentary following Cult Party's unique method and approach to music
  • Handmade zines
  • One off artwork or drawing by Leo Robinson
  • A private and personal over-the-phone performance

Total: £340

*I understand that the above limit states more, but the minimum for campaign listing is £500, but what we really need is £340. However, we are of course not averse to going over our personal limit. Obviously...

Very straightforward goals. With this, every little helps to either entirely fund the project or to at least reduce the deficit. Hopefully the former!

End Result

The end result lies in promotion of Cult Party, a wonderfully talented artist that will hopefully help forward his career and gain awareness of his otherworldly talents. More than being just a music video, the project will stand alone as a narrative piece, that could be shared through exhibits, screenings and/or Film Festivals. Because, why make a film and not screen it? Apart from anything else, we're doing this because we want to, and we enjoy it. 

Thank you. And Like Tesco, every little helps!


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. So spread the word and share! Let's create a beautiful baby.

Smashing.
